name: SunsplashedSerenity walk to Harvard & Fresh Pond
description:
An elegant, sun-splashed, 2 bedroom (+2offices) apartment with parking, a 15-minute walk or 7-minute bike ride to Harvard (bikes provided). Enjoy this spacious 1st floor unit in a stylish 3-level house, with its gorgeous yard and two bluestone patios, on a quiet leafy street in Huron Village Cambridge. Sleeps 5.

The space
An elegant, sun-splashed, 2+ bedroom apartment, just a 15-minute walk (or 7-minute bike ride, bikes provided!) to Harvard. Enjoy the spacious 1st floor of a 3-level house on a quiet leafy street in Huron Village, (West) Cambridge. Sleeps 5. Bedroom 1: queen bed; Bedroom 2: twin bed; Study: pull-out double sofa bed.

Recently renovated with designer furnishings and attention to detail. Breakfast at the kitchen bay window overlooking the garden. Enjoy the contemporary bath, full dining room, living room with French doors to a study with "instant" office (wi-fi & printer/scanner/copier provided). European cable lighting, hardwood fl
neighborhood_overview:
Huron Village is known for its charm. We have playgrounds, a reservoir, small artisans, a used bookstore, antiques, and two bakery-cafes all within walking distance of Harvard Square. Not to mention the scrumptious take-out, available in several local places. (URL HIDDEN)
(URL HIDDEN)
host_about: I'm a professor at one of the local universities and a long-time Cambridge resident.  I live on the second floor at 64 Granville Road with my daughter.  We enjoy sharing our "Cambridge tips" with all of our visitors: where to ice-skate in winter or rent a canoe in summer, the best local places for cheese, bread, and yummy ethnic take-out treats.  We can lend you bikes and direct you to the Minuteman Bikeway, an 11-mile shady ride through Arlington, Lexington and Bedford, or give you a couple of sleds and show you the hill at Fresh Pond.  Whatever the season, we look forward to welcoming you when you're in Cambridge.

name: Lovely Studio Room: Thu-Mons, Near Universities
description:
Large sunny room which comfortably fits a couple, small family or 3 adults (3rds gets covered foam sleeping mat on floor). Amazing queen mattress, cable TV, fridge, microwave, high-speed wifi, en-suite marble bath with good water pressure & long tub. Quiet, leafy Cambridge neighborhood, moments from city life! Walk, bike or bus to Harvard, less than a mile from us. **Pls note: must like kids, pitter-patter of sweet 2 yr old happens above us sometimes!

The space
We have a peaceful, large, sunny room w/ attached marble bath, a fridge/microwave/toaster oven, high speed wifi and cable TV. We're on a quiet, tree-lined street in a wonderful part of Cambridge, moments walk to Davis Square. The room comfortably fits a couple with one child on a nice foam mat on floor. (We also have a couple of other rooms which may be available when the studio is full @ $85 extra/night). Here's what else you get: self-serve coffee/tea, micro-wave and fridge in room, hair dryer and iron
neighborhood_overview: The neighborhood is quiet and friendly and our street is tree-lined, and known as one of the nicest blocks in what is a great neighborhood. It's far enough away from the main street so you won't hear any noise, yet within moments you can be at the subway or in Davis or Porter Squares. there's a sweet playground nearby, a bike trail extending 19 miles, and many parks. A Whole Foods and Trader Joe's are both within a 15 minute walk.
host_about:
Friendly, smart, politically liberal/progressive, resourceful :) I love hosting people from all over the world, and know the Cambridge/Boston area well (for a native NY'er---I've been here since graduate school which was 20 yrs ago). You will find the environment here 'on the court' restful, peaceful and as my current guest from Australia put it, "I  figured you were a healer of some sort-- because your home feels healing." Our place is relaxing and down to earth, with  an artistic and colorful ambiance, and lots of sunlight.

My boy is pure enjoyment once he feels comfortable with a guest. My dog is one of the sweetest mutts ever (objectively speaking of course)!

If you happen to be taking the bus from NYC, WORLD WIDE BUS leaves you a 10 minute walk from our house.

name: Near Harvard: Safe & Lovely Room
description:
Room next to kitchen and living room in wonderful condo. This room works best for someone who is a good sleeper, although it is v private. Your room is the yellow room with an organic bamboo mattress on floor-- now with a lovely couch. Photos share flavor of the, artistic open space and Mazzy , our pup. Quiet, leafy street close to public transport. Harvard U is within a mile, easily accessible by bike, bus or walking. Tufts is even closer, MIT is a nice bike-ride or short subway ride away.

The space
Quiet peaceful room w/shared marble bath, wifi. Here's what else you get: Use of the kitchen for coffee or tea, good hosts, a great pup to visit, access to the T at Davis or Alewife in a 10 minute walk, 5 minutes walk to the bus on MA Ave, restaurants, shops galore--- all within a 1 minute walk outside of our quiet private court. Oh, and you can easily rent a Hubway bike nearby for a quick ride to Tufts, Lesley University or Harvard Square, (20 minutes to MIT).
neighborhood_overview: Amazing neighborhood: Quiet yet close walk to Davis Square, Porter Square, Alewife train station. Nice 25 minute walk to Harvard Square. Many local bars, restaurants, music venues. Great parks, tennis courts, bike-path, all right at your fingertips! Trader Joe's and Whole Foods within walking distance.
host_about:

name: B & B near Harvard's Quad Houses
description:
Your choice (depending on availability) of one of two comfortable guest rooms in quiet, tree-filled neighborhood, just 7 minute walk to RedLine Porter Square, 5 minutes to north side of Harvard campus, Harvard Smithsonian Center for Astrophysics. WiFi, AC, flat screen cable TV, parking. The two guest rooms share the guest bathroom, with two other bathrooms in the house.

The space
Comfortable, convenient B&B at the north end of the Harvard campus, in quiet, residential neighborhood, near the Harvard Smithsonian Center for Astrophysics, 4 blocks from Porter Square on Red Line T. Wi-fi, breakfast, AC in summer. Dozens of restaurants, stores all within 6-15 minute walk. Choose between either the king or queen sized bedrooms.

Guest access
Your room has television, a sitting area with sofa and tables, WiFi. Breakfast is served in the first floor dining room. Guests also enjoy the front and back terrace gardens. Although there are no kitchen p
neighborhood_overview: We're in a beautiful neighborhood, with nearby streets on the National Register for perfectly restored Victorian houses. Houses have gardens, big trees. Wildlife and birds abound, yet we're less than 10 minutes walk to dozens of restaurants along bustling Mass Ave, with public transportation, Harvard and Lesley.
host_about: I’ve recently retired from a dozen years as marketing director for the nearby Harvard Museum of Natural History.  My husband John and I are both Harvard grads, appointed years ago to cochair an alumni reunions committee. We enjoy meeting people from all over the world, and sharing our interests in natural history, sailing, books, photography. and sharing our love of Harvard, Cambridge and Boston with visitors. I've travelled widely in my previous work for an international nonprofit, visiting remote corners of the world ranging from Timbuktu, to Yemen, to the kingdom of Tonga and Australia's Kakadu National Park.

name: Riverbend Bed and Breakfast
description:
Private bedroom, host provides simple breakfast, easy access to Harvard Square.

The space
A guest room with twin beds and private bath in a first floor two family home. I've moved four blocks from my old Riverbend Bed and Breakfast, and have lost the spectacular view, but am still near the bend in the Charles River. A great location for jogging along the river and a fifteen minute walk to Harvard Square or three minute bus ride. Perfect for a guest visiting Harvard University for a few days but also for those who want to take the "T" to Boston. The room is best for one guest, but a second one can be accommodated

Guest access
Simple breakfast with host

description:
You can't beat this location. It applies to all my properties in Cambridge. We choose walking shoes locations. 25 minutes from Logan Airport, excellent location to South Station, MIT, Central, Longwood hospitals, Brookline, Watertown. My apartments are located in Harvard Square. We hope you stay with us.

This apartment is not shared, no flat mates. It will be all your spa

host_about: Traveler with a passion for real estate. I enjoy interior decoration and I also enjoy welcoming guests from all around. I am known to be a friendly host. These days I do not get to meet most of my guest but I try my best to meet them. Bring your positive energy and please be our guest.

name: Cambridge Getaway @ Harvard & MIT
description:
Charming 2-bedroom apartment on the third floor of our beautiful Victorian home.

The space
This is a charming furnished 2 bedroom apartment with a full bathroom, large eat in kitchen, and a living room. It is on the top floor of a well kept Victorian home. It has a small roof deck where you can enjoy your morning coffee or a glass of wine in the evening. The apartment is located within walking distance of MIT and Harvard. Central and Inman Square are less than 5 minutes away. You can walk to fine dining in Inman square where you will find an eclectic mix of restaurants. Downtown Boston is only a 10 minute train ride away. There you will find shopping areas, world-class hospitals, the convention center, and various museums. Our location is truly in Mid-Cambridge. There is a Whole Foods market and a number of cafes just down the street. Rates are subject to change during the busy season Boston Marathon, local graduations, reunions and the Regatta. The apartment is
neighborhood_overview: Annmarie and I have lived in this area for over 50 years. We both live on the first floor of this house and know where people want to go. We can suggest the best restaurants and attractions in the neighborhood.
host_about: Annmarie and I were both born here in Cambridge. We have lived in the same location our entire lives. It is a wonderful area for visiting the city..We started with Airbnb for 4 years now and it has been a wonderfull experience. Many people have stayed here from all over the world.. Marathons, Graduations, Reunions and Family get togethers. We are surrounded by Great restaurant's and cafe's.. We are 5 minutes to bus lines and the Redline. You can walk to Harvard or MIT in 10-15 minutes Walkability has a 95% rating. We also have free parking.

name: "The Treehouse" :  Elegant living near Harvard
description:
An elegant, contemporary, top-floor unit in the quiet, green, Huron Village area of Cambridge, with its boutiques, restaurants, galleries, grocer, antique shop, & a used bookstore. Walk to Harvard Square, the Charles River, & Fresh Pond. The large backyard hosts 2 patios, a double hammock, lounge chairs, & a croquet lawn. Close to the Minuteman Bike Trail & Route 2. Short-term guests from 5/15 -8/31; starting 9/1, long-term guests only (3 months or more).

The space
This stylish, contemporary, architect-designed, skylit, tree-top, compact (+/- 700 sq. ft.) apartment can sleep 4: 2 in queen bed + 2 on fold-out floor mattresses in either the 2nd bedroom (which is set up as an office) or the living room alcove. Enjoy the lovely shady patio (with wi-fi), lounge in the quiet backyard in the double hammock. Stroll to Fresh Pond & Harvard Square in quiet, leafy Huron Village after breakfast at Hi-Rise Bakery. A perfect Cambridge experience!

A beautiful

name: A+ Clean & Safe 1Br @ MIT, Kendall, Back Bay
description:
Serene and superb daily escape from the high energy of Boston and Cambridge. This apartment is comfortable for two and is centrally located on a one way street between two one way streets. Near Central Square, walk to MIT, Harvard and Back Bay. The bus stops 3/4 of a block away. Experienced travelers only as this is a self-catered apartment.
Please see our reviews.

The space
Private, self-catering, serene bedroom, full-size kitchen, full bath, sitting room/office, w/d in the unit.
As an experienced and frequent solo traveler, I also appreciate a clean, safe, and economical option for lodging.

Internet, Wifi for your portable apps.
Great natural light.

Very easy access to public transportation. Buses are about 1 - 4 blocks nearby. The T (subway), Red Line, Central Square stop is 6 blocks. Close to MIT, BU, Harvard, Back Bay, Fenway, The Charles River, Somerville, Historic Boston, or the Waterfront.

This f
neighborhood_overview:
Awesome location, one-way street between two one-way streets makes this gem surprisingly quiet for an urban environment. Close to Live Entertainment, Charles River, Back Bay, Fenway, Central Square Theatre, dance, yoga, healthy food, boutique cafe's and shopping.

A safe, culturally diverse, historic neighborhood of graduate students, young professional families, and a booming bio-tech industry.

The location is just a few blocks to Central Square, Mass Ave. great food and entertainment. While the apartment can be quite serene and restorative, it is centrally located and convenient to any of the hot spots in Cambridge or Boston.
host_about: Background in travel and health care. Currently working in publishing and production.

name: Two-room suite near Harvard Univ. with parking
description:
Lovely, private suite with bedroom and study, kitchenette, bathroom and access to back porch in a quiet, yet centrally located neighborhood. Family friendly. We provide a crib and high chair for a baby, when needed.

Our suite is registered and licensed under the rules and regulations for Short-Term Rentals of the City of Cambridge. Registration No: STR-12140

The space
Private suite (bedroom and study, with kitchenette and bath) with separate entrance in beautiful and quiet Cambridge Agassiz neighborhood. From our house, you can walk in ten minutes to Harvard Square, the MBTA subway line, Harvard Yard, and Lesley University. The Harvard Law School, School of Engineering, and Divinity School are 5 minutes away. A full service supermarket is just around the corner.

The recently renovated rooms (with hard wood floors) are on the first floor of a Victorian single family house; we live above.
The suite is equipped with:
- wireless inte
neighborhood_overview: Our neighborhood is both well connected to Harvard university and all kinds of sources of entertainment. At the same time, it is quiet, family-oriented, and very safe. In addition, parking, a problem in some parts of Cambridge close to campus, is very easy on our street. We provide a visitor permit valid in our area..
host_about: We live in a comfortable Victorian House in a quiet neighborhood in the heart of Cambridge, very close to the Harvard campus. I am a Professor of French and my husband a retired university administrator. We have lived here for decades, but we maintain strong ties to Europe, where our grown daughters live and where we go often to spend time with our families. Bernd's family lives in the Rhine region of Germany and Nadine's in Provence. We love to welcome guests from around the world to our great city.

name: Apartment in Harvard's Backyard
description:
The space
Gorgeous apartment in the ideal Cambridge location! It's a spacious and well-laid out one-bedroom - perfect for a couple. It has a nice size living room with incredible sunlight. It's in the tallest building on our street, so from the couch, we see treetops out of all four living room windows! The bedroom has a Queen-size bed, an enormous closet, AC, and 2 windows. Even the bathroom gets sunlight so bright that you feel like you're showering outside! The kitchen is awesome - marble countertops, dishwasher, etc. There are also hardwood floors throughout (minus kitchen and bathroom). There's laundry and bike storage in the basement and a shared yard to boot!

Because we often get asked: we have a Queen-size bed in the bedroom, which is perfect for a couple. When one bed is not enough, we host guests in the living room on our very comfortable West Elm couch, and on our top-of-the-line full size air mattress.

We're smack between Harvard and Ce
host_about: We are professionals living in Cambridge, MA.  Nicole is from New (Website hidden by Airbnb) is from Haifa.  We love travelling and we've stayed in airbnbs all over the world!

name: East Cambridge Apartment
description:
Our four bedroom home is tucked away in a wonderful neighborhood in East Cambridge. Walk to great neighborhood restaurants and enjoy day trips to Boston with easy access to bus and train lines. Enjoy the backyard and charm of Cambridge.

The space
Location, location, location! It is conveniently located a mile from Harvard Square, steps away from MIT, and a ten minute walk to Charles River and multiple T stops to travel to Boston. This is an 1854 home that has been entirely renovated on the first floor and basement level. Apartment has driveway, a backyard, an updated kitchen, 1 king bed in one bedroom, 2 twins in the bedroom and a bunk bed in the third (2 twins) and a single in the fourth. The apartment is located in Kendall Square and a short walk to many bars and restaurants. Apartment has high ceilings, washer/dryer in kitchen, flat screen tv, and feels far bigger than 2200 sq. feet.

Guest access
No keys involved, you will receive
neighborhood_overview: Neighborhood is tucked away behind MIT and Kendall Square.  East Cambridge still has a strong Portuguese population that is apparent with grape vines surrounding our yard.  Our oldest son goes to school down the street and we love the community and our neighborhood.
host_about:
My wife and I are teachers north of Boston and have 4 children.  We enjoy traveling, being active, and spending time in Cape Cod and Lake Ontario.
  
As a family we enjoy seeing different places and experiencing different cultures.  We love the concept of airbnb and the idea of communal living.  As a young family we love the idea of living somewhere else and having the flexibility/comforts of a kitchen and bedrooms. 

Rocco is 7 years old and he loves Ancient Egypt and karate.  Theo is 4 and he enjoys cars and diggers.   Colton is also 4 and he enjoys sleeping and baseball.  Adeline is 2 and loves her mom.

name: Elegant Airy Comfort. Workspace. Private Entrance.
description:
Semester rentals available, discounted by 30%.
Wonderfully located, spacious, steam-cleaned & disinfected, the apartment is the second floor of an 1890's two-family home with high ceilings and big windows. There are three bedrooms, a separate study with a desk and bed, and two bathrooms. The convenient neighborhood offers something interesting for everyone to do, one parking space is included. If you don't need all three bedrooms please let us know: we may be able to adjust the price.

The space
We've attended to the details that will make your stay supremely comfortable. The sheets are ironed, there are toys and supplies for children, the toiletries are lovely, the towels are large and plush, and the Welcome Basket is stocked with deliciousness. This is a great place for a family or a group of friends!

The Location
You can be on the Boston Common and Freedom Trail in Downtown Boston, or at Shannon Beach on Mystic Lake, in under 15 minutes.
neighborhood_overview:
Please remember that the AirBnB "pins" do not show you exact listing locations. We are a three minute walk to Davis Square and the subway in one direction, and also a three minute walk to the grocery store and bus on Mass Ave in the other direction.
Our location offers very easy access to Harvard, Tufts, Cambridge, Arlington and Boston. There are children's playgrounds within a short walk, and a public beach within a short drive. Davis Square, right at the next corner, is a destination in itself.
Here's a portion of an article from the Boston Globe about Davis Square:

Somerville crossroads lives up to its hip image

“We’ve come from a foreign land called suburbia,” a mother joked to her two highly energized toddlers as they darted about on the busy sidewalks of Davis Square. On a sunny Saturday afternoon, urban bohemians and families alike swarmed into this hipster beehive to purge their cabin fever.

Sandwiched between Tufts University and Nor
host_about:
Richard is an artist. I worked as a residential designer/builder for years, and now I write about it. I also consult with non-profit organizations about strategic planning,
We love to travel as well, and also have a home on Prince Edward Island in Canada.  Where-ever we go, I like to cook and dance.

name: Quiet, Artistically Decorated Cambridge Apartment
description:
The space
Starting at $200 a Night for up to four Guests

Our quiet apartment is located on one of the more beautiful tree lined residential streets in No. Cambridge. It’s a 1/3 mile walk to both the Davis Square and Alewife T Stations and two blocks from the bus into Harvard Square, allowing easy access to Cambridge and Boston.
- Totally renovated in 2011.
-In bedroom there is a queen sized bed.
-Livingroom has an American Leather (www.americanleather.com) sleeper sofa with a Tempur-Pedic Gel queen size mattress. Hands down the most comfortable sleeper sofa on the market! There is a light blocking curtain separating the living room and kitchen for privacy if sleeping in the living room.
- Very large kitchen equipped with a gas stove, refrigerator, dishwasher, microwave, coffee maker, toaster, hot water kettle, plates, glasses, utensils, pots, and pans. Tea, coffee and other treats are provided. Large refrigerator/freezer can be plugge
neighborhood_overview: Our street is a beautiful quiet tree lined street that does not get a lot of car traffic since it is not a through street from major roads.  There are several parks close by- a large one that is great for jogging, soccer, softball, track and smaller ones that with newly renovated playground equipment and water features for hot days.
host_about: My husband and I bought this house 25 years ago and have renovated almost every square inch of over the 25 year period.  We have two daughters who have graduated college (Colorado College & Princeton) and we have a 20-year-old son who is a sophomore at Harvard.  We all love cycling, rowing, baseball, the red sox and being with friends and family.

name: See Yourself in Central Square
description:
The space
Welcome to our Central Square Apartment, right in the heart of downtown Cambridge! Steps away from the Red Line, we are located right in between Harvard and MIT!

Our Second Floor walk up is a studio apartment with King sized bed, full sized futon couch and sun filled atrium complete with hammock. It has a full bath and a well stocked kitchen. A former seamstress's shop in the seventies, it has floor to ceiling mirrors that gives the space an even larger feel. It still retains some of that funky seventies charm.

Though right in the heart of downtown Cambridge, the apartment is set back from the street so it is surprisingly quiet. An oasis from the city sounds, the apartment shares the 4 story building with office space so evenings are very quiet and private. The Green Street parking garage is located across the street and charges $13 a day. Pearl Street laundromat is two blocks away.

Central Square is the hub of Cambridge. Ri
host_about:
I spent most of my adult life traveling around the globe from my home base in Portland,Oregon... sometimes staying in people's house, sometimes just a hammock between two trees.  I am currently indoctrinating my son to like these things so we can hit the road when he gets a wee bit older.  My last trip was across India by bicycle.  Good fun if you get the chance!

Since I've been in Cambridge, I've learned things that would be not possible while traveling, learning the guitar, making beer, perfecting my jerk chicken burritos...and I've grown to love this town...lively music scene, and the biking is getting better and better!

name: Home on quiet street near Harvard
description:
The space
Second-floor room adjacent to bathroom and kitchen shared with owner.
Walk up one flight from porch.
Fifteen-minute walk to Harvard Square.
Ten-minute walk to Harvard Yard.
Five-minute walk to Harvard Law School.

Room contains double bed, closet, desk, Wireless access, and basic TV.
Linens provided ( sheets, bath towels, hand towels, etc.)
In cold weather, guests have access to the thermostat and also small plug-in heater/fan.
Room has AC installed in window during summer.
Movable fans for other rooms.
Simple breakfast supplies available in kitchen (coffee/tea, milk, juice, cereal, bagels, fruit, eggs).


Laundromat and cafe on corner of street.
Owner has no pets, but tenant in separate apartment on first floor has two cats.

Guest access
Kitchen use for other meals negotiable.
Resident parking pass available.
Access to yard with garden and deck.
host_about:
I have lived in my house in Cambridge for more than forty years, during which I have shared the space with family and first-floor tenants. Though my children are grown, I love my neighborhood and appreciate the sense of community.  I know well the advantages of this location, and I always enjoy connecting people with historic and cultural resources. In keeping with these enthusiasms, I volunteer as a guide at deCordova Sculpture Park and Museum in Lincoln and participate in projects at a community art center near my house.  I post about art in the Boston area on a blog called ART OUTDOORS. 
 (Website hidden by Airbnb) 

Currently a freelance writer and editor of educational materials, I keep a home office but still have one guest room that is not used often enough.  I think the room would prove to be a comfortable base for someone attending a conference or exploring the Boston area.

- Enjoy the comfort & convenience of my cozy 1 bedroom, on a quiet street in Mid Cambridge. With lots of light, hardwood floors, french doors, a beautiful kitchen & 2 decks. Minutes to Harvard, MIT & public transportation.

The space
Fully furnished, lots of windows and hardwood floors throughout, lovely front and back porches, landscaped garden & patio. 700 sq. ft. includes living room with study area & pull out sofa bed, bedroom with queen sized bed, window air conditioners, large closets and bathroom with tub. neighborhood_overview: Mid- Cambridge is a beautiful neighborhood of Victorian houses and tree lined streets.   Convenient to everything - half way btween Harvard & Central Sqs. Enjoy excellent dining, entertainment, site seeing & seasonal events. Everything you need is near by including grocery stores, library, post office, drug stores, cafes, banks, hubway bikes, Charles River.
host_about: Hi, I am Melissa. I grew up in historic Lexington Mass and studied Art History and Art Education. I make sculpture out of recycled computer parts out of a Maker Space called the Artisan's Asylum in Somerville and teach people of all ages. I put my heart and soul into renovating my condo and turned it into the dream home I always wanted! I love the back porch and back yard. It is the most relaxing place to hang out on a hot summer day! I rent to Harvard and MIT affiliates. Many international scholars have stayed in my condo.  Come visit MA. I live around the block and would be happy to give suggestions of what to see and do on your visit!

It's bright with two windows and is on the first floor of a stately, well-maintained three story house, built circa 1920, on a quiet, tree-lined street. Parking may be available. The room is in our sunny, clean three-bedroom condominium with one bathroom (shared) and a private yard. It's air-conditioned and has a queen size bed with cotton sheets and a fluffy down comforter. neighborhood_overview: Quiet residential neighborhood with quick access to pubic transportation, cafes, restaurants, retail shops, entertainment, parks, Hubway bike rental, and walking and biking trails, local grocery stores, Whole Foods, Trader Joes, H Mart.

neighborhood_overview: We're located in a fantastic neighborhood, right in the vibrant Harvard Square in Cambridge, MA!
host_about:
Welcome to The Cambridge Karma House!

¡Bienvenidos a La Casa de Karma!

We wanted a name that embodies our feelings and philosophy around hosting, and essentially it is about karma- the notion that our actions and intentions will come back to us and influence our future, whether they be positive or negative. Karma is similar to the golden rule of “treat others the way you want to be treated." We believe that this is a good way to go through the world and attempt to always practice this with our guests. We will try to always treat you with loving kindness and respect, and we expect the same from our guests--that they treat the folks running the house, other guests in the house, and the space itself, with respect and kindness.

This Victorian house built in the 1880s and still has many of the quirks from that era. Around 30 years ago our family bought the property, and in 2013 we started managing and renovating its 6 apartments and established the Cambridge Karma House LLC!

We enjoy hosting our guests & we look forward to meeting you! Please let us know if you need anything or have questions.

We try to always be friendly and caring to our guests so please do let us know if there's anything we can do to make your stay more comfortable.

CHECK-IN=any time after 3pm*

CHECK-OUT=12 noon or earlier*

*if you need to check in before 3pm or check out after 12 noon, please let us know and we will *try* to accommodate you (you MUST receive a confirmation that this is okay). If we’re not able to accommodate you with an early check-in or late check-out time, we are almost always able to offer our guests the ability to store their luggage in the basement during non-apartment-stay hours.

---> The details of our check-in and check-out procedures are *automatically* emailed to confirmed guests by airbnb through our “House Manual”; the House Manual covers a variety of topics but we ask that you ****privilege what is written here**** regarding parking, plumbing, tidiness + cleanliness, and waste disposal (we are in the process of updating the House Manuals on all of our listings but sometimes our systems, etc. change this places is the quickest go-to place to relay/outline what we need our guests to know and/or do). 

IMPORTANT NOTES (parking, plumbing, tidiness + cleanliness, and waste disposal)*:

*Please privilege guest expectations and procedures written here over those received in the "House Manual”

**************PARKING**************:

We canNOT offer parking to most of our guests. We have 1 visitors parking pass for 6 units (maximum 3 days in a row in the zone indicated behind the pass (to be placed on the dashboard) & the vehicle must be moved every 24 hours); if you want the pass YOU MUST ASK us *****AND**** receive a message confirming that, indeed, you may use it (it is in high demand and often unavailable).

Due to the limited availability of parking in Cambridge (both through the house and in Cambridge overall), we suggest you not bring a car.

**************PLUMBING**************

While there are many fantastic and charming features of the old Victorian house, the old pipes are not one of them! Therefore:

YOU ***MUST*** USE THE HAIR AND FOOD CATCHERS IN ALL OF THE DRAINS. Indeed, WATER (/polarity bonded liquids (no oil)) IS THE ONLY THING THAT CAN GO DOWN THE SINKS AND TUB. Not doing so will clog up the pipes; if we need to call the plumber we may keep part, all of your security deposit to remedy the situation.

**************TIDINESS & CLEANLINESS of Your Living Space When Checking Out**************

There is a short window period between checking-in and checking-out and oftentimes we are booked back to back with multiple apartments to prepare. If your apartment takes more than about an hour to clean it is likely we will draw from your deposit for this extra service of your apartment requiring a deep cleaning after you check out. Crumbs and food all over the tables and counters (or food in the trash; see below under "Compost"!), spilled products on the bathroom sink, this is not what we expect to encounter to turn around the apartment to the next guest. The apartments are large and wiping all the surfaces down, cleaning the floors and changing the bedding and towels in the most basic way usually takes about an hour. In a way we're trying to clean invisible things (germs, finger prints, dust, etc.) form one guest to the next; when we clean and prepare apartments we do not expect to have to pick-up-after-you.

A my j**************WASTE DISPOSAL: COMPOSTING + RECYCLING + TRASH************** :

Our Earth is under seriously strained circumstances in terms of how much toxic matter humans are exposing it to, and as such, we take waste production seriously. The best sustainable practice mantra is (in this order): reduce, reuse, recycle.

GUESTS STAYING UNDER ONE WEEK:

Please leave your trash, recyclables and compost INSIDE of the apartment and KINDLY DO NOT take it outside. If you need to take it out for some reason, please see the “where" section for each type of waste.

GUESTS STAYING OVER ONE WEEK:

Take your trash, recyclables and compost to the 19 side of the house and put them IN THE PROPER BINS (if you are unable to do so for medical reasons, please let us know and we will gladly do this for you!). The trash and recycling is collected at around 7am Wednesday morning (one day later on weeks where there are national holidays);

********TRASH********

WHAT? anything that is NOT compostable (food) or recyclable (paper, glass, aluminum, plastic). Examples: styrofoam, dirt and hair (though these last 2 can put in the garden)….most (clean) materials can be recycled! :-)

WHERE? Indoors: in the bin marked “Trash.” Outdoors: in the BLACK OR GREY bins (these are smaller than the recycling bins).

HOW? In TIGHTLY SEALED PLASTIC BAGS. You CANNOT leave the bags unsealed (this disrespects the folks collecting the trash by risking waste falling out while disposing of it) and/or the City will reject the bin likely fine us (and we will have no qualms about passing this on to you (by withholding your security deposit).

********RECYCLING********

WHAT?

Paper (example: receipts, newspaper, tissues, cereal boxes)

Glass (for example:bottles),

Aluminum (for example:cans)

Hard Plastics (for example: your clean (see below) yoghurt containers, to-go food containers, etc.….*****You must KEEP SOFT PLASTICS (for example: plastic bags) SEPARATE from other recyclable materials*****; these clog the recycling sorting machine. We put these together outside (either in a small bin by the compost wheel and/or in a large bag full of soft plastics (mostly bags)!

** VERY IMPORTANT NOTE: all materials MUST BE CLEAN. This means that you have to rinse out you milk cartons, clean out containers containing food (put excess food in the compost (**NEVER down the sink drain**; see “Plumbing”).

WHERE?

Indoors: in the bin marked “Recycling.”

Outdoors: in the LARGE NAVY BLUE BINS (everything goes in there EXCEPT for your soft plastics (for example: plastic bags); put these in the small container by the compost wheel or in a large plastic bag full of soft plastics).

vHOW?

WI
********COMPOST********

I N sA Isis WHAT?

IAll of your food scraps (for example: fruits peels, tea bags, coffee grinds, vegetable scraps, etc.) EXCEPT for meat and dairy (egg shells are fine!). What do do with these food caught in the kitchen sink? Throw it in the zip lock bag in the freezer :)

 usKWHERE w the best I?

Z
Please let us know if you have any questions!

Thanks!awi mznocwn Abi

name: MIT/Harvard/Inman- 2 Bedroom Apt.
description:
First floor apartment located in our 2 family home. Located in vibrant and hip Inman Square. I live in a separate apartment upstairs with my husband and 2 children.

City of Cambridge Inspected and Licensed as a LEGAL short term rental apartment.

Registration No. STR-14611 with the City of Cambridge,MA

The space
2 bedroom Apartment on the first floor of a 2 unit home. Centrally located in vibrant Inman Square. 15 min walking distance to Harvard Sq, 10 min walk to Central Square and the Red Line T. If you have a car we can provide 1 visitors pass for short term on street parking in the area ( please let me know ahead of time if you will be needing it).. This is a perfect location for visiting Harvard University, MIT or Boston.. 26 fabulous restaurants, cafes and coffee shops just around the corner or use the 2 groceries stores within a 10 minute walk. You also can have groceries delivered from Instacart from a number of local retailers. You
neighborhood_overview: What is not to love about Inman Square!! Tons of Restaurants and still maintaining a neighborhood feel. There are 2 WholeFoods Markets within a 10 minute walk.
host_about:
I am a married work from home mom to two amazing children and Airbnb host. I was the Chef/Owner of two award winning restaurants in Boston prior to having children. My husband Chad is a Communications Consultant. 

 Cambridge has been our home for over 15 years and is an amazing place to live and raise a family.

name: Beautiful Light-Filled Bedroom/Best Location
description:
Come stay in one of the most elegant and centrally located condos in Cambridge. I am located between Harvard and Porter Square, 5 minutes walk from the Harvard Law School and just 10 minutes walk from Harvard Square.

The space
Please note the door to this room does have a lock; the bathroom is shared.

This study holds an extremely comfortable sofa bed, a desk, and an antique dresser for your use, and looks out on an exclusive garden and patio. The high end sofa bed is a Twilight Sleeper Sofa from Design Within Reach and expands into a twin size Single Bed: H 17" W 79" D 34.75" (please note that in the photos the sofa bed is not expanded).

The room is long and narrow, approximately 16.5 x 5.5 feet. It's the perfect space for a visiting scholar or someone coming to visit Boston who wants to work and tour. The room has three East and one South facing windows, and gets natural light the entire day. The room and house are extremely quiet, s
neighborhood_overview: Porter Square is the gastro pub center of Cambridge, in addition to having some amazing cafes and bakeries.
host_about: I'm a classical musician.  I grew up in Boston and went to school here in Cambridge.  I enjoy hosting guests, and am looking forward to meeting people from all parts of the world on Airbnb.  Thanks!

name: Quiet private room in N. Cambridge
description:
Quiet room w/ futon and couch, desk, and closet.

Bus to Harvard Square leaves just around the corner. It's about a 10 to 14 minute ride depending on the time of day, and there is a subway connection there.
There is also a subway stop about a 13 minute walk from my place.

I have a lot of hosting experience and can provide good tips depending on an individual's interests.

The space
Futon is comfortable, there are hangers in closet to hang up some clothes. Bathroom is just outside room in hallway.

Guest access
Assess to kitchen and dining room as well as back and front porch.

Please check with me about check-in times and check out times as they can vary from day to day. I never rush guests out in the morning who have stayed with me the previous night. Check-ins can't happen until my current guest(s) have left.

There are occasions when guests can leave some luggage on the day they are checking o
neighborhood_overview: This was the working class neighborhood of Cambridge, the area where former speaker of the house, Tip O'Neil, grew up. A lot of condos have gone up in the neighborhood. It's an area that borders Arlington and Somerville, and Belmont and Watertown are also very close.
host_about: Worked in music industry for over 20 years. Passionate about music including music from many different areas of the world. I'm also an avid biker. Very helpful assisting travelers as I've hosted many from around the world. Enjoy meeting people and having conversations on a number of different topics. I've traveled extensively on a budget and am very resourceful helping others who may have a limited budget find things to do that they can afford.

name: Large Downstairs Room
description:
If you are bringing a car you must let us know in your first message.

The space
** Please note there has been some confusion lately regarding our exact address. Map programs may attempt to auto-fill our Cambridge street address and may try take you to a similar street in Somerville. Guests are advised to double check our address when using Map programs, Uber, Lyft or other means to locate us. Thanks! **

Please also be aware that the house you are booking is an old house. It has not been recently remodeled and it will be considered by most people to be 'messy'.

All guests can expect a freshly vacuumed room with clean linens and towels, but the living areas outside of your room will not necessarily be 'spic-and-span' and so if this is something that would bother you then please inquire elsewhere.

We are located in the middle of Cambridge, 3 blocks from the Red Line Subway Stop at Central Square. We are within walking distance to MIT

name: Minutes to Harvard Square
description:
This is a newly-updated well-maintained 2 bedroom condo in a classic Cambridgian three level triple decker house. We are located on the first floor (or 'ground floor' in European terms). It is in the most quiet and safest neighborhood in Cambridge, 1.5 miles west of Harvard Square.

The space
The prestine unit is located within 8 minutes of bus ride to Harvard Square (4 different MBTA buses pass the area with Apps to help with live tracking), in the Strawberry Hill district of Cambridge, MA. It is the safest neighborhood in Cambridge, very quiet yet very accessible to H. Sq or downtown. There is also free street parking just in front of the condo, which is very rare for Cambridge. One bedroom has a queen size bed and cabinet. The smaller bedroom has a full size sofa bed. The living room is equipped with HD TV, Wifi, Wireless Speaker, fans, and a sofa bed as well. The kitchen is brand new with all the necessary equipment. The bathroom is brand new and marble
neighborhood_overview: very quiet and family oriented. Free street parking directly in front of the house, which is very rare for Cambridge
host_about: I am a professional living between two coasts. I like to travel, and I'm quite easy going.  I've spent my formative years in various continents, so I am quite open and experienced to various cultures.

name: Spacious townhouse in Cambridge, MA
description:
Beautiful big modernist townhouse for rent (3 months or more)

The space
Spacious modernist townhouse for 3 months or more during August 1 2020 - February 1 2021. The house is 1870 sq/f, 3 floors, 2 bedrooms, 2 baths, big living room, study with sofa-bed, lots of light, internet, washer/dryer, all amenities in the kitchen, parking and garden. Rent - $4100 per month. Final cleaning fee $ 200.

Guest access
Entire house is for guests.
neighborhood_overview: Top location, calm street, minutes to Harvard GSD, Harvard Museums, Harvard square, Cambridge Public Library, close to MIT.  Bakeries, coffee shops, restaurants around the corner.
host_about: I'm an artist living and working between Cambridge (MA, USA) and Europe.

name: Victorian Charm MIT/Harvard/Kendall/Central-1BR
description:
Welcome to our 100-year-old house! Cozy, friendly and full of charm. Very convenient to MGH. Our location is hard to beat: close to both subway and bus with many excellent restaurants in walking distance. Convenient for functions at MIT or Harvard. Located in Central Square, we are an easy walk to Kendall and Inman Squares. For runners and walkers, the Charles River paths are 0.5 mile away. This unit features hardwood floors and nine foot ceilings. The private back deck is very popular.

The space
First off, in these days of divisiveness, we should make clear that everyone is welcome here. Period. If you have medical needs at MGH, our house can be a safe, quiet respite.
This rental is effectively a studio apartment with a private, locked entrance on the middle floor in a 3-unit building. It consists of a private bedroom, private eat-in kitchen and full bathroom in Central Square. In nice weather, guests love to hangout on the private back porch surrounded by
neighborhood_overview:
Despite our urban setting, our neighborhood is very quiet, particularly at bedtime. It has always been the kind of neighborhood where women can walk alone safely at night. Generally speaking, this side of the river is dramatically calmer than the Boston side though now bustling with great restaurants.

We actively recycle. We can do it for you if you simply keep glass, plastic and metal trash together and separated from trash. We also keep a compost container in the fridge for vegetable trash. We'll empty it into the big bin outside when you leave.
host_about:
We are a pair of classical musicians in Cambridge, located between MIT & Harvard. As with much of Cambridge, we're hopeless lefties. 

On parle un peu de français. Hablamos poco español. Und ein bisschen Deutsch auch.

Most Sundays you'll find us "making a joyful noise" at one church or another.
We've been in this old house and this neighborhood over 20 years now. Since we cook a bit, the rental floor fridge and pantry might contain a little overflow from ours. We're huge fans of Airbnb both as guests and as hosts. Leave your towels and sheets at home; we provide all that for you. Our biggest challenge as Airbnb hosts is saying goodbye to the awesome people who stay with us.

name: Lovely Room Near Porter & Harvard
description:
This is a large room in a nice house that is 3 blocks from Porter Square and 10 blocks from Harvard Square.

The space
We have 3 sunny, spacious rooms in the heart of Cambridge. Very close to the subway, stores, restaurants, Harvard University, MIT, and Boston. Only a 5 minute walk to the subway (Redline), and a 15 minute train ride to downtown Boston. One subway stop away from Harvard Square.

The rooms are located on the 2nd and 3rd floors of our house. They are all a good size.

They feature all hardwood floors, big windows and lots of light. Each has a big bed, desk and dresser and a fridge, microwave and toaster oven (if necessary). There are two shared full baths. Free laundry and Wi-Fi!

Note: There is no living room access and very limited kitchen access. If you are super clean and clean up after every meal, then there can be full kitchen access.


Other people in the house are my parents and other guests who a
neighborhood_overview: Great neighborhood, very quiet and peaceful, yet very close to shopping, restaurants and the subway and bus.
host_about: Startup enthusiast in Cambridge MA. I like to travel (though I don't get the chance nearly enough) and always appreciate meeting new people, seeing new places, and trying new foods. I've been around southeast Asia, South America, Europe and the US.

name: Cambridge Apt, walk to MIT, Harvard
description:
Private, sunny, top floor and a half of owner-occupied 19th century row house. The house is tucked away on a private lane minutes from Central Square and public transportation (subway and bus), restaurants, pubs, and two grocery stores. MIT is a 12-min walk, or one subway stop in one direction, and Harvard is a 20-min walk, or one subway stop, in the other direction. The flat gets lots of sun, and has a fully equipped eat-in kitchen and full bath. No TV, but good Wifi.

The space
The apartment has an open plan with wood floors throughout and exposed brick walls. There is a queen size bed and daybed in the loft, and a sofa that can be opened into a bed (twin) in the main living space. It should be noted that the loft is open, so there is little privacy within the flat itself. Also, the spiral staircase leading to the sleeping loft is narrow, and not easy to negotiate with luggage. The flat is on the top of the house, so be prepared for many stairs, but loads of su
host_about: I've lived in Cambridge for 12 years and am new to AIRBNB.

name: Huron Village Lower Unit Harvard Sq
description:
Beautifully decorated apartment in the heart of Huron Village - less than a mile away from Harvard Square. Colorful and light-filled open floor plan with two bedrooms & one bath. This is the lower unit in a two-unit home. Please note we rarely accept short term (under two-weeks) stays more than 2 months in advance.

The space
Our Philly-Style apartment is available for short or medium-term rentals. Perfect for visiting professors and parents visiting their children at Harvard or any of the other area colleges or universities. Also great for business travelers who want a more spacious workspace than a cramped suite at a nearby hotel may give them or small families or groups of friends who are tourists in Cambridge/Boston area. There are two bedrooms - one on each floor and one bath. Beautifully decorated with family antiques and new modern furniture. Lots of original and unique art is hung across the walls. Marimekko (which is across the street) fabrics and pill
neighborhood_overview: Huron Village is the greatest neighborhood in Cambridge (okay - we're bias). Conveniently located between Harvard Square and Fresh Pond our home is at the center of it all. The house sits at the intersection of Mobilia Gallery, Marimekko, and the Cambridge Trust Bank. The Fresh Pond Market is just across the street for all your grocery needs including beer and wine. If you don't feel like cooking then cross the street to Full Moon a European-American bistro or the Village Kitchen which has great pizza and italian fare. Just up the street is Formaggio's Kitchen a gourmand's paradise offer the best cheese selection in the world!  There are a dozen more funky independent shops around for clothing, furniture, books and more. Huron Village is bustling by day and quiet at night. Currently there is some construction going on the street/neighborhood which may start around 7 am  and can be a bit noisy some weekdays.
host_about:
I am Democratic political consultant who travels a lot for business and pleasure both domestically and internationally. My homes are showcases for the various art and handicrafts I have picked up along the way.

I have homes in Kigali, Rwanda, Washington, DC and in Cambridge, MA that  I list on AIRBNB and try to use AIRBNB when I travel as well. 

My brother Adam manages the Cambridge house most of the time and will be your primary contact should you choose to stay there. My friend Whinock helps me manage guest communications in Kigali  and we have a full staff to support guests there.

name: Long term only, Modern Entire Condo MIT/MGH $3600
description:
Entire Condo for long term rental with 2 bed, a sun-filled study, open layout modern kitchen & cozy living with fireplace close to MIT, Kendall, and MGH. Central H/A (unlike most in area) means no radiators and true AC! *We love to help families traveling for medical treatment.*

The space
We are looking for a long-term rental. Please contact us for details. This listing is for the *entire* apartment including all bills, gas, utilities, satellite tv, internet, plus all essentials and hospitality products you might need!

The condo is modern, which means we have central heat and air conditioning (unlike most apartments in Cambridge--crucial in the summer months, and nice instead of radiators in the winter months), a dishwasher, garbage disposal, convection oven, huge new hot water heater, modern refrigerator with filtered water and ice dispenser, a working gas fireplace, and an open kitchen and living room with lots of counter space.

The hous
neighborhood_overview: We're in the awesome area of Cambridge, near up-n-coming Kendall. Very close to MIT (5 min walk), the redline T (12 min walk), and buses that take you directly to the T stop just a block over (2 min walk). Also just a block or two to some of the best pubs and restaurants in the Boston area!!! Lord Hobo (voted best beer in Boston), Tatte (a celebrated pastry bakery and coffee), Emma's Pizza, Cambridge Brewing Company (voted best brew pub in America), Dunkin Donuts (New England tradition), and Friendly Toast (best breakfast/brunch in Boston) are all within just a block or so! At the same time we are in a very quiet, nice, and safe neighborhood with peaceful outdoor areas.
host_about: Love art, music, nature, animals, nuclear energy, and conservation.

name: Renovated Brownstone - MIT/Kendall
description:
City living at its finest! Comfortable private room and bath with new Queen size bed in recently renovated brownstone in East Cambridge.

LOCATION, LOCATION! Near MIT, MGH, Charles River and the many places of interest in Boston and Cambridge.

The space
ACCOMMODATIONS:
Your private bedroom features:
- New super comfortable Queen-Size bed
- Room features a rocking chair, two bureaus and closet space
- Private bathroom with towels and toiletries
- Other amenities: hair dryer, iron and ironing board and Wi-Fi.

In the summer my guests can enjoy coffee in the private patio and year round in my large modern kitchen. Guests have access to a lovely living room with fireplace and TV with many cable stations.

I love to greet my guests when they arrive when possible. If not, I leave a lock box on the door with instructions for easy access. I am usually close by so we always connect at some point.

L
neighborhood_overview:
LOCATION, LOCATION, LOCATION!

If you are going to visit Boston and Cambridge, this is the place to stay. I am located in East Cambridge - near Kendall Square, MIT, Harvard, Massachusetts General Hospital, and Boston - with easy access to everything Boston and Cambridge have to offer. The Museum of Science, the Galeria Mall, and the Charles River are a short 3-5 block walk and there are plenty of shops and restaurants nearby.
host_about:
A little bit about me…

Originally from Florida, I found my way to New England via Spain where I lived and worked for 10 years! I have resided in Cambridge for the past 13 years and love everything it has to offer. I know the city well and can give you tips on things to do, places to see, and where to eat! 

I am a Spanish teacher and I love every opportunity to meet new, interesting people from other places. I love to travel, cook, and spend time with friends and family.  I share my renovated Brownstone with a well-behaved Bichon, Skipper, who also likes to meet new people.

Hope you will plan to visit, I would love to host you.

name: Large 2 Bedroom short ride to Harvard
description:
Lots of sunshine in this 2BD 1.5BTH apartment, a spacious kitchen, and living room. Comes with free washer and dryer, dishwasher, and free street parking. Great for professionals, grad students, and visitors.

The space
***Please keep in mind that this is a typical house in Cambridge, that is a bit old and therefore has the wear and tear of an older home ie. loose door handles, scratches on floor and/or walls, perhaps stains on wooden floors, etc. It is very cozy and a lovely home, but again it just has an older feel so if you are looking for something modern or spotless, you may want to look elsewhere. Just want to be completely honest and thank you for your interest in my listing!

NEIGHBORHOOD:

* Quiet high-end safe neighborhood down the street from where the Internet was invented. Across the street from golf course and beautiful Fresh Pond running trail. There's also a close-by tennis court, basketball court, and children's park.
neighborhood_overview:
This is a very family friendly neighborhood, with a playground right around the corner. Most residents in the area are either families, or teachers/students from Harvard. I highly recommend if you are looking for a quiet area that is easily accessible to the city, yet still has a homier feel!

You will find the Fresh Pond Golf Course right across the Street, wich makes this a very quiet neighborhood. There are lots of restaurants around the area with many options for you and your family.

Being so close to Harvard University, the enviroment is very friendly and the people is thoughtful and respectfu, having visitors from all over America all the time. If you’re a student or teacher, or if you’re visiting your college student, our propert is the best option for you!
host_about: Voyage Management LLC is a small business run by travel enthusiasts. We seek to be the go-to choice for business and healthcare stays. Please let us know how we can help you.

We have a very cozy and comfortable room with a full size bed, TV, closet and bureau with it’s own AC and heating controls. You have your own private full bathroom (never shared) across the hall and full shared use of our beautiful, well stocked custom kitchen. In addition there is a second room you may use for an office work space or to store luggage. A simple breakfast will be provided and space in the refrigerator will be made available for you.
We are on the second floor of this 2 family home so there are stairs to negotiate.

If you are coming to Boston to visit colleges, see our additional listing of 2 Cozy Rooms near Harvard Square for additional sleeping space. We only
neighborhood_overview: Lovely, quiet, safe neighborhood close to Inman Square with many wonderful restaurants.

I am a pediatric nurse practitioner married to a cabinetmaker who loves to travel (especially to Italy)! host_about: Hello!  Professional in 30s splitting time mostly between Boston, Kendall Square Cambridge, Portsmouth, NH, San Francisco and NYC right now and travel frequently.  I've visited most of the 50 states and traveled to 20+ countries internationally.  Profile shows some hosting/swap/Couchsurfing activities, plus dozens of others not booked via AirBnB. Just returned from Iceland, Holland, Italy and London - some great AirBnB experiences - including an Amsterdam Houseboat.  I own/operate multiple businesses:  Lingerie Planet, Inc.  Beer Bites, LLC and my non-profit " (Website hidden by Airbnb) you can follow via @PHILANTHROPIST on (Hidden by Airbnb) . I've owned numerous condos - Cambridge Mass, USA has been home base for 15 years and I've maintained various apartments with numerous residential tenants as well as physical office/incubation spaces with business tenants and/or employees. Currently promoting "The Market Accelerator" which is a startup incubator similar to TechStars, MassChallenge, Y-Combinator with pilot locations on Market Street in Downtown Portsmouth, NH and Kendall / MIT area Cambridge.  My space is unique in that it is designed to work & live for small startup business teams with numerous beds/desks, etc.  I'm also currently working on a project:   "FloatingLoft"  dotc0m  - which is an accelerator / incubation / living space on the ocean. I'm also interested in travel opportunities - so if you are travelling here to New England - I'm open to swaps/exchanges/creative deals, etc.  If you have piles of airline miles needing to be used us - that's a huge plus and can be better than cash.

15 minute walk to Harvard and Central Square (redline).

Beautifully renovated, modern, cozy oasis in the city. This little apartment is a perfect place to relax after taking in everything Cambridge and it's surrounding areas have to offer.

name: Cambridge Long-Term Large Room
description:
This spacious first floor bedroom offers quiet comfort with a recent model queen size bed, easy chair, desk, bureau, and closet. Shared kitchen and bath and washer/dryer. All utilities and wifi, cable tv, and linens included. Minimum stay: 32 nights. Located in a mature academic household. Open to all ages, creeds, and colors, and rainbow friendly. Recent negative Covid test required and temperature and oxygen test on day of arrival; if you fail the tests, host reserves the right to cancel.

The space
The bedroom is on the first floor and has a very comfortable queen size bed, desk, flat screen TV, bureau, easy chair, private closet, and two large windows. Minimum rental period: 32 days. Special note: upon the guest's arrival we have the policy of taking their temperature and oxygen level readings, and if the temperature is too high, and/or oxygen levels too low, to cancel the stay or until negative Covid test and vitals return to normal range. If guest is arr
neighborhood_overview: The neighborhood is residential yet quite vibrant and has many services within walking distance. Two blocks in one direction is the wonderful café Sofra with homemade confections and middle eastern dishes. One block in the other direction is Shangri-La: an excellent Chinese restaurant. Two blocks away is Greg's, a neighborhood Italian eatery with full bar and early bird specials. Also within a block are a well stocked liquor store/wine shop, a middle eastern bakery, and a dry cleaners. If you want to walk five blocks to Coolidge Square there is a tasty vegetarian restaurant (Red Lentil), a great diner (Town Diner), a tiny but very good middle eastern eatery (Jasmine), and a super coffee/lunch spot (Uncommon Grounds). A supermarket (Shaws) is four blocks away. A jogging trail around Fresh Pond is six blocks away as is a very nice nine hole golf course. All of this only a ten minute bus ride from Harvard Square!
host_about: I am a long time Cambridge resident having come here originally to attend Harvard Divinity School. I'm a residential real estate agent practicing in Cambridge and Boston. I co-own a three-family residence in Fresh Pond Cambridge and rent out two rooms and a studio through airbnb at my residence where I also reside. I'm interested in health and help run a small meditation and holistic health group out of the first floor apartment in addition to the room rentals. My interests also include gardening, interior design, travel golf, and of course hosting on airbnb! I like providing beautiful and comfortable spaces for my guests to enjoy. I own an RV and love to go camping to the mountains and seashore with my friends and especially my grandchildren. My favorite travel destinations are New Orleans, Savannah, Georgia, and Palm Springs California. I like all kinds of foods and especially my veggies, and I'll give you my cole slaw recipe; grate a cabbage and some carrots, add a grated fresh anise and an apple to the mix, then add some organic cider vinegar and olive oil mayo to taste (this mix tastes so good, you can try it without mayo). My musical tastes are also wide and include jazz, pop, and a cappela.

name: Lux 1 Bedroom Cambridge Apt by MIT
description:
Our apartment is located in Watermark Kendall West, one of the most exciting places to live, work, shop & play in the Boston area. At this community, there is an array of amenities such as a mezzanine terrace with a garden, fitness center and more.

The space
Residents will enjoy their new luxury home equipped with beautiful design features such as gourmet kitchens with Shaker-style birch cabinets, tile floors and granite counter tops, luxurious bathrooms and expansive windows.

Property amenities include:

• Fitness center (fee)
• Business center
• Club room with video conference & caterers’ kitchen
• Meeting rooms with 45" LCD screen with surround sound
• Elevator
• Mezzanine terrace with a garden
• Zen garden with WiFi
• Beautiful lobby with museum art
• Magnificent architectural and interior design
• Constructed with sensitivity to energy consumption and environmental issues, including natural v
neighborhood_overview:
Watermark Kendall West is located in the heart of Kendall Square, an award winning neighborhood marked as a global center for innovation and cutting edge technology next to MIT. Kendall Square has endless options for dining, entertainment, shopping, recreation and more.
Right nearby, you can also to go sailing, kayaking, running or biking along the Charles River.
Neighboring Boston is only ten minutes east of Cambridge and can be accessed by one of several bridges that cross the Charles River. The Longfellow Bridge, that carries Route 3 and MBTA trains, directly connects Cambridge’s Kendall Square with Boston’s Beacon Hill neighborhood.
host_location: New York, New York, United States
host_about:
We have been providing vacation rental apartments for over 10 years across the East Coast. We are known for our distinctively furnished apartments in popular locations, and for our attentive service. You’ll find that our rates are quite reasonable. If you're looking for a safe, comfortable place with fabulous amenities and Wi-Fi (we know you need the Wi-Fi!) in the Boston MA area, Washington DC, Miami FL or very close to NYC in Jersey City or Hoboken, we'd love to host you. Many of the buildings where our apartments are located feature amenities such as beautiful lobbies, 24 hour front desk staff, fitness centers, business centers, recreation rooms, indoor or outdoor pools and whirlpools. If you are traveling with children, some buildings offer playgrounds (many buildings are near public playgrounds as well) or indoor playrooms. Depending on the location, you can stay for just a few days, a week, a month or more. 

We offer an assortment of short-term apartments in sizes ranging from a studio to three bedrooms that are fully furnished with all the comforts of home. Our local staff meticulously prepares your apartment before your arrival, and we offer 24 hour assistance for any emergencies after business hours. When you arrive at your apartment, the beds will be made, towels and bath amenities will be stocked in the bathrooms, and the coffee maker will be set up in the kitchen with some sample coffees, sweetener and creamer (teabags too if that is your preference) to start your morning off properly. If you’d like to cook a meal, the kitchen is stocked with dishes, cutlery, glassware and pots and pans. The living room is set up with a TV and cable channels, and the Wi-Fi router password and instructions will be prominently displayed so you can get connected quickly. You can also make local and toll-free phone calls at no charge. 

Please contact us to confirm the exact availability of the apartment you are interested in. We’d love to host you (and your family) for your vacation or business trip.

name: It's home, Cambridge! (2BD/2BT)
description:
2 bed room, 2 full baths, Central Sq, Cambridge

The apartment is a great space for visiting professionals or academics looking for a place to stay while on a long term assignment or internship. Nearby parks make it convenient location for small families visiting the area who are looking for a comfortable home base from which to explore Cambridge and Boston.

The space
You will find yourself in a quiet a corner of Cambridgeport, just a brisk walk to bustling Central Sq, between Harvard and MIT. The Central Sq. Red line MBTA subway quickly connects you to the rest of Cambridge and Boston. Or walk five minutes to the Charles River and enjoy an invigorating stroll along the scenic river. The BU main campus is just a few more minutes away on the other side of the BU bridge.

The apartment is the ground level, basement unit of a 3 unit family home. The cozy space has 2 bedrooms and 2 full bathrooms. The kitchen is equipped with all the basic
neighborhood_overview: Our part of Cambridge has a calm, quiet and neighborly feel with young families, folks walking their dogs, and indiviudals going for morning walks and runs.  We are just a five minute walk from Trader Joe's, Starbucks and beautiful views of the Charles River and Boston skyline.  There are neighborhood convenience stores and quick bites nearby.  A little further away, just ten minutes by foot, is a large Whole Foods Grocery.
host_about:
I grew up into San Francisco Bay Area, (Cupertino to be specific) and have unexpectedly but happily have found myself living in Cambridge for nearly 10 years.  I enjoy the outdoors in all of New England's four seasons as well as Cambridge's small city feel.  I love going for runs along the Charles River.  Food is dear to my heart, both in cooking for friends and exploring new restaurants or going to old favorites.  

I've recently helped my parent set up an AirBNB spot in my childhood home in the Bay Area, in addition to the Cambridge location.  Please send me a message if you're curious about either one!

name: Bright Convenient Apt Harvard / MIT
description:
This 600 sf apt with roof deck on the third floor of an old Victorian home is bright and airy. Surrounded trees it does become a sanctuary, a place to call "home". Centrally located and within walking distance to MIT, Novartis, Harvard. It is within minutes walk to the Central Sq subway, station.

The apartment is efficiently laid out with a loft feel. It has a bedroom with king size bed, bath, kitchen, and living area with a ligne roset pullout couch/bed, plus a 230 feet deck.

The space
Renovated recently the space is bright airy space with views out. The deck from the living area gives with its surrounding trees gives the place a feel of a sanctuary. Good for relaxation in the midst of your travel. The living dining room is furnished to be a home which can also be used for travel work.

Guest access
Laundry in the basement if needed, the key to the front door works for the basement. The basement is kept clean but is unfinished.
neighborhood_overview:
In Central Square, easy access to lots of restaurants and bars. walking distance to Inman Square, Kendall Sq, Harvard Sq. Minutes to downtown on the subway. Easy access to zip cars and hubway bicycle service. There are three grocery stores within 5 minutes, Whole Foods, H-Mart and Harvest Coop.

There are a few drinking places; the Fields, Phoenix Landing, the Druid (Inman Sq) and Plough and Stars. They all serve food.

Restaurants are also abundant. It has a concentration of ethnic restaurants. For Indian, Central Square has Shalimar, India Pavilion and many others. There is Central Kitchen, Viale, Oleana, Ole, Casa Portugal, Dumpling House (Chinese) and Four Burgers. Flour is a short walk toward MIT and is known for its baked good and breakfast.

The space
Need a little home away from home? Come to this comfortable home away from home and enjoy! You will have your own private entrance to our separate in-law apartment. Social worker by training, local shop keeper by profession. We've lived here for over 7 years, have a daughter and dog!  We love Cambridge and would be happy to share things to do around town.

name: Charming Harvard Victorian
description:
Charming Victorian a 10 minute walk or 5 min trolley ride to Harvard square. Close to MIT and Harvard.

Nestled up to Harvard sq. our home has stunning old charm with great period character and one off street parking space.

The space
This beautiful 125+ year old home offers approximately over 1900 sq feet of indoor living space. Off the kitchen is relaxing deck with table that's perfect for breakfast, brunch, dinner or happy hour. The home also boasts a beautifully landscaped garden yard with relaxing front porch and backyard seating

The home has stunning vaulted/Abbey ceilings on the top floor, big screen TV and lots of comfortable sitting venues to relax and enjoy its Victorian charm.

While you don't really need a car in this area, as the 'T' stop to Harvard sq with access to all of Boston is across the street, the home offers one and sometimes two street parking, a rarity in Cambridge!

At 1900 sq ft with fou
neighborhood_overview:
Nestled up to Harvard and surrounds the neighborhood is quiet, well established, and beautiful with a lot of history and many famous residents past and current.

Located in the neighborhood of Cambridge called Huron Village, the home is blocks away from the historic Longfellow house, Harvard, Radcliff, Leslie and the entire area exudes Victorian charm.

There is easy and quick access to local stores, tree lines streets, and it offers exceptionally easy access to all things Cambridge and Boston, no car required!
host_about:
I love anything with a story behind it.  I really enjoy any sort of cultural event and great conversation.

In Phoenix, we have tried to provide the perfect sanctuary to get away and yet still see everything the city has to offer for events, shopping, dining, and natural beauty.  North Scottsdale near Kierland is absolutely the perfect location to be.

In Cambridge/Boston we are working with a 124-year-old Victorian.    It's beautiful with a lot of New England charm.   Many homes of the type in the area are gut remodeled and turned into condos or modern style living spaces.  We are working hard to maintain its hand-built Victorian charm while greening its infrastructure where possible and protecting it for future generations.   It's literally an antique we feel more like stewards than owners of.

We are now sharing these homes with others and using any money we earn to further the renovation projects.   We hope to meet people that will continue with us on this journey and get to enjoy things each time they come back as we further improve the spaces for all to enjoy.

name: Stay Across from Harvard's Campus!
description:
You can see the back of Widener Library in Harvard's Old Yard from the front door.

Minutes away from the Harvard T-station with lots of shops, restaurants, and cafes, the apartment is a perfectly situated amongst the best of the in the Boston/Cambridge area.

PLEASE take the time to read the entire description before proceeding with an inquiry or a booking request. Most of your questions will be answered below. Thanks ;-)

The space
A cozy and artistic haven in the heart of historic Harvard Square. Perfect for the visiting scholar, business traveler, or proud parent of a very accomplished student. I love being able to share my home with you and look forward to you stay!

BOOKING REQUIREMENTS:
Since this is my actual home, and not and property that is just for AIRBNB, I only accept request:
-From guest with complete well-thought out profiles with a verified photo, 3 or more verifications (phone, Government ID are a must)
neighborhood_overview: The neighborhood is beautiful. There are MANY great restaurants, shops, cafes and places to visit around the area. The Charles River is just 2 blocks away and is a beautiful place to walk or run.
host_location: New York, New York, United States
host_about:
Hello! I'm Originally from Nashville TN, but went to school in Evansville IN for undergrad, and Cambridge MA for my Master's. I love traveling, the arts, reading and getting to know people from all over the world. Pleasure to "meet' you! Feel free to contact me with any questions you may have.

A Few Facts About Me:

-I'm a professional performer.

-I have been to over 18 different countries and 3 continents.

-Six Characters in Search of An Author by Luigi Pirandello is my favorite play.

-My dad took me to see Phantom of the Opera when I was 8. He was afraid I’d find it boring. I gripped the seat in front of me the entire show and have since seen it 10 times. I think theater should be mandatory in schools.

- I love adrenaline sports like, Skydiving and Bungee Jumping.

-I was clearly born in the wrong time period. I prefer vintage clothes, classic TV, and I wish my name was Ella Fitzgerald.

-I love Indian food, and sushi, and southern food and… oh dear…

-I have a farm in Paris Tennessee.

neighborhood_overview:
Watermark Kendall West is located in the heart of Kendall Square, an award winning neighborhood marked as a global center for innovation and cutting edge technology next to MIT. Kendall Square has endless options for dining, entertainment, shopping, recreation and more.
Right nearby, you can also to go sailing, kayaking, running or biking along the Charles River.
Neighboring Boston is only ten minutes east of Cambridge and can be accessed by one of several bridges that cross the Charles River. The Longfellow Bridge, that carries Route 3 and MBTA trains, directly connects Cambridge’s Kendall Square with Boston’s Beacon Hill neighborhood.
host_location: New York, New York, United States
host_about:
We have been providing vacation rental apartments for over 10 years across the East Coast. We are known for our distinctively furnished apartments in popular locations, and for our attentive service. You’ll find that our rates are quite reasonable. If you're looking for a safe, comfortable place with fabulous amenities and Wi-Fi (we know you need the Wi-Fi!) in the Boston MA area, Washington DC, Miami FL or very close to NYC in Jersey City or Hoboken, we'd love to host you. Many of the buildings where our apartments are located feature amenities such as beautiful lobbies, 24 hour front desk staff, fitness centers, business centers, recreation rooms, indoor or outdoor pools and whirlpools. If you are traveling with children, some buildings offer playgrounds (many buildings are near public playgrounds as well) or indoor playrooms. Depending on the location, you can stay for just a few days, a week, a month or more. 

We offer an assortment of short-term apartments in sizes ranging from a studio to three bedrooms that are fully furnished with all the comforts of home. Our local staff meticulously prepares your apartment before your arrival, and we offer 24 hour assistance for any emergencies after business hours. When you arrive at your apartment, the beds will be made, towels and bath amenities will be stocked in the bathrooms, and the coffee maker will be set up in the kitchen with some sample coffees, sweetener and creamer (teabags too if that is your preference) to start your morning off properly. If you’d like to cook a meal, the kitchen is stocked with dishes, cutlery, glassware and pots and pans. The living room is set up with a TV and cable channels, and the Wi-Fi router password and instructions will be prominently displayed so you can get connected quickly. You can also make local and toll-free phone calls at no charge. 

Please contact us to confirm the exact availability of the apartment you are interested in. We’d love to host you (and your family) for your vacation or business trip.

neighborhood_overview: Enjoy all that Cambridge can offer (just about anything you can think of) without worrying about how to get there or having to carry anything with you: you can always stop by home for a few minutes of relaxation, have a meal delivered to you, check the internet, use your own facilities.... and then hop back into the swing of New England living. neighborhood_overview:
‣‣‣‣3 minute walk to Harvard Square and ten minutes to Central Square Station.
