‣‣‣‣ Minutes walk to all major bus stops and Harvard Square Red Line, you can't go wrong with the location whether you will be here to be a part of Harvard or you will be heading to Boston.
host_about:
Harvard affiliate, design enthusiast, love to host and toast. The rest is history. Beyond all of the above, there is only one reason doing what we do- We are people's people :-). 

★★★★★★★★

FOR NEW airbnb user, below are some of the FAQ links for your perusal (questions & answers useful for new user). Please do let me know if you have any problem, my response would be faster than airbnb support team as sometimes their hotline as very busy (but I only can help you on general question).

GENERAL FAQ for guests before booking
www.airbnb.com/help/topic/traveling

FAQ: What are Airbnb Service Fees?
www.airbnb.com/help/question/104

FAQ: For How to Book
www.airbnb.com/help/question/85

FAQ: For How to make a payment / reservation
Please message me first before you book with the number of guests including kids. Tax of 13% is added on to the total and sent.

www.airbnb.com/help/question/9

www.airbnb.com/help/question/92

www.airbnb.com/help/question/58

FAQ: How does the Airbnb payment system work?
www.airbnb.com/help/question/51

Contact Number and Email Information will only be released until a booking is made.

Below is the FAQ on airbnb “Why can’t I call or email a host before booking?”: www.airbnb.com/help/question/111

We strongly recommend reviewing all cancellation policies before making your reservations: www.airbnb.com/home/cancellation_policies

Hope this helps you get to know how airbnb works :-)

For Pricing, at the listing page, enter check in date, check out date and total number of guests. The system will auto generate the price for your consideration. Regarding the currency display, it depends on your own setting, you can change your currency setting at the lower left panel of your airbnb page under the "LANGUAGE", you will see "CURRENCY" setting. Just click on it to change to any currency that you wish to display.

- Return Customer or Host or Guest with positive reviews with whatever possible discount on top of their daily / weekly / month rate OR VIP customer that keep booking over certain accumulated nights that I will offer extra discount OR Customer who had referred me many booking :-)

name: Cambridge Getaway @ MIT and Harvard
description:
Charming 2-bedroom apartment on the second floor of our beautiful Victorian home.

The space
This is another charming furnished 2 bedroom apartment with a full bathroom, large eat in kitchen, and a living room. It is on the second floor of a well kept Victorian home. This large apartment is located within walking distance of MIT and Harvard. Central and Inman Square are less than 5 minutes away. You can walk to fine dining in Inman square where you will find an eclectic mix of restaurants. Downtown Boston is only a 10 minute train ride away. There you will find shopping areas, world-class hospitals, the convention center, and various museums. Our location is truly in Mid-Cambridge. There is a Whole Foods market and a number of cafes just down the street. Rates are subject to change during the busy season Boston Marathon, local graduations, reunions and the Regatta. The apartment is family and small pet friendly as well. There is a fee for pets.
As of July 20
neighborhood_overview: Annmarie and I have lived in this area for over 50 years. We both live on the first floor of this house and know where people want to go. We can suggest the best restaurants and attractions in the neighborhood.
host_about: Annmarie and I were both born here in Cambridge. We have lived in the same location our entire lives. It is a wonderful area for visiting the city..We started with Airbnb for 4 years now and it has been a wonderfull experience. Many people have stayed here from all over the world.. Marathons, Graduations, Reunions and Family get togethers. We are surrounded by Great restaurant's and cafe's.. We are 5 minutes to bus lines and the Redline. You can walk to Harvard or MIT in 10-15 minutes Walkability has a 95% rating. We also have free parking.

name: Huron Village Upper Unit Harvard Sq
description:
New Listing: Beautifully decorated apartment in the heart of Huron Village - less than a mile away from Harvard Square. Colorful & light filled open floor plan with three private bedrooms. This is the upper unit in a two unit home.

The space
Our gorgeous decorated home is available for short or medium term rentals. Perfect for visiting professors and parents visiting their children at Harvard or any of the other area colleges or universities. Also great for business travelers who want a more spacious work space than a cramped suite at nearby hotel may give them, families or groups of friends who are tourists in Cambridge/Boston area. There are three bedrooms on the top level and one bath. Beautifully decorated with family antiques and new modern furniture. Lots of original and unique folk art from my travels around the world is here. Hand crafted upholstery pieces are in each room. Marimekko (which is across the street) fabrics, ethnic textiles and fun pillows
neighborhood_overview: Huron Village is the greatest neighborhood in Cambridge (okay - we're bias). Conveniently located between Harvard Square and Fresh Pond our home is at the center of it all. The house sits at the intersection of Mobilia Gallery, Marimekko, and the Cambridge Trust Bank. The Fresh Pond Market is just across the street for all your grocery needs including beer and wine. If you don't feel like cooking then cross the street to Full Moon a European-American bistro or the Village Kitchen which has great pizza and italian fare. Just up the street is Formaggio's Kitchen a gourmand's paradise offer the best cheese selection in the world!  There are a dozen more funky independent shops around for clothing, furniture, books and more. Huron Village is bustling by day and quiet at night. Currently there is some construction going on the street/neighborhood which may start around 7 am  and can be a bit noisy some weekdays.
host_about:
I am Democratic political consultant who travels a lot for business and pleasure both domestically and internationally. My homes are showcases for the various art and handicrafts I have picked up along the way.

I have homes in Kigali, Rwanda, Washington, DC and in Cambridge, MA that  I list on AIRBNB and try to use AIRBNB when I travel as well. 

My brother Adam manages the Cambridge house most of the time and will be your primary contact should you choose to stay there. My friend Whinock helps me manage guest communications in Kigali  and we have a full staff to support guests there.

name: Friendly Pleasant Place
description:
Our comfortable bedroom with adjoining private bathroom, and a large (shared) living room area, is on the 1st floor with the hosts living on 2nd floor. The bedroom looks onto a small garden with access to a patio. Ideally located on a dead end street, near downtown, close to subway. Beautiful area.

The space
5 blocks from Central Square, Cambridge, and the Red Line, MBTA Subway station. Walking distance (less than a mile) to both Harvard and MIT (Massachusetts Institute of Technology).

In addition to the queen bed in the room, we can add a very comfortable queen air mattress and/or a single foam pad for extra people.

Guest access
On the first floor, adjacent to where the room is located, there is a limited kitchen with simple amenities. Microwave, refrigerator, coffee maker, eating utensils (plates, bowels, spoons, forks, knives), toaster and sink available. There is no stove nor hotplate. We do not provide breakfast.
neighborhood_overview: We live on a quiet dead end street very close many of Cambridge and Boston's amazing places
host_about: We are a couple with professional jobs. The adult children have left us for their own adventures after college. We enjoy sharing our space with other responsible world citizens. We love music, healthy food, gardening, hiking, movies and sacred space. We speak a few languages and enjoy hearing from people around the world as to how we can become loving humans.

name: Lovely East Cambridge Apartment
description:
This second floor apartment is situated a short distance from MIT, steps away from Kendall Square and very close to public transportation to get to Harvard Square, the Charles River and Boston. Walking distance to great restaurants.
You will be given an easy 4 digit code that will allow you to come and go as you please. We understand how hard it is to travel with kids so we are equipped for young families with pack & plays, a stroller and portable high chair.

The space
The apartment is located in a wonderful neighborhood between Kendall and Inman Square. There are great restaurants and an ample amount of parks within walking distance.

The apartment will be fully furnished with new beds, linens, stocked kitchen, and plenty of amenities for you to have a comfortable stay.

There are 2 large bedrooms and one smaller one. One bedroom has a queen, one bedroom has 2 twins and there is another twin bed in the smaller bedroom. There is
neighborhood_overview: The apartment is located in a wonderful neighborhood between Kendall and Inman Square.   There are quality bars, restaurants and an ample amount of parks within walking distance.
host_about:
My wife and I are teachers north of Boston and have 4 children.  We enjoy traveling, being active, and spending time in Cape Cod and Lake Ontario.
  
As a family we enjoy seeing different places and experiencing different cultures.  We love the concept of airbnb and the idea of communal living.  As a young family we love the idea of living somewhere else and having the flexibility/comforts of a kitchen and bedrooms. 

Rocco is 7 years old and he loves Ancient Egypt and karate.  Theo is 4 and he enjoys cars and diggers.   Colton is also 4 and he enjoys sleeping and baseball.  Adeline is 2 and loves her mom.

name: Quiet Studio near MIT, Harvard & BU
description:
Our private studio apt. is in an antique home on a quiet street. It has a main room with a queen-sized wall bed, a full bath & a kitchen. 10 minute walk to Central Square 'T' station, BU bridge, Trader Joe's and Whole Foods. WiFi, AC & free pass to the Museum of Fine Arts.

The space
Our studio apt. is on the 1st floor of a 3 family, 130+ year-old home. It comfortably accommodates 2 guests. It has a main room with a queen-sized Murphy-style wall bed. It has 9 ft ceilings and hardwood floors. The apartment has a small, but full bathroom and a kitchen with dishwasher. There is a small patio within a fenced yard.

Guest access
After entering an exterior door, guests have their own locked entrance to the private apartment. Guests have shared access to the side patio and yards, including a charcoal grill. Washer & dryer available in the cellar. On street parking. Great WiFi, too.

Other things to note
We include a pass for
neighborhood_overview: Cambridgeport is a quiet, residential neighborhood with a lot of history. There are 5 parks within a 10 minute walk. Central Square is our closest square - a 10 minute walk north. The Charles River and BU Bridge are a 10 minute walk south.
host_about: We have lived in Cambridge MA for over 30 years. We love the New England area and embrace all four seasons as well as the food and activities that come with them. In addition to loving this area, we both like to travel as much as we can. After all the years in Cambridge, we still love to discover new restaurants and activities in the Boston area and are looking forward to sharing those places with you when you come to visit. Our apartment is close to farmers' markets, interesting bars and restaurants, and public transportation to go anywhere in Boston or Cambridge. We are a 10 minute walk to the Charles River and its hike and bike paths as well as several Hubway bike rental spots. We'll happily loan you helmets! You can walk to Harvard, MIT and BU from our central location and even downtown Boston is only a little over a 1/2 hour walk. There's so much to see and do in this historic and interesting neighborhood. Come visit!

neighborhood_overview: The neighborhood is up and coming! Its between the old and the new!  Steps away is a full service supermarket.  Right across the street is the delightful Sofra bakery, specializing in Middle Eastern treats.  For a bit of the old step across Mt Auburn street and get a old school Italian dinner at Greg's (no relation)  Be sure to get to Town Diner for your breakfast needs!
host_about:
I spent most of my adult life traveling around the globe from my home base in Portland,Oregon... sometimes staying in people's house, sometimes just a hammock between two trees.  I am currently indoctrinating my son to like these things so we can hit the road when he gets a wee bit older.  My last trip was across India by bicycle.  Good fun if you get the chance!

Since I've been in Cambridge, I've learned things that would be not possible while traveling, learning the guitar, making beer, perfecting my jerk chicken burritos...and I've grown to love this town...lively music scene, and the biking is getting better and better!

host_about:
Welcome to The Cambridge Karma House!

¡Bienvenidos a La Casa de Karma!

We wanted a name that embodies our feelings and philosophy around hosting, and essentially it is about karma- the notion that our actions and intentions will come back to us and influence our future, whether they be positive or negative. Karma is similar to the golden rule of “treat others the way you want to be treated." We believe that this is a good way to go through the world and attempt to always practice this with our guests. We will try to always treat you with loving kindness and respect, and we expect the same from our guests--that they treat the folks running the house, other guests in the house, and the space itself, with respect and kindness.

This Victorian house built in the 1880s and still has many of the quirks from that era. Around 30 years ago our family bought the property, and in 2013 we started managing and renovating its 6 apartments and established the Cambridge Karma House LLC!

We enjoy hosting our guests & we look forward to meeting you! Please let us know if you need anything or have questions.

We try to always be friendly and caring to our guests so please do let us know if there's anything we can do to make your stay more comfortable.

CHECK-IN=any time after 3pm*

CHECK-OUT=12 noon or earlier*

*if you need to check in before 3pm or check out after 12 noon, please let us know and we will *try* to accommodate you (you MUST receive a confirmation that this is okay). If we’re not able to accommodate you with an early check-in or late check-out time, we are almost always able to offer our guests the ability to store their luggage in the basement during non-apartment-stay hours.

---> The details of our check-in and check-out procedures are *automatically* emailed to confirmed guests by airbnb through our “House Manual”; the House Manual covers a variety of topics but we ask that you ****privilege what is written here**** regarding parking, plumbing, tidiness + cleanliness, and waste disposal (we are in the process of updating the House Manuals on all of our listings but sometimes our systems, etc. change this places is the quickest go-to place to relay/outline what we need our guests to know and/or do). 

IMPORTANT NOTES (parking, plumbing, tidiness + cleanliness, and waste disposal)*:

*Please privilege guest expectations and procedures written here over those received in the "House Manual”

**************PARKING**************:

We canNOT offer parking to most of our guests. We have 1 visitors parking pass for 6 units (maximum 3 days in a row in the zone indicated behind the pass (to be placed on the dashboard) & the vehicle must be moved every 24 hours); if you want the pass YOU MUST ASK us *****AND**** receive a message confirming that, indeed, you may use it (it is in high demand and often unavailable).

Due to the limited availability of parking in Cambridge (both through the house and in Cambridge overall), we suggest you not bring a car.

**************PLUMBING**************

While there are many fantastic and charming features of the old Victorian house, the old pipes are not one of them! Therefore:

YOU ***MUST*** USE THE HAIR AND FOOD CATCHERS IN ALL OF THE DRAINS. Indeed, WATER (/polarity bonded liquids (no oil)) IS THE ONLY THING THAT CAN GO DOWN THE SINKS AND TUB. Not doing so will clog up the pipes; if we need to call the plumber we may keep part, all of your security deposit to remedy the situation.

**************TIDINESS & CLEANLINESS of Your Living Space When Checking Out**************

There is a short window period between checking-in and checking-out and oftentimes we are booked back to back with multiple apartments to prepare. If your apartment takes more than about an hour to clean it is likely we will draw from your deposit for this extra service of your apartment requiring a deep cleaning after you check out. Crumbs and food all over the tables and counters (or food in the trash; see below under "Compost"!), spilled products on the bathroom sink, this is not what we expect to encounter to turn around the apartment to the next guest. The apartments are large and wiping all the surfaces down, cleaning the floors and changing the bedding and towels in the most basic way usually takes about an hour. In a way we're trying to clean invisible things (germs, finger prints, dust, etc.) form one guest to the next; when we clean and prepare apartments we do not expect to have to pick-up-after-you.

A my j**************WASTE DISPOSAL: COMPOSTING + RECYCLING + TRASH************** :

Our Earth is under seriously strained circumstances in terms of how much toxic matter humans are exposing it to, and as such, we take waste production seriously. The best sustainable practice mantra is (in this order): reduce, reuse, recycle.

GUESTS STAYING UNDER ONE WEEK:

Please leave your trash, recyclables and compost INSIDE of the apartment and KINDLY DO NOT take it outside. If you need to take it out for some reason, please see the “where" section for each type of waste.

GUESTS STAYING OVER ONE WEEK:

Take your trash, recyclables and compost to the 19 side of the house and put them IN THE PROPER BINS (if you are unable to do so for medical reasons, please let us know and we will gladly do this for you!). The trash and recycling is collected at around 7am Wednesday morning (one day later on weeks where there are national holidays);

********TRASH********

WHAT? anything that is NOT compostable (food) or recyclable (paper, glass, aluminum, plastic). Examples: styrofoam, dirt and hair (though these last 2 can put in the garden)….most (clean) materials can be recycled! :-)

WHERE? Indoors: in the bin marked “Trash.” Outdoors: in the BLACK OR GREY bins (these are smaller than the recycling bins).

HOW? In TIGHTLY SEALED PLASTIC BAGS. name: Lux 2 Bedroom Cambridge Apt by MIT
description:
This 23 story high-rise residential building is located in one of the most exciting places to live, work, shop & play in the Boston area. At this community, there is an array of amenities such as a mezzanine terrace with a garden.

The space
Residents will enjoy their new luxury home equipped with beautiful design features such as gourmet kitchens with Shaker-style birch cabinets, tile floors and granite counter tops, luxurious bathrooms and expansive windows.

Property amenities include:

• Fitness center (fee)
• Business center
• Club room with video conference & caterers’ kitchen
• Meeting rooms with 45" LCD screen with surround sound
• Elevator
• Mezzanine terrace with a garden
• Zen garden with WiFi
• Beautiful lobby with museum art
• Magnificent architectural and interior design
• Constructed with sensitivity to energy consumption and environmental issues, including natural ventilation and exte
neighborhood_overview:
This property is located in the heart of Kendall Square, an award winning neighborhood marked as a global center for innovation and cutting edge technology next to MIT. Kendall Square has endless options for dining, entertainment, shopping, recreation and more.
Right nearby, you can also to go sailing, kayaking, running or biking along the Charles River.
Neighboring Boston is only ten minutes east of Cambridge and can be accessed by one of several bridges that cross the Charles River. The Longfellow Bridge, that carries Route 3 and MBTA trains, directly connects Cambridge’s Kendall Square with Boston’s Beacon Hill neighborhood.
host_location: New York, New York, United States
host_about:
We have been providing vacation rental apartments for over 10 years across the East Coast. We are known for our distinctively furnished apartments in popular locations, and for our attentive service. You’ll find that our rates are quite reasonable. If you're looking for a safe, comfortable place with fabulous amenities and Wi-Fi (we know you need the Wi-Fi!) in the Boston MA area, Washington DC, Miami FL or very close to NYC in Jersey City or Hoboken, we'd love to host you. Many of the buildings where our apartments are located feature amenities such as beautiful lobbies, 24 hour front desk staff, fitness centers, business centers, recreation rooms, indoor or outdoor pools and whirlpools. If you are traveling with children, some buildings offer playgrounds (many buildings are near public playgrounds as well) or indoor playrooms. Depending on the location, you can stay for just a few days, a week, a month or more. 

We offer an assortment of short-term apartments in sizes ranging from a studio to three bedrooms that are fully furnished with all the comforts of home. Our local staff meticulously prepares your apartment before your arrival, and we offer 24 hour assistance for any emergencies after business hours. When you arrive at your apartment, the beds will be made, towels and bath amenities will be stocked in the bathrooms, and the coffee maker will be set up in the kitchen with some sample coffees, sweetener and creamer (teabags too if that is your preference) to start your morning off properly. If you’d like to cook a meal, the kitchen is stocked with dishes, cutlery, glassware and pots and pans. The living room is set up with a TV and cable channels, and the Wi-Fi router password and instructions will be prominently displayed so you can get connected quickly. You can also make local and toll-free phone calls at no charge. 

Please contact us to confirm the exact availability of the apartment you are interested in. We’d love to host you (and your family) for your vacation or business trip.

description:

name: #34-1 Great apartment in Cambridge!
description:
This is a first floor apartment of a Victorian home close to Porter Square. The apartment has a living room, bedroom, kitchen with dishwasher, private deck and parking. Shops and public transportation are close by and it's a quiet and safe neighborhood. Owners live next door.

The space
Stay in a cute 1st floor apartment around 5 minutes (0.3 miles) away from the Porter Square Train Station. The apartment has a bedroom, large walk-in closet, living room, kitchen with dishwasher, bathroom, private deck, off-street parking spot (tandem), and free laundry in the basement. There is a convenience store on Walden Street that is less than a 5-minute walk

Guest access
the apartment, deck, basement (laundry) and parking spot
neighborhood_overview: The apartment is on a residential street in Cambridge, 7 minutes from the Porter Square Train Station and plaza. There are lots of great shops and stores close by, as well as parks and other nice places.
host_about:
Welcome to The Cambridge Karma House!

¡Bienvenidos a La Casa de Karma!

We wanted a name that embodies our feelings and philosophy around hosting, and essentially it is about karma- the notion that our actions and intentions will come back to us and influence our future, whether they be positive or negative. Karma is similar to the golden rule of “treat others the way you want to be treated." We believe that this is a good way to go through the world and attempt to always practice this with our guests. We will try to always treat you with loving kindness and respect, and we expect the same from our guests--that they treat the folks running the house, other guests in the house, and the space itself, with respect and kindness.

This Victorian house built in the 1880s and still has many of the quirks from that era. Around 30 years ago our family bought the property, and in 2013 we started managing and renovating its 6 apartments and established the Cambridge Karma House LLC!

We enjoy hosting our guests & we look forward to meeting you! Please let us know if you need anything or have questions.

We try to always be friendly and caring to our guests so please do let us know if there's anything we can do to make your stay more comfortable.

CHECK-IN=any time after 3pm*

CHECK-OUT=12 noon or earlier*

*if you need to check in before 3pm or check out after 12 noon, please let us know and we will *try* to accommodate you (you MUST receive a confirmation that this is okay). If we’re not able to accommodate you with an early check-in or late check-out time, we are almost always able to offer our guests the ability to store their luggage in the basement during non-apartment-stay hours.

---> The details of our check-in and check-out procedures are *automatically* emailed to confirmed guests by airbnb through our “House Manual”; the House Manual covers a variety of topics but we ask that you ****privilege what is written here**** regarding parking, plumbing, tidiness + cleanliness, and waste disposal (we are in the process of updating the House Manuals on all of our listings but sometimes our systems, etc. change this places is the quickest go-to place to relay/outline what we need our guests to know and/or do). 

IMPORTANT NOTES (parking, plumbing, tidiness + cleanliness, and waste disposal)*:

*Please privilege guest expectations and procedures written here over those received in the "House Manual”

**************PARKING**************:

We canNOT offer parking to most of our guests. We have 1 visitors parking pass for 6 units (maximum 3 days in a row in the zone indicated behind the pass (to be placed on the dashboard) & the vehicle must be moved every 24 hours); if you want the pass YOU MUST ASK us *****AND**** receive a message confirming that, indeed, you may use it (it is in high demand and often unavailable).

Due to the limited availability of parking in Cambridge (both through the house and in Cambridge overall), we suggest you not bring a car.

**************PLUMBING**************

While there are many fantastic and charming features of the old Victorian house, the old pipes are not one of them! Therefore:

YOU ***MUST*** USE THE HAIR AND FOOD CATCHERS IN ALL OF THE DRAINS. Indeed, WATER (/polarity bonded liquids (no oil)) IS THE ONLY THING THAT CAN GO DOWN THE SINKS AND TUB. Not doing so will clog up the pipes; if we need to call the plumber we may keep part, all of your security deposit to remedy the situation.

**************TIDINESS & CLEANLINESS of Your Living Space When Checking Out**************

There is a short window period between checking-in and checking-out and oftentimes we are booked back to back with multiple apartments to prepare. If your apartment takes more than about an hour to clean it is likely we will draw from your deposit for this extra service of your apartment requiring a deep cleaning after you check out. Crumbs and food all over the tables and counters (or food in the trash; see below under "Compost"!), spilled products on the bathroom sink, this is not what we expect to encounter to turn around the apartment to the next guest. The apartments are large and wiping all the surfaces down, cleaning the floors and changing the bedding and towels in the most basic way usually takes about an hour. In a way we're trying to clean invisible things (germs, finger prints, dust, etc.) form one guest to the next; when we clean and prepare apartments we do not expect to have to pick-up-after-you.

A my j**************WASTE DISPOSAL: COMPOSTING + RECYCLING + TRASH************** :

Our Earth is under seriously strained circumstances in terms of how much toxic matter humans are exposing it to, and as such, we take waste production seriously. The best sustainable practice mantra is (in this order): reduce, reuse, recycle.

GUESTS STAYING UNDER ONE WEEK:

Please leave your trash, recyclables and compost INSIDE of the apartment and KINDLY DO NOT take it outside. If you need to take it out for some reason, please see the “where" section for each type of waste.

GUESTS STAYING OVER ONE WEEK:

Take your trash, recyclables and compost to the 19 side of the house and put them IN THE PROPER BINS (if you are unable to do so for medical reasons, please let us know and we will gladly do this for you!). The trash and recycling is collected at around 7am Wednesday morning (one day later on weeks where there are national holidays);

********TRASH********

WHAT? anything that is NOT compostable (food) or recyclable (paper, glass, aluminum, plastic). Examples: styrofoam, dirt and hair (though these last 2 can put in the garden)….most (clean) materials can be recycled! :-)

WHERE? Indoors: in the bin marked “Trash.” Outdoors: in the BLACK OR GREY bins (these are smaller than the recycling bins).

HOW? In TIGHTLY SEALED PLASTIC BAGS. You CANNOT leave the bags unsealed (this disrespects the folks collecting the trash by risking waste falling out while disposing of it) and/or the City will reject the bin likely fine us (and we will have no qualms about passing this on to you (by withholding your security deposit).

********RECYCLING********

WHAT?

Paper (example: receipts, newspaper, tissues, cereal boxes)

Glass (for example:bottles),

Aluminum (for example:cans)

Hard Plastics (for example: your clean (see below) yoghurt containers, to-go food containers, etc.….*****You must KEEP SOFT PLASTICS (for example: plastic bags) SEPARATE from other recyclable materials*****; these clog the recycling sorting machine. We put these together outside (either in a small bin by the compost wheel and/or in a large bag full of soft plastics (mostly bags)!

** VERY IMPORTANT NOTE: all materials MUST BE CLEAN. This means that you have to rinse out you milk cartons, clean out containers containing food (put excess food in the compost (**NEVER down the sink drain**; see “Plumbing”).

WHERE?

Indoors: in the bin marked “Recycling.”

Outdoors: in the LARGE NAVY BLUE BINS (everything goes in there EXCEPT for your soft plastics (for example: plastic bags); put these in the small container by the compost wheel or in a large plastic bag full of soft plastics).

vHOW?

WI
********COMPOST********

I N sA Isis WHAT?

IAll of your food scraps (for example: fruits peels, tea bags, coffee grinds, vegetable scraps, etc.) EXCEPT for meat and dairy (egg shells are fine!). What do do with these food caught in the kitchen sink? Throw it in the zip lock bag in the freezer :)

name: Peaceful One-Bedroom Apartment
description:
October 2020 Update: Thanks for looking. Unfortunately, we are currently CLOSED until the spring. Stay safe out there!

The space
A charming one-bedroom apartment. Located on the first floor (ground floor) of a two-family house, the apartment has a separate entrance and consists of a bedroom, living room, a no-cook kitchen/dining area, and a bathroom with an old-fashioned clawfoot tub (details below). A great accommodation for 1 or 2 guests, but please note that two guests will need to share the only bed.
More Details:
• Free driveway parking for one car.
• Front porch with a private entrance to the apartment.
• No-cook kitchen/dining area with a table & chairs, refrigerator, microwave, coffee maker, electric kettle, toaster, plates, glasses, and utensils.**
• A bedroom with a real queen-size bed, alarm clock, closet, small bureau, and an old-school TV with rabbit ears antenna - no cable.
• Bathroom with a clawfoot tub &
neighborhood_overview:
My house is located 2 miles from Harvard Square in a wonderfully diverse section of the city known as North Cambridge — a laid-back community & family-oriented area that’s home to an eclectic mix of people. There are families who’ve lived here for generations; and then there are us “newcomers,” drawn here by affordable real estate prices and the opportunity to live close enough to the action of Davis, Porter and Harvard Squares, yet far enough away from the hustle-bustle and relative anonymity of those neighborhoods.

The neighborhood is in transition; you’ll see a recently renovated property worth over three-quarters of a million dollars right next to a house in need of a paint job and a little TLC. And yes, some of houses have overgrown yards. But, remember that appearances can be deceiving…Those houses in need of some TLC on their exterior, often have beautiful interior spaces. And sometimes, those overgrown yards are actually urban vegetable gardens overflowing with
host_about: Hello, thanks for stopping by.  I’m a long-time Cambridge resident and have lived in this wonderful neighborhood for years. I’m currently retired from a working life that's included many career adventures -  from being a short order cook to designing & building furniture to managing an IT department for a software company...and other detours in between.  These days, I'm truly blessed to have a life that keeps me busy doing the things that I enjoy... but not so busy that I don't have time to stop and smell the roses.

name: Great House in Central Square
description:
My 3 bedroom house is in a quiet & friendly neighborhood yet only 2 blocks to the subway. There are plenty of bars, restaurants, markets & shops within 3 blocks. Nestled between Harvard & MIT it is an easy walk to see most of Cambridge's offerings!

The space
This is a fantastic space very close to the bustle of Central Square. The house has lots of natural sunlight and was built in 1833 so although renovated, has plenty of old style charm. The stairs are steep compared to modern day construction but there are 2 sofa beds downstairs if stairs are a problem. You rent the entire house so no one is above or below to disrupt your holiday with unwanted noise.

Guest access
driveway parking for 1 car, storage shed, shared yard and entire home.

License number
STR-18433
neighborhood_overview: Very friendly, safe and close to the heart of Central Square.  Also surprisingly quiet considering it is only 2 blocks to the subway and center of Central Square.
host_about: Hello! My name is Lindsey (she/her) and I am student at UMASS Amherst currently taking classes remotely. description:
Our studio is a spotless ground floor apartment with completely separate street entrance! Walk to Harvard, MIT. IMMACULATE small 400 sq. ft studio apartment with funky custom queen high-ceiling loft bed (see photos). Great for singles

The space
LOCATION: Historic tree lined Bigelow Street,. Our location is amazing! We are centrally located smack between Harvard & MIT! (The crossing streets are Bigelow Street and Massachusetts Avenue).

Our studio apartment is always professionally cleaned and spotless for your arrival. The studio apartment is on the ground floor and has it's own private completely separate entrance off the street and is accessible by key code.

description:
This sunny corner apartment in a modern building houses 6 comfortably. Two rooms have queen murphy bed/sofas, and the last a twin daybed and trundle bed. A short walk from Central Square, MIT and Harvard. Enjoy gourmet kitchen and dining area.

The space
This apartment has three sleeping spaces. Each space can be converted from a bedroom into an entertainment space or workspace. It is ideal for longer stays in which the occupants want to work, entertain, cook at home, exercise at home, etc. Because each room can transform from a bedroom into a living room, there is no separate living room. The master bedroom has a private bathroom, and the other two bedrooms share a bathroom. The kitchen is fully equipped with all equipment needed for cooking meals for six.

Guest access
Enclosed parking can be arranged from the building for $15/day.

Other things to note
There is a Keurig & regular coffee maker. A starter s
neighborhood_overview: Beside being close to MIT and Harvard along with Central, Kendall and Inman Squares, our building is next to nationally-acclaimed restaurants Bondir (right next door) and Oleana (a block away).   A new coffee shop/craft beer shop (Lamplighter) just opened across the street.
host_about:
Travelling is a passion of mine.   I love to experience new places, new foods and meet new people.   Having lived in Brazil, Japan, Thailand and many years here in the United States I appreciate diverse viewpoints and customs.    Getting helpful insight from friendly locals makes any stay so much richer.

For my day job, I develop multifamily housing.   I am interested in creating living solutions that allow residents to pursue their passions and interests while having a smaller environmental footprint.    To that end, I am involved in a startup that uses architectural robotics to create transformable spaces.

As a father of five, I am a family man.   I appreciate the challenges and joys of travelling with family.    My wife and I took our children down the Silk Road on a 3 week hand carry only trip.   Getting good local advice can be critical to making a stay pleasant and rewarding for every member of the family.

This exquisite property is a modern full-service 17 story high-rise building located in the heart of Kendall Square. Property amenities include 24 hour concierge services, a fitness club, and a Zen Garden.

The space
Apartments offer panoramic views, over-sized closets, and designer kitchens. Your fully appointed apartment is furnished with all the necessities of home, including linens & towels, and an individual washer/dryer.

Property amenities include:

• 24-hour, full-service concierge
• Zen garden
• Dry cleaning
• Fitness center (fee)
• Meeting room
• Club house
• Sun deck
• In unit washer/dryer

The private bedroom features a deluxe queen size bed with our indulgent custom linens, fluffy duvet, and plush pillows, two night tables with lamps, a clock radio, a dresser and a spacious walk-in closet.

The Living Room includes a sofa with pullout bed, club chair, an entertainment center
neighborhood_overview: This property is located in the heart of Kendall Square, an award winning neighborhood marked as a global center for innovation and cutting edge technology next to MIT. Dubbed as one of the most exciting places to live, work, shop and play in the Boston area, this walkable community is situated just one subway stop on the Red Line from Beacon Hill, two stops from Harvard Square and on the banks of the Charles River.
host_location: New York, New York, United States
host_about:
We have been providing vacation rental apartments for over 10 years across the East Coast. We are known for our distinctively furnished apartments in popular locations, and for our attentive service. You’ll find that our rates are quite reasonable. If you're looking for a safe, comfortable place with fabulous amenities and Wi-Fi (we know you need the Wi-Fi!) in the Boston MA area, Washington DC, Miami FL or very close to NYC in Jersey City or Hoboken, we'd love to host you. Many of the buildings where our apartments are located feature amenities such as beautiful lobbies, 24 hour front desk staff, fitness centers, business centers, recreation rooms, indoor or outdoor pools and whirlpools. If you are traveling with children, some buildings offer playgrounds (many buildings are near public playgrounds as well) or indoor playrooms. Depending on the location, you can stay for just a few days, a week, a month or more. 

We offer an assortment of short-term apartments in sizes ranging from a studio to three bedrooms that are fully furnished with all the comforts of home. Our local staff meticulously prepares your apartment before your arrival, and we offer 24 hour assistance for any emergencies after business hours. When you arrive at your apartment, the beds will be made, towels and bath amenities will be stocked in the bathrooms, and the coffee maker will be set up in the kitchen with some sample coffees, sweetener and creamer (teabags too if that is your preference) to start your morning off properly. If you’d like to cook a meal, the kitchen is stocked with dishes, cutlery, glassware and pots and pans. The living room is set up with a TV and cable channels, and the Wi-Fi router password and instructions will be prominently displayed so you can get connected quickly. You can also make local and toll-free phone calls at no charge. 

Please contact us to confirm the exact availability of the apartment you are interested in. We’d love to host you (and your family) for your vacation or business trip.

name: Harvard & MIT- Sweet Retreat in Coolest Cambridge!
description:
Our Sweet Retreat is quietly hidden away in the heart of Cambridge, steps from a cafe, bike sharing, MBTA, Harvard, MIT, shops, and eateries — as well as equidistant to Harvard, Inman, and Central Squares. The apartment is comfortably furnished and INCLUDES off street PARKING!

We will greet you and point you to the historical, artsy, free, outdoors, music, restaurants, beaches, and etc. As friendly, long time Cambridge residents (designers and world travelers!), we know the hidden gems too.

The space
This apartment is a hidden gem. It is bright, cheery, quiet, and steps away from every mode of transportation and convenience you need to enjoy all that Cambridge (and beyond) has to offer.

The main room has a comfortable space for sitting and a long L shaped counter for working or sipping coffee. There is an apartment sized refrigerator, microwave, coffee maker and electric tea pot — along with dishes, bowls, and etc.

The full bathr
neighborhood_overview: This is an old neighborhood of owner occupied homes once used as servants' quarters for the Brattle Street mansions near Harvard Square in the old, Victorian days. We neighbors all know each other, so things run smoothly. It is safe, quiet, friendly, and has GREAT coffee steps away.
host_about: Artist, textile/accessories designer, and global traveler with a particular love for Asian markets, vintage textiles, and artisans !! My daughter and I lived in Vietnam for the better part of 7 years, and our home is definitely a mini gallery of our travels. I am positive you will feel very happy to be in the midst of lovely colors, interesting books, and, best of all, in a seemingly quiet corner of Cambridge, tucked away, that in actuality — is in the center of all!

name: Live Large in Transformable Studio
description:
A 12'x12' living room, a 12'x12' bedroom, a study, a walk-in closet, a kitchen, bathroom in a studio? You can do it with architectural robotics. Come experience the future of housing based on work straight out of MIT.

The space
Live large in a small space using robotic closets and bed. By day enjoy your full-size living room with a sofa, a bench and a 42" flat screen TV. By night, press a button and the queen bed is at your disposal. The luxurious bathroom, fully equipped kitchen and washer/dryer make this studio live like a comfortable one-bedroom unit. The sofa converts to a small futon, suitable for children ages 2-12. For older folks, please note that the bed is close to the floor.

Guest access
Enclosed parking can be obtained from the building for $15/day.

Other things to note
There is a Keurig & regular coffee maker. A starter supply of paper goods, detergent, soap, shampoo etc. is provided. Portacrib

neighborhood_overview: Strawberry Hill is a very friendly neighborhood between Huron Ave and Mount Auburn Street. There are numerous little places by local owners offering a multitude of food within a ten minute walk. Sofra ( a spinoff from Oleana) is a quick walk away. Shangri-La offers a great dim sum and is just around corner. Across the way Conleys Pub and sports bar is always serving up food and drinks. Homemade Greek yogurts and foods can be found at Sophia's on Belmont St, and just before that Linda's Donuts makes the best home made donuts from scratch every morning. At Aram's Cafe, one can get a breakfast or lunch cooked by Aram himself, whose establishment has been cooking up delicious entrees for over 25 years. Starbucks is diagonally across. Moozies Ice cream nearvy for homemade ice cream. There is a large supermarket and drug store in Star Market as well as local food shops- Russo's, Eastern Lemejuan,  The Fresh Pond Golf Course and Waterworks have a beautiful walking/jogging path and public golf

name: Cambridge Modern Living
description:
This cozy modern apartment is conveniently located a 5 minute car ride or 8 minute bus ride from Harvard Square, on a quiet residential street. The apartment is one block away from the 71 and 73 bus lines that run straight to Harvard Square. There is a couch or air mattress and shared bath available for you in this quaint 1 bedroom, 1 bath modern apartment.

The space
This sun filled flat is the ideal Cambridge location. I am a 5 minute car or bus ride from the Harvard Square stop of the Red Line MBTA train and Harvard University, and steps away from one of the best Turkish cafes (Sofra) in the Boston area! There is a grocery store (with Starbucks), dry cleaners, shoe repair, bank, and pharmacy conveniently located across the street. Fresh Pond and Mt. Auburn Cemetery (two of Cambridge's top destinations) are a 10 minute walk away. There are a number of coffee shops and restaurants all within a 5 minute radius! The beautiful Charles River is an enjoyable 10 minute
neighborhood_overview:
Here are a few of my favorite things about my location:
1) Restaurants/Cafes/Bars less than 0.25 miles away include: Sofra, Red Lentil, Greg's, Cha Yen Thai Cookery, Deluxe Town Diner, Seta's Cafe, The Village Kitchen.
2) I love walking around and enjoying the beautiful homes, gardens and parks in the neighborhood.
3) Proximity to Harvard Square - you really can't beat it. You can be at the heart of Harvard Square in less than 5 minutes by bus or car.
4) Great live music - There are a number of live music venues nearby.
5) The Cambridge Public Library and newly renovated Harvard Art Museums are beautiful spaces with great architectural design and are within a walking distance from my place and they both are great places to spend the day.
6) Fresh Pond and Mt. Auburn Cemetery, two highlights, are within a 10 min walk.
host_about:
I'm a Designer/Education Entrepreneur. My company is based in Boston, but I'm a native Californian. I grew up in Southern California and got transplanted to the chilly East Coast. Let's just say, I'm still getting used to the winters!

I've been living in Cambridge for the past 6 years, and have come to enjoy the intellectual environment and diversity of the city.

I love art, electronic music, traveling, trying new restaurants, watching indie movies, and working on interactive art projects in my spare time.

name: Cambridge Long-Term Spacious Room
description:
This spacious first floor bedroom offers quiet comfort with a recent model queen size bed, easy chair, desk, bureau, and closet. Shared kitchen and bath and washer/dryer. All utilities and wifi, cable tv, and linens included. Minimum stay: 32 nights. Located in a mature academic household. Open to all ages, creeds, and colors, and rainbow friendly. Recent negative Covid test required and temperature and oxygen test on day of arrival; if you fail the tests, host reserves the right to cancel.

The space
The bedroom is located in the first floor apartment and has a very comfortable queen size bed, two windows, desk, bureau, flat screen TV, closet, and easy chair.

Guest access
Kitchen.

Other things to note
PLEASE provide details of your work/study situation and whether you plan to work remotely. If you are traveling from out of state, Massachusetts requires a two-week quarantine period until you have a negative Covid t
neighborhood_overview: The neighborhood is quite residential yet has many services within walking distance. Two blocks in one direction is the wonderful café Sofra with homemade confections and middle eastern dishes. One block in the other direction is Shangri-La: an excellent Chinese restaurant. Two blocks away is Greg's, a neighborhood Italian eatery with full bar and early bird specials. Also within a block are a well stocked liquor store/wine shop, a middle eastern bakery, and a dry cleaners. If you want to walk five blocks to Coolidge Square there is a tasty vegetarian restaurant (Red Lentil), a great diner (Town Diner), a tiny but very good middle eastern eatery (Jasmine), and a super coffee/lunch spot (Uncommon Grounds). A supermarket (Shaws) is four blocks away. A jogging trail around Fresh Pond is six blocks away as is a very nice nine hole golf course. All of this only a ten minute bus ride from Harvard Square!
host_about: I am a long time Cambridge resident having come here originally to attend Harvard Divinity School. I'm a residential real estate agent practicing in Cambridge and Boston. I co-own a three-family residence in Fresh Pond Cambridge and rent out two rooms and a studio through airbnb at my residence where I also reside. I'm interested in health and help run a small meditation and holistic health group out of the first floor apartment in addition to the room rentals. My interests also include gardening, interior design, travel golf, and of course hosting on airbnb! I like providing beautiful and comfortable spaces for my guests to enjoy. I own an RV and love to go camping to the mountains and seashore with my friends and especially my grandchildren. My favorite travel destinations are New Orleans, Savannah, Georgia, and Palm Springs California. I like all kinds of foods and especially my veggies, and I'll give you my cole slaw recipe; grate a cabbage and some carrots, add a grated fresh anise and an apple to the mix, then add some organic cider vinegar and olive oil mayo to taste (this mix tastes so good, you can try it without mayo). My musical tastes are also wide and include jazz, pop, and a cappela.

A private retreat ideally located in a quiet neighborhood between Harvard and Porter Square, close to some of the best restaurants and shops in Cambridge, minutes from the Redline. Sunny and spacious with two bedrooms and a separate food preparation/living and dining area.

The space
Three attractive, cozy rooms and a spacious bathroom with a claw tub and separate shower on the third floor of a mansard style victorian house in the heart of Cambridge. The two bedrooms have comfortable beds with fine, all cotton bed linen and plenty of pillows. The food preparation area in the living room is equipped with high quality appliances - a coffee maker, large toaster oven and microwave, mini fridge and freezer - not a full kitchen but much more than you would find in any hotel room. The living area also has a 42" TV with HBO and Showtime. The apartment has its own private lockable
neighborhood_overview: The area between Harvard and Porter Squares is one of the most lively and interesting parts of Cambridge, as is Davis Square which is also nearby. Temple Bar, Giulia, and numerous other great restaurants, takeout places and cafes are right around the corner. Abodeon, Pod, Nomad, and Joie de Vie plus the unusual vintage stores and music venues of Davis square are just a few of the interesting possibilities. The Peabody Museum with its exquisite glass flowers and the newly renovated Harvard Art Museums are within walking distance.

host_about:
Travelling is a passion of mine.   I love to experience new places, new foods and meet new people.   Having lived in Brazil, Japan, Thailand and many years here in the United States I appreciate diverse viewpoints and customs.    Getting helpful insight from friendly locals makes any stay so much richer.

For my day job, I develop multifamily housing.   I am interested in creating living solutions that allow residents to pursue their passions and interests while having a smaller environmental footprint.    To that end, I am involved in a startup that uses architectural robotics to create transformable spaces.

As a father of five, I am a family man.   I appreciate the challenges and joys of travelling with family.    My wife and I took our children down the Silk Road on a 3 week hand carry only trip.   Getting good local advice can be critical to making a stay pleasant and rewarding for every member of the family.

name: Sunny Huron Village Apt. w/ Terrace
description:
PERFECT COVID ESCAPE! Our two-family home in West Cambridge includes a new one bedroom apartment on first floor, with sunny bedroom, living room, new kitchen & bath, as well as a wonderful private garden terrace. Easy commute to Harvard Sq on foot or by bus. Excellent WiFi for working remotely.

The space
This sunny, spacious one-bedroom apartment has its own front entrance and side terrace with café table, tucked on the first floor of our two-family home. We’ve furnished it with New England antiques to complement the brand new kitchen and modern bath with shower. New queen bed perfect for one or two guests. Full kitchen with stove, dishwasher and microwave. We follow Airbnb’s enhanced cleaning protocols.

This is a dream apartment for those coming to explore Cambridge, visit the universities, or see all of Boston. Nestled in an upscale residential neighborhood, it is a foodie’s haven with artisanal bakery, gourmet cheese shop, old fashion butch
neighborhood_overview: West Cambridge is a hot neighborhood at the moment, with great urban amenities and excellent green spaces. Nestled between the historic homes of Brattle St, the unique shops of Huron Village and the green spaces of Fresh Pond reservoir and Danehy Park, there's lots to do and see. Jog or walk the 2 mile loop around the Pond, explore historic neighborhoods and sample the many interesting food shops. Or wander down to Harvard Square and all the university has to offer with museums and bookstores galore. Major retailers like Whole Foods and Starbucks are also a short walk away.
host_about:
I have lived in Cambridge for over 20 years.  I moved here for graduate school at Harvard and never left.  Currently, I'm a baker and  pastry chef  ( (Hidden by Airbnb) @hazelnama ) working part time in local bakeries.   However, my primary job is raising our six year old son.

I love to travel and have been all over world (most of that before having a child).  My partner and I spend a good deal of time in Maine but are plotting trips much further out as our son gets a little older.  

As a host I'm very accessible but mostly hands off.  I'm more than happy to answer any questions, point you in the direction of great restaurants or sights but tend to let our guests enjoy the space as they like.

This private space is a basement unit. It has its own bathroom and wonderful amenities including granite counters for kitchenette area. Large, lovely renovated apartment with peaceful garden. Nice space to read, work or relax.

Guest access

License number
C0234160491

name: Luxury Harvard/MIT Victorian
description:
Newly remodeled Victorian with all the Victorian charm, yet modern convenience in the best location. Our home features traditional soapstone counters and sink, luxury Japanese soaking tub with a huge rainfall showerhead, coffee machine to get you going in the morning, and tons of charm. Perfect for 4-5 Adults +/- children

The space
Our home is a two bedroom in a beautiful 124 year old Victorian home surrounded by a beautifully gardened yard. We’ve just completed extensive remodeling to a modern style while paying homage to and by preserving much of its Victorian elements and charm.

Our home easily accommodate 4-5 adults. We do have an high end queen sized stay firm inflatable airbed for guests with children/teens if needed.

Inside we have two bedrooms each with queen sized beds with luxury mattresses. Either or both of the rooms can be setup for you to be a work-space/office configuration complete with internet, large screen monitors, ke
neighborhood_overview:
Nestled up to Harvard and surrounds the neighborhood is quiet, well established, and beautiful with a lot of history and many famous residents past and current.

Located in the neighborhood of Cambridge called Huron Village, the home is blocks away from the historic Longfellow house, Harvard, MIT, Radcliffe, Leslie and the entire area exudes Victorian charm.

There is easy and quick access to local stores, tree lines streets, and it offers exceptionally easy access to all things Cambridge and Boston, no car required!
host_about:
I love anything with a story behind it.  I really enjoy any sort of cultural event and great conversation.

In Phoenix, we have tried to provide the perfect sanctuary to get away and yet still see everything the city has to offer for events, shopping, dining, and natural beauty.  North Scottsdale near Kierland is absolutely the perfect location to be.

In Cambridge/Boston we are working with a 124-year-old Victorian.    It's beautiful with a lot of New England charm.   Many homes of the type in the area are gut remodeled and turned into condos or modern style living spaces.  We are working hard to maintain its hand-built Victorian charm while greening its infrastructure where possible and protecting it for future generations.   It's literally an antique we feel more like stewards than owners of.

We are now sharing these homes with others and using any money we earn to further the renovation projects.   We hope to meet people that will continue with us on this journey and get to enjoy things each time they come back as we further improve the spaces for all to enjoy.

description:
Tucked away in the coveted Agassiz neighborhood, this Philadephia-style apartment is located on a charming side street. With one bedroom located on the second floor of this 1900 Victorian house, guests have ample privacy within the apartment.
★ 1 mile from Harvard Square and 5 blocks from Porter Square
★ Within 3 blocks: Star Market (grocery store), Harvard Law School, Giulia's, Hi-Rise Bakery and shops
★ Live like a local and come home to 17 Traymore after a day in the city!

The space
♦ Walk Score® of 90 - "Walker's Paradise"
♦ Transit Score® of 80 - "Excellent Transit"
♦✔Traveling with a car? The driveway parking space is available to rent for $15/night. (2 cars is $25/night.) This ensures hassle-free, convenient parking with no parking tickets in a city that heavily tickets. Let me know if you would like that option anytime prior to your check-in date.

♦ Onsite ✔washer/dryer w ✔detergent and ✔fabric softner
neighborhood_overview:
Here are my personal recommendations: airbnb.com/things-to-do/rooms/6363476

✷ Located in the Agassiz neighborhood, 1 of 13 neigborhoods in Cambridge.
✷ Includes a large chunk of Harvard University, including the Harvard Museum of Natural History and Peabody Museum of Archaeology and Ethnology.
✷ Academic buildings and student housing sit alongside Victorian wood-frame houses. ✷ Small, moderate-density residential neighborhood with around 5,000 residents.
✷ Harvard Square and Porter Square (both major commercial and transit centers) lie at either end of the neighborhood
✷ Massachusetts Avenue, which connects the two squares, serves as the neighborhood’s retail center.
✷ Universities are a major presence in the neighborhood, which contains academic and student housing facilities for both Harvard University and Lesley University.
✷ To the east, Agassiz shares a border with the city of Somerville.
host_about: Hello! I'm Kimberly. Originally from Syracuse, NY, I have lived in Cambridge for over 20 years and can brave any New England winter. This suburban city stole my heart from Day 1. My passion is being a mother to my 14 and 13 year old, and my 2 year old Mini Schnauzer. I love food in general (cooking, eating, reading about…), cross-stitching and dreaming about traveling the world.

name: Big 2 bedroom, steps to Davis Sq
description:
Spacious, sunny 2 bedroom, 6 room 1st floor of two-family, private entrance.
7-minute walk to Davis Sq & T-station, 1 min to Mass Ave bus. Queen and twin bed, Ful furnshd din rm, livrm, kit, washer/dryer.
Grt Location! (no pets) 4 month minimum stay!

The space
Large North Cambridge apartment, hardwood floors with original cherry & gumwood trim. Spacious living room and and dining room make it a comfortable space to relax after work or sight seeing or visiting. Well-appointed kitchen makes it easy to prepare a meal or just enjoy take out. On nice summer evening the back porch is a delightful place for dinner, cocktails, or just enjoying the yard and quiet. We can provide an additional inflatable mattress if needed.

Guest access
You have the full use of the first floor and back porch. The basement and upper floors are the owner's space, so please respect that.
neighborhood_overview:
North Cambridge ( NoCa) is a wonderful quiet neighborhood, and Hollis is one of the nicest streets in NoCa! It is a one way street, and traffic on the street is pretty light. Massachusetts ave is just abut 100 yards up, and within a 5 minute walk you will find many fine restaurants ( two sushi, one Greek, one Italian, one Vietnamese- French, one steak house, one Chinese), a produce market, a dry cleaner, and three banks. There is a CVS in Porter square, about a 10 minute walk on Mass Avenue, and the MINUTE CLINIC there is open 8am- 7 pm.
Additionally, at the end of Rindge Avenue end of Hollis, you will find branch of the Cambridge Public Library, and great play ground with both toddler and "big kid" sections, ball fields, and tennis courts.
And if you are looking for more night life, Davis Square, with a huge variety of restaurants, bars, gift shops, and hipsters, is about a 7 minute walk.

Minimum Monthly Stay and price reflects this.

The space
This is not an apartment primarily occupied by renters/owners and then vacated for guests - it is a dedicated guest apartment and as such, it is clean and uncluttered and you won't feel as if you are invading someone else's space.

Picture this: You’ve strolled the tree-lined streets of Cambridge. You’ve had some delicious food from one of the many, many excellent restaurants in the area. You’ve browsed the aisles of the Harvard Book Store, had some coffee, people watched, maybe gone on a local history tour. Now it's time to come home to an apartment so cosy, so comfortable, so quiet that you will immediately kick off your

description:
This exquisite property is a modern full-service 17 story high-rise building located in the heart of Kendall Square. Property amenities include 24 hour concierge services, a fitness club, and a Zen Garden.

The space
Apartments offer panoramic views, over-sized closets, and designer kitchens. Your fully appointed apartment is furnished with all the necessities of home, including linens & towels, and an individual washer/dryer.

Property amenities include:

• 24-hour, full-service concierge
• Zen garden
• Dry cleaning
• Fitness center (fee)

The Living Room includes a sofa with pullout bed, club chair, an entertainment center
neighborhood_overview: This property is located in the heart of Kendall Square, an award winning neighborhood marked as a global center for innovation and cutting edge technology next to MIT. Dubbed as one of the most exciting places to live, work, shop and play in the Boston area, this walkable community is situated just one subway stop on the Red Line from Beacon Hill, two stops from Harvard Square and on the banks of the Charles River.
host_location: New York, New York, United States
host_about:
We have been providing vacation rental apartments for over 10 years across the East Coast. We are known for our distinctively furnished apartments in popular locations, and for our attentive service. You’ll find that our rates are quite reasonable. If you're looking for a safe, comfortable place with fabulous amenities and Wi-Fi (we know you need the Wi-Fi!) in the Boston MA area, Washington DC, Miami FL or very close to NYC in Jersey City or Hoboken, we'd love to host you. Many of the buildings where our apartments are located feature amenities such as beautiful lobbies, 24 hour front desk staff, fitness centers, business centers, recreation rooms, indoor or outdoor pools and whirlpools. If you are traveling with children, some buildings offer playgrounds (many buildings are near public playgrounds as well) or indoor playrooms. Depending on the location, you can stay for just a few days, a week, a month or more. 

We offer an assortment of short-term apartments in sizes ranging from a studio to three bedrooms that are fully furnished with all the comforts of home. Our local staff meticulously prepares your apartment before your arrival, and we offer 24 hour assistance for any emergencies after business hours. When you arrive at your apartment, the beds will be made, towels and bath amenities will be stocked in the bathrooms, and the coffee maker will be set up in the kitchen with some sample coffees, sweetener and creamer (teabags too if that is your preference) to start your morning off properly. If you’d like to cook a meal, the kitchen is stocked with dishes, cutlery, glassware and pots and pans. The living room is set up with a TV and cable channels, and the Wi-Fi router password and instructions will be prominently displayed so you can get connected quickly. You can also make local and toll-free phone calls at no charge. 

Please contact us to confirm the exact availability of the apartment you are interested in. We’d love to host you (and your family) for your vacation or business trip.

name: Top floor apt with deck-brand new kitchen!
description:
1200 sq ft condo in Cambridgeport-- perfect base for exploring Boston area. Located on a quiet street. 5 min walk to Charles river, 10 min to T, 15 min to MIT, 20 min to Harvard. Spacious, fully-furnished deck. Next to park. Lots of light. Internet. Although not shown in the pictures, we just had our kitchen re-done and it's brand new!

The space
We love this space -- it's our home, and I hope you like it as much as we do. It's a spacious open layout with lots of light, and a fully furnished deck that overlooks a local park -- great for relaxing in the summertime! We love to cook and have full size kitchen with tons of counter space and a chef-style gas stove. The master bedroom has its own full bath.

Guest access
You're welcome to use all appliances and rooms in the space. Some cabinets, chest of drawers, and closets we've placed off limits but there will be plenty of space for your stuff! In the kitchen you are welcome to all the pots/pans
neighborhood_overview: The cambridgeport area is a part of Cambridge located between MIT and Harvard close to the river. It's a quieter residential area but very close to tons of things to do. The neighborhood is a mix of young professionals, students, and families. You will be very close to MIT and only 5 minutes away from the Charles River. In addition, there are two grocery stores (Trader Joe's and Whole Foods) a 10 minute walk away. Central Square is a 10-15 minute walk.
host_about: I'm a 37 year old science professional and former postdoctoral fellow at harvard medical school in Boston, MA. Originally from Canada and been living in Boston for a little over 9 years. Love to travel, play soccer and always open to new types of cuisine.

name: 2BR Walk to Harvard/MIT/Red Line T
description:
Second floor 2 bedroom just outside Central Square.

Around the corner from Lamplighter Brewery and Longfellows Coffee shop!

Each bedroom has a queen bed. Dining room w/table for eight (ten squished), and one full size futon. Two futons in LR.

Adorable deck for wine/morning coffee. Short walk to MIT/Harvard/Central/Inman/Red Line T (subway), WiFi, stocked kitchen. 2 day weekend minimum. Friday and Saturday nights must book together. Parking available. Check in after 4pm, checkout by 11am.

The space
Please read the entire description, rules, etc., for the listing.

Location, location, location!!!

Walk to Central Square and the Red Line T (5 min), Inman Square (10 min), MIT (15 min), and Harvard (20 min).

Next door to Lamplighter Brewery and Longfellows Coffee shop!

There's a large park a block away with playground, basketball courts, and sprinklers for the kids on a hot summer day. A
neighborhood_overview:
Great restaurants and nightlife in Central Square, even more great restaurants and nightlife in Inman Square. We're halfway between the two.

I'm around the corner from Lamplighter Brewery and Longfellows Coffee shop!!!

Don't miss Christina's... the best malted vanilla ice cream in Cambridge! Ok, Tosci's is amazing ice cream too. And J. P. Lick's, Ben & Jerry's, Lizzy's, Cold Stone Creamery... OK, so we have good ice cream in Cambridge :-)

Whole Foods is three blocks away, Shaw's supermarket eight blocks. Two bodegas each one block away and a 24 hour Quik-E-Mart three blocks away. Six blocks to H-Mart. Best. Asian. Supermarket. Ever.

If you throw a rock in Cambridge you'll hit a smart person. But please, don't throw rocks!!!

name: Single family house / Cambridgeport
description:
A charming single family home in walking distance to MIT/Harvard and a stone's throw from Boston. 2000 sq feet, big enclosed yard with outdoor eating, trampoline and small garden. Five bedroom, 21/2 bath, living & family rooms, refinished basement w/play space. Driveway (2 cars) & laundry in unit. Some pets okay. AC. Ask about dates if not listed; we can be flexible. Additional guests are possible for a small fee; please let us know. Family friendly: games and bikes are available for use.

The space
This recently renovated single-family home with a big enclosed yard (with trampoline) and driveway with parking for 2 cars is a rare find in Cambridgeport— within walking distance to MIT and Harvard and Boston is just 2 T stops away. Our home is cozy, clean, and fun and perfect for families w/kids and larger groups.
On the first floor is the living room (with TV/DVD player but no cable), kitchen (fully equipped with gas stove, espresso maker, blender, cooking
neighborhood_overview: In our Cambridgeport neighborhood, you can walk to restaurants, cafes, and shops in Central and Harvard Squares, grocery stores (Whole Foods and Trader Joes), and the Charles River.  Dana Park (with sprinkler, playground and space to walk dogs) is a block away in this family-friendly neighborhood, rich in diversity and culture.  You can bike into Boston along the Charles, go to the Red Sox, ride the swan boats in the Boston Common, visit the MFA, Aquarium, Science Museum, and much more!
host_about: I am a Middle Grade/Young Adult writer (Dear Blue Sky) and editor, and I teach at Harvard Summer School and Harvard Extension School.  Check out my website: (Website hidden by Airbnb) for more info.  I love to read, play soccer, swim, hike, bike, watch TV series, go to the beach, and travel when we can.  My husband is the Director of the Writing Program at Boston University, and we have 4 children (17, 15, 12, and 10).  Our favorite destinations are Martha's Vineyard, NH, Chautauqua, and northern CA.  Our motto: Life is good!

description:
COVID-19. What can we say? The house is small, but clean, comfortable and pleasing. The new (2019) bathroom is shared but "really nice". The Airbnb bedroom faces the back of the house for extra privacy, light-cancelling shades and a Persian carpet. Enjoy relaxing, reading, watching TV. in a glass room that closes off to give you a sensation of complete privacy, yet surrounded by trees and sky. We miss you!

The space
The room is located to the rear of the house and the single (one person) bed is on a solid maple platform frame with quality mattress and and cotton/linen sheets for added luxury in this modest but well-maintained home. The room also includes a desk, closet and dresser.

Guest access
Guests may access the entire house including beautiful glass conservatory, kitchen, living and dining room. And if you need to iron something, I have that also. The residence has WIFI. Carolina and I are friendly, but we also keep a
neighborhood_overview: This unique urban neighborhood has a suburban feel, yet  minutes from Harvard Square and enjoys the amenities of both.   Located on a "no outlet" tree-lined street, there is very little traffic, but Trader Joe's, Whole Foods, and retail stores are all within comfortable walking distance.    A public library and upscale shopping/eating venues are also within walking distance.    If you enjoy running or a leisure walk in a wooded area,  Fresh Pond park and Golf Course is practically at your doorstep.  And there is a Burger King close by if you have that craving.
host_about: Outgoing, accomodating and helpful.   My personal interests include travel and playing American folk music on the fife.   Very active with a healthy circle of friends, but enjoy the quietness of my home.    Commute to work on a bike.   Have hosted international students since 1994 and enjoy introducing visitors to the wonders of Cambridge, Boston and New England.

The space
This is a truly beautiful brick building overlooking the park. It is one of the lovliest buildings in Cambridge both for the architecture and for the location. We have the quiet of a top floor apartment but right in the midst of Harvard. We are 1/16th of a mile from the Law School and a four minute walk to the Harvard Square Red Line or the central part of Harvard Yard.

This listing is for the entire 2 bedroom apartment. There is appx. 2000 Sq feet and it is large and well designed. We have a child and there are toys to play with if you are traveling with a child or two.

name: Warm and welcoming
description:
Warm, cheerful sunny atmosphere in a great location. Quiet residential neighbourhood. Close to Harvard, Inman and Central squares; close to public transportation, great restaurants, access to many other amenities.
Please know that there is a second bedroom that accommodates one person and when booked the bathroom is shared with them.

The space
The space is my home and I take pride in keeping it clean. I hope that guests will find it comfortable and know that they are welcomed. Please clean up after yourself, especially the sinks in the bathroom and kitchen. This is much appreciated.

Guest access
Guests can have access to the kitchen, but this does not include cooking facilities. You are welcome to sit at the table in the kitchen to eat as well use the fridge. I always offer a range of teas, cookies and fruit that you are invited to have while staying here.
The rest of the house is private and not for guests use.

Othe
neighborhood_overview: The house is conveniently located with restaurants, whole foods and Walgreens a stone's throw away.
host_about:
I love to travel, meet people from all around the world. I enjoy reading, music, movies and spicy food.
I have loved visiting Italy, Hungary, Turkey and Mexico to name some.
You will find me warm and helpful as host.
My life motto is to treat others as I would like to be treated by them.

We are surrounded by parks and subway stops T. Walking distance to Porter Square, Davis Square , Alewife, Harvard Square, Davis Square, and several parks ( Fresh pond, Danehy, Russel Field, St Peter's, Cedar, Raymond), the Minuteman Bike Path ( takes you all the way to Lexington). it is 35 minutes walk ( 2.5 miles) to Harvard square and 5 minutes walk to a free Tennis/basketball court offered by our beautiful city of Cambridge. Walking distance to many restaurants, cafes and 2 movie theaters.

We are less than half a mile (0.4) from Massachusetts Avenue ( Mass Ave), along Mass Ave, restaurants that are very close are Frank’s steak house ( American Style cuisine) , Qingdao Garden (Chinese takeout or dine in).; Greek Corner ( Greek Style cuisine). Visit our Guidebook for more choices.

Walking few minutes more towards Davis Square, you have Spoke (Wine bar and delicate small plates); Meju (Korean food); Martsa on Elm (Tibetan food) ; The Painted Burro (Mexican f
host_about: We have lived in Cambridge for 20 years and know the city very well. We love to dine out and can provide restaurant recommendations. We work for state government and high tech and know the local universities. We also have a young teenage son who plays sports and is very social. We love hosting friends and family and have an open door policy. We love it when our friends drop in for coffee.

name: Modern Furnished 2-Bedroom Apt in Kendall Square
description:
Design and sophistication describe this apartment and the Kendall Square area. Enjoy the panoramic views from your home, its spacious floor plan, the designer kitchen, and oversized windows and closets. This top-notch community next to the Charles River offers a modern fitness center, concierge services, a Zen garden, a lush clubhouse, and a sundeck.

The space
Live in the most exciting and vibrant neighborhood of Massachusetts. Kendall Square is a brimming area with cutting edge technology, science, design, innovation, creative restaurants, and fist-class shopping and is only a couple of metro stations away from downtown Boston. The apartment is located in a modern high-rise boasting spectacular views and world-class resident amenities including a Zen garden, a clubhouse, and full-time concierge services. The moment you walk in your apartment you will fall in love with the stylish interiors and designer kitchen with stainless steel appliances, the panoramic view
neighborhood_overview:
Leading academic institutions like MIT, innovative restaurants with all types of cuisine, a big selection of shopping centers, and the proximity to the Kendal/MIT metro make this apartment your perfect headquarters to explore Cambridge and Boston.
