name: Pet Friendly Flat, Relaxed & Cozy Near Radcliffe
description:
This raised first floor unit in an historic Harlowe building is the perfect home base to enjoy Cambridge/Boston & all of New England, conduct your research, work from home, teach your course, or just relax in the many public open spaces or our building's quiet private back yard. Sidewalks and roads in this area are always very clear in the winter making it easy to be outdoors.

I love this very pet friendly building and all my neighbors, as well as this beautiful neighborhood.

The space
A mostly owner-occupied condo building (I own & generally live in this flat). Use of the master bedroom for two; additional cost per person for the single bed, guest room & sofa; up to 3 people total. Use of 3 full-sized closets.

Two small dogs live here but will not be present when guests rent. One pet under 20 lbs allowed with a signed waiver & refundable damage deposit.

Guest access
Wifi, television, Apple TV.

Full sized ki
neighborhood_overview:
Incredible location between Harvard Square, the Law School, the Observatory, and the Charles River.

I love listening to the amazing conversations as I'm out and about, or even sitting in my living room with the windows open. Most of my neighbors are retired professors, researchers, or graduate students. An interesting number of architects as well.

Harvard, MIT and Tufts host fascinating lectures and short courses that are open to the public and feature some of the greatest minds in the world.

The Harvard Observatory is a two minute walk from the flat. They host star gazing events on a regular basis.
host_about: I live in Cambridge, MA and work in higher education and am slowly working through a doctorate.  For fun I travel and snowboard. I am both an airbnb host and frequent traveller.

name: Smack dab between Harvard+Porter 2
description:
This owner-occupied Victorian duplex is on a quiet, leafy, safe street AND a short 3 blocks from bustling Massachusetts Avenue: a 10 minute walk to Harvard Square and 5 minutes to Porter Square.
Your room has a double real bed. You are on the third floor, peaceful, cozy and quiet, right among the tree tops. At night you have the stars, and by day the room is light and sunny. Airy, modern kitchen, leafy yard, washer/dryer, wifi.

The space
The room is cozy, with wide, old pine board flooring, sky light with a room-darkening shade, closet, dresser, large desk with office supplies, yoga mat, full length mirror, a/c (when necessary) and a fan. This bedroom shares a full bathroom with the other third floor bedroom, Smack Dab 1. (FYI: there are 2 other bathrooms in the house). An iron and ironing board are available. I provide soap, shampoo, conditioner, body lotion, first aid kit and other essentials.
PLEASE NOTE: your room is 29 stairs up 2 uncarpete
neighborhood_overview:
This neighborhood is very special in that it is quiet, you can hear birdsong most times of the day, there are lovely gardens all around. And you will be just 3 blocks from Massachusetts Avenue (Mass Ave), the busiest street in Boston/Cambridge. Or, if you are here in winter, the quiet of the cold air is lovely too, and if we are lucky, you'll see snow!

Along Mass Ave, you can walk to many local run businesses of every sort: gift shops (Joie de Vivre, Nomad, Abodeon, Tokai), coffee shops (Simons, Hi-Rise, Starbucks) and so many restaurants of every ethnicity (Indian, Japanese, Thai, Italian, Mexican, American). You can take a walk from here to the Charles River, through Harvard Square. You can stroll down Mass Ave to Central Square where there is a whole new world waiting for you, but just as Cambridge as any other place! Somerville is just minutes away too (Davis Square, Inman Square, Union Square), and it is an amazingly rich community for music, food and funky shops
host_about:
Hello!  

I've lived in Cambridge for 30 years.  I am an artist;  I paint, draw and sculpt.   I am a rather quiet person, with a good sense of humor.   I live with two cats, Aiko and Minkah.  They are friendly, interested in people and they are very good friends to each other. 

I love living in Cambridge.  It's a rather small town with so much to offer.  Boston is also very close by, accessible by the subway, bus or Uber.  There's so much to see and do there as well!    

This is quite an amazing neighborhood and I really love sharing it with people.  It is good to remember the ocean is also near-by and it is accessible either in the city, or in its more natural state, by subway, rail or bus.  There are countless historical sites, museums, restaurants and shopping experiences in the area.  

I hope you will consider visiting Cambridge!

name: Cambridge Cottage - Garden Room
description:
Private room in a cozy cottage 1.4 miles from Harvard and/or from MIT and .8 miles from Central Square MBTA stop. Quiet off-street location and private garden space to relax with your morning coffee. Kitchen access included, air conditioner and a whole-house water filter. Please note - we recently painted the house bright blue! New photos coming soon.

The space
The space is a private room in a two-story small house with a view of the garden. Two bedrooms, the kitchen and a shared bathroom are on the first floor. The term "cozy" means this is a small cottage with a homey feel but there is no common living area except the tiny kitchen with a small counter and stools for sitting. It will, however, give you a taste of real home life in Cambridge (we raised 4 kids in this home!) We stay on the second floor when we're in town. The garden patio table and chairs are a wonderful place to relax with your morning coffee or for an evening meal in warm weather.
neighborhood_overview: The house is located near Inman Square in Cambridge, 1.4 miles from Harvard to the west and MIT to the south. Inman Square is a vibrant neighborhood with dozens of restaurants with every kind of cuisine and atmosphere.  The Central Square (Red Line) MBTA stop is 0.8 miles away - about a 15 minute walk.
host_about: My wife Elaine and I have been long-term residents of Cambridge, and we love sharing our enthusiasm for our vibrant city.  We live a healthy, organic lifestyle, and my wife loves to grow herbs, veggies and flowers in our tiny front yard garden.  We both enjoy music, nature, and meeting new people!

Take a walk around Fresh Pond Reservoir, exercise in Danehy Park, shop at Whole Foods and Trader Joe's. A mile and a half from Harvard with a private parking place, this apartment is a perfect base for your short term visit.

The space
This apartment accommodates up to six and is ideal for a family or group looking for a high quality extended stay. Simply yet elegantly furnished two bedroom with two full bathrooms (master bath has a large shower, other bathroom has a tub and washer/dryer). Pull-out queen-size sofabed. Gourmet kitchen fully equipped for cooking.

Guest access

Other things to note

Due to Covid concerns, soft accessor
neighborhood_overview: A stone's throw away, yet hidden from the bustle of Fresh Pond Parkway, this apartment is within walking distance of shops and restaurants, including Trader Joe's, Whole Foods, Chipotle, TJ Maxx, and a movie theater. Equally accessible to two of Cambridge's largest green spaces -- Fresh Pond Reservoir and Danehy Park. Close to public transportation (subway & bus) to take you anywhere around Cambridge and Boston. For the adventurous, ride along the Minuteman Bikeway from Alewife out to historic Lexington and Bedford.
host_about:
Travelling is a passion of mine.   I love to experience new places, new foods and meet new people.   Having lived in Brazil, Japan, Thailand and many years here in the United States I appreciate diverse viewpoints and customs.    Getting helpful insight from friendly locals makes any stay so much richer.

For my day job, I develop multifamily housing.   I am interested in creating living solutions that allow residents to pursue their passions and interests while having a smaller environmental footprint.    To that end, I am involved in a startup that uses architectural robotics to create transformable spaces.

As a father of five, I am a family man.   I appreciate the challenges and joys of travelling with family.    My wife and I took our children down the Silk Road on a 3 week hand carry only trip.   Getting good local advice can be critical to making a stay pleasant and rewarding for every member of the family.

Private bedroom with private bathroom and your own private living room on the 2nd floor of our solar-powered house near Davis Square. All within a 10 minute walk to the subway, restaurants, and shopping.

Property registered with city of Cambridge (Reg# 13334) and Commonwealth of Massachusetts (ROT: 15213091-005, Certificate C0090430491).

The space
The house was built in 1863 yet gut-renovated in 2015 with modern amenities (including solar panels, making your stay here carbon-neutral). The space is designed exceptionally well for privacy so you can have as much (or as little) as you want. You will be the only guests since we only rent to one party at a time. The first floor is common area with the owners and consists of an open living room, dining room, and modern kitchen, all with hardwood floors. Th
neighborhood_overview: Although Davis Square is technically in neighboring Somerville, our home is within walking distance (less than 10 minutes). At one point, Details magazine listed Davis Square as one of the hippest neighborhoods in the country.
host_about:
We are a gay couple in our 40's living in Cambridge, Massachusetts (Davis Square area).  We also own a summer house near Ogunquit, ME, that we also rent out.

Our interests include travel, architecture, wine, board games and cards games, and dinners out with friends.

We lived in Tokyo, Japan, for two years and that's where we got our start using AirBnB - as hosts and guests. We've also lived in various parts of the United States; including Boston, Cape Cod, and Salem (MA), Roanoke (VA), plus San Francisco and Irvine (CA).

neighborhood_overview: A stone's throw away, yet hidden from the bustle of Fresh Pond Parkway, this apartment is within walking distance of shops and restaurants, including Trader Joe's, Whole Foods, Chipotle, TJ Maxx, and a movie theater. host_about:
Travelling is a passion of mine.   I love to experience new places, new foods and meet new people.   Having lived in Brazil, Japan, Thailand and many years here in the United States I appreciate diverse viewpoints and customs.    Getting helpful insight from friendly locals makes any stay so much richer.

For my day job, I develop multifamily housing.   I am interested in creating living solutions that allow residents to pursue their passions and interests while having a smaller environmental footprint.    To that end, I am involved in a startup that uses architectural robotics to create transformable spaces.

As a father of five, I am a family man.   I appreciate the challenges and joys of travelling with family.    My wife and I took our children down the Silk Road on a 3 week hand carry only trip.   Getting good local advice can be critical to making a stay pleasant and rewarding for every member of the family.

name: Lovely room: walk to  Harvard Square with parking
description:
It's a short walk to Central and Harvard Square. The room is lovely and quiet with high ceilings, two windows, wood floors, and a comfortable queen sized bed. There is a bureau, two chairs, and mirrors. The full bath is shared with myself and my daughter. There is a closet with hangers for your clothing and two of the bureau drawers are empty and available for you. There is an electric kettle, tea and water in your room as well as a few snacks. Your towels are in a basket in your closet.

The space
My 800 square foot apartment is clean and un cluttered with lovely light and wood floors. I have a sweet cockapoo who lives there. He is very friendly and is a hypoallergenic non shedding dog. I live here with my daughter.
You will share the bathroom with us. You may use it as your own and leave your things there, we do not leave anything in the bathroom when guests are here. There is shampoo, cream rinse, soap and hand lotion available for you. We don't leave our
neighborhood_overview:
Our neighborhood has a tantalizing group of eclectic restaurants of all kinds and many places to have coffee. I have a guest book with menus and maps. The famous Plough and Stars pub is on the corner of Mass Ave and Hancock and they have live music most evenings. Improv Boston is just a few blocks away in Central Square. You can take the train downtown to Park Street to find the nearest theater, or go the Kendall Cinema in Kendall Square.
We are within walking distance of the beautiful recently renovated Harvard Art Museum as well as the Peabody Natural History Museum. If you love bookstores the Harvard Bookstore on Mass Ave is a treat as well as the tiny Grolier Bookstore which has only poetry, a Cambridge classic.
The Lizard Lounge just outside of Harvard Square is well known for its poetry slams on Sunday nights. Passim in Harvard Square is another local favorite if you want to hear folk music. The ART theater has two locations, one in Harvard Square for their main theatr
host_about: I am an actress and improv performer, teacher, writer, mother and dog lover. I love yoga and improv and  I am a vegetarian. I speak French relatively fluently and I love to travel. I practice meditation and I believe in the connectedness of all living beings.

name: Tufts, MIT, Harvard, Davis & Porter Sq. Cambridge!
description:
Comfort and Location! This charming Cambridge apartment is on the first floor of our 2-family home on quiet, pretty Hollis Street, steps from Davis Square (Somerville) and Porter Square (Cambridge), within walking distance to all the universities and main attractions of one of the most vibrant communities in the US! You won't need a car - we are steps from public transportation to Boston, its colleges and medical centers, and all surrounding communities.

The space
This is a legal short-term rental, certified by the City of Cambridge, under its new short-term rental ordinance.

The apartment is perfect for visiting faculty or graduate students and their families interested in a longer-term rental of a month or more. Additional bedrooms in our "Tree Top Suite" are available on our third floor, connected to the first floor apartment via a stairway, for an additional charge. Just ask if you need more than 2 bedrooms for your stay. See the third floor
neighborhood_overview:
This is a safe neighborhood with a lot of open space. Besides our yard, which is considered large by city standards, there is a school with public playing fields, two playgrounds, and public tennis courts at the end of the street on Rindge Avenue. Right around the corner, on Sherman Street, there is a giant public park - Danehy Park - with playgrounds and playing fields, trails for walking and jogging, and in the winter, a giant hill for sledding.

The location gets even more perfect....You can get easily anywhere and everywhere from Hollis Street without a car. Walk, bike, or take public transportation. You will be close to the major universities, museums, medical centers, and other attractions of the Boston- Cambridge area. Hip Davis Square (Somerville) is just short five -minute walk, with its historic movie theater and great restaurants. There are many other restaurants right around the corner on Massachusetts Avenue, like Urban Kitchen (American), Café Barada (Middle
host_about:
I'm a college professor, with a husband and 3 grown kids and we live in Cambridge and in Harwich Port Massachusetts  We have two nice places to stay when you visit Massachusetts - a cottage by the sea on Cape Cod and and lovely 2 bedroom first floor apartment in our two family home in Cambridge. 

Regarding our Cape Cod listing:
My mother and her family began renting a cottage on Ocean Avenue back in the 1920s  when she was a teenager and she and my father  bought a cottage on this street in 1954. In the early 1960s, they purchased "The Cape Codder".  We were fortunate to be able to spend many of our summers as children in this neighborhood, which has not changed much since that time.  Generations of the same families return every season to this place we all call "home" as it is filled with memories of relaxed childhood summers with our extended families.  We look forward to sharing this experience with others!

Regarding our Cambridge listing:
Part of my mother's family emigrated to Cambridge at the turn of last century from Co. Kerry, Ireland, taking up residence in our Hollis Street neighborhood that was once called "Little Dublin". Her cousins became successful funeral home owners and leaders in the Cambridge community. This neighborhood was also home to the famous House Speaker, "Tip" O'Neil, and has a rich history, dating back to the Revolutionary War. The first floor apartment where my parents once lived has been renovated and is now available for guests.

I like to travel, garden, and be near the ocean!

name: 1BR duplex, walking distance to Harvard Sq.
description:
Fully furnished & equipped 2 level 1 BR with short walks to Harvard & Porter Sq. Set back in a quite side street. Proximity to Hi-Rise bakery, restaurants and bars. Unit has a separate entrance through patio unique to the unit. Free on street parking.

The space
This addition to the main house, is a dedicated guest apartment and as such, it is very clean and uncluttered, so it will feel like your own space and you don't have to be afraid of invading someone's privacy.

Picture this: You spend a day outside, in Cambridge and Boston, exploring all the different shops, restaurants and cafes around the area.

You explored the broad variety of Harvard's book stores, had some coffee, people watched, maybe did one of the fun themed history city tours. Now it is time to go back home, to relax in this cosy and quiet apartment, take off your shoes, kick back on the comfy couch and reminisce about the great day you had.

Sink into the couch,

You will be renting a large multi-level townhome with 3 bedrooms PLUS a sleeping loft PLUS a separate studio. It's conveniently located 1 block from Harvard University's campus and a 12-minute walk to the Harvard Sq T.

The space
Our space has two units including a 3 bedroom+ Loft and a separate studio unit. Great for larger groups and families.

The larger space has high ceilings, hardwood floors and a nice backyard for entertaining. The space has three bedrooms including master suite with queen mattress, two separate bedrooms each with a full size bed, and a sleeping loft with a twin size bed.

The second space is a studio that was recently painted, tastefully decorated, has a large king size bed and easily accommodates two additional guests.

Please take a few minutes to look at the pictures to get a better sense of t

description:

The space
This is a bright and spacious room with skylights, a seating area in

a balcony, queen-sized bed, air conditioning, 19-inch flat screen tv with

Guest access
You have your own private bedroom and bathroom. There is a nice back porch off your room. You are welcome to use the kitchen and dining area, and store your luggage in the spare room.

If you are here for a week or more, I can do some laundry for you. There are also laundromats nearby.

Sunny, treed oasis one block from the best restaurants and coffee shops and the heart of Central Square. Walking distance to MIT and Harvard, it's the perfectly equipped pied-a-terre complete w/ Juliette balcony. Great location! Covered parking available. 6 mo/min.

The space
This is an amazingly well-equipped, well-located, homey and comfortable nicely furnished unit, complete with linens, fully tricked out kitchen - everything you need in a home!

It's a sunny, treed oasis one block from the best restaurants and coffee shops and the heart of thriving Central Square. Walking distance to MIT and Harvard. Two blocks to the Red Line or Whole Foods. Everything you can think of is at your fingertips. The location is just outstanding.

The 430 ft.² studio living space is a bright and spacious thanks to a wall of glass and your very own Juliette balcony you can step out onto from the main room to see what the weather's doing. The kitchen is a very
neighborhood_overview: Central Square is vibrant and alive with all the best restaurants, clubs, coffee shops, bookstores - you name it. one block from the best restaurants and coffee shops and the heart of thriving Central Square. Whether you are just looking to get all your errands and shopping done or you want to go out and hear live music or browse vintage vinyl or books at an authentic locally-owned bookstore or take a dance class - you name it, it's all here and all just steps away from the apartment. We are walking distance to Harvard. Two blocks to the red line or Whole Foods. Everything you can think of is at your fingertips. The location is just outstanding. Ask and we're happy to advise/recommend.
host_about: I'm from Cambridge. I work in the Motion Picture Industry. I speak English, French, and Spanish. Drop us a line, you'll here back from myself or Nina (my mom). We look forward to hearing from you! Cheers

Hello and welcome!

name: One/Two BR near MIT/Kendall/Harvard
description:
Newly furnished apartment in modern elevator building with fully equipped kitchen. This is a traditional one bedroom apartment configuration; however the living room has lockable doors so it can become a fully private second bedroom. Walk to MIT, Kendall Square or Harvard. Parking available under the building for an extra fee.

The space
This one bedroom unit features a living room that can be used as a second private bedroom. Complete flexibility for use by two or more roommates or as one whole apartment. The living room has a twin bed, along with a queen sofabed and desk. It can be separated from the kitchen/dining area by shutting (and locking) the barn-style doors. The master bedroom has a queen bed, a sofa and a desk. Note that some pictures and the 3D video were taken before the extra bed and desk were added (see captions for more detail).

Guest access
Enclosed parking can be obtained from the building for $15/day.

Ot
neighborhood_overview: Besides being close to MIT and Harvard along with Central, Kendall and Inman Squares, our building is next to nationally-acclaimed restaurants Bondir (right next door) and Oleana (a block away).
host_about:
Travelling is a passion of mine.   I love to experience new places, new foods and meet new people.   Having lived in Brazil, Japan, Thailand and many years here in the United States I appreciate diverse viewpoints and customs.    Getting helpful insight from friendly locals makes any stay so much richer.

For my day job, I develop multifamily housing.   I am interested in creating living solutions that allow residents to pursue their passions and interests while having a smaller environmental footprint.    To that end, I am involved in a startup that uses architectural robotics to create transformable spaces.

As a father of five, I am a family man.   I appreciate the challenges and joys of travelling with family.    My wife and I took our children down the Silk Road on a 3 week hand carry only trip.   Getting good local advice can be critical to making a stay pleasant and rewarding for every member of the family.

name: Entire condo short term rental. June 24- August 7
description:
Entire condo in brick building with character. This is a beautiful condo and users must commit to reading and understanding house rules, in particular how to operate European style windows and the door to the deck.
Users have only access to one bedroom. The owner will be away. Users may cross his bedroom to access the sunny deck.
Close to Central Square, Harvard, MIT, B.U.. Steps away from Whole foods.
Hubway bike rental station is three blocks away.

The space
Works great for one person, loving couple, or two close friends.
There are two bathrooms.
Renting a car for a few days? A guest parking permit may be used for stretches of three consecutive days.

Guest access
Entire Place.
neighborhood_overview:
The house is a 10 minute walk to Central Square in Cambridge.
It takes 15 minutes to walk to Harvard Square.
Ideal location if you need to go to anywhere in Cambridge or downtown Boston.
host_about:
Hello everyone, 
My name is Darko. I grew up in France and I now live in Massachusetts. I love to travel, to meet new people and to explore new countries and cultures.
I think of myself as an  environmentalist and social justice matters to me.
 I love to cook and to try new foods or new restaurants. I started to be an airbnb  host this year, and I love it!
Finally, I'd rather bike than drive!
In addition to French and English, I speak some Croatian and basic Spanish.

Recently re-listed apartment near Porter Square at the end of a quiet road; ideal for academic couple or couple with one child. Modern fully equipped kitchen. Newly refinished and fully furnished. Two private entrances. Great washer and dryer. Television and Wifi.

name: sunny 2-level apt. near Harvard
description:
This cozy, sun-filled, family and pet-friendly apartment is in a Victorian house on a lovely, tree-lined street; 5 blocks to Harvard, 3 blocks to Lesley; close to Tufts. Four blocks to Red Line T station and easy access to downtown Boston, hospitals, MIT. One block to Mass. Ave with great restaurants, coffee houses, shops, bars.
Kitchenette, office area, large bedroom with skylights, reading nook, free wireless, cable, Netflix.
Off-street parking, and use of laundry and yard.

The space
You share the front entrance with onsite owners, but your apartment upstairs is completely private.
Enjoy your living room and kitchen area with refrigerator, cooktop, microwave, and convection toaster oven (no full oven), which are fine for cooking light meals. TV with free premium cable, WIFI, and Netflix are also included. Curl up in the sunny reading nook upstairs, work at the desk, or enjoy the big sky-lit bedroom. There is a table and chairs on the side
neighborhood_overview:
The apartment is on a quiet tree-lined residential one-way street with attractive gardens, but 1 block from Mass. Ave, with lots of wonderful, varied restaurants, shops, coffee houses, and night clubs. It's a lively neighborhood. There are three markets within 4 blocks.
Great area for walking. Harvard and Lesley Universities, university life and grounds (Harvard Yard), museums, historic buildings, entertainment, are short walks away.
Medical facilities close by.
host_about:
My husband and I have lived in this house over 40 years.  We love our neighborhood and community.  We have two sons and 3 grandchildren - who live in New York City.
I am a sociologist, and have worked in employment and education research and program/policy development.  I am retired, on Board of community-based non-profit assisting low income young people of color build their futures.
I continue  to be involved in political and social policy development.  I like theater, dance, walking with our dog, and visiting with our grandkids, continuous learning, and traveling to interesting places.
My husband and I try to be great hosts - helpful but not intrusive.

name: 3Bdr with parking in West Cambridge
description:
Take a walk around Fresh Pond Reservoir, exercise in Danehy Park, shop at Whole Foods and Trader Joe's. A mile and a half from Harvard with a private parking place, this apartment is a perfect base for your short term visit.

The space
This apartment accommodates up to nine and is ideal for a family or group looking for a high quality extended stay. Simply yet elegantly furnished three bedroom with two full bathrooms (master bath has a large shower, other bathroom has a tub and washer/dryer). Pull-out queen-size sofabed and twin airbed. Gourmet kitchen fully equipped for cooking.

Guest access
Apartment is on the second floor (walk up one flight of stairs). One parking space included.

Other things to note
A starter supply of paper goods, detergent, soap, shampoo etc. is provided. Vacuum, hair dryer, iron, ironing board, and cleaning supplies are also available for use. A portacrib/pack-n-play is available for use.
neighborhood_overview: A stone's throw away, yet hidden from the bustle of Fresh Pond Parkway, this apartment is within walking distance of shops and restaurants, including Trader Joe's, Whole Foods, Chipotle, TJ Maxx, and a movie theater. Equally accessible to two of Cambridge's largest green spaces -- Fresh Pond Reservoir and Danehy Park. Close to public transportation (subway & bus) to take you anywhere around Cambridge and Boston. For the adventurous, ride along the Minuteman Bikeway from Alewife out to historic Lexington and Bedford.
host_about:
Travelling is a passion of mine.   I love to experience new places, new foods and meet new people.   Having lived in Brazil, Japan, Thailand and many years here in the United States I appreciate diverse viewpoints and customs.    Getting helpful insight from friendly locals makes any stay so much richer.

For my day job, I develop multifamily housing.   I am interested in creating living solutions that allow residents to pursue their passions and interests while having a smaller environmental footprint.    To that end, I am involved in a startup that uses architectural robotics to create transformable spaces.

As a father of five, I am a family man.   I appreciate the challenges and joys of travelling with family.    My wife and I took our children down the Silk Road on a 3 week hand carry only trip.   Getting good local advice can be critical to making a stay pleasant and rewarding for every member of the family.

name: Charming apt easy walk to Harvard
description:
Bright and spacious renovated 2nd flr apt. Walk to Harvard or Porter sq, run at Reservoir, eat at gourmet shops or bakery close by. One block to Harvard Smithsonian, 15-20 min walk to Harvard square. Eat-in kitchen, dining room, renovated bath, comfy living room.

The space
We welcome you and know you will be comfortable. This is a 2 bedroom one bath apartment. There is a queen bed in the master and two singles in the 2nd bedroom. The apt is complete with everything you need to feel at home: Lovely living room with TV and cable, internet, full dining room, eat-in kitchen with stove, microwave, coffee pot etc.
The second floor has lots of windows and lots of light. There is a.c. in each bedroom.

Guest access
Washer and dryer available for long term guests.

Other things to note
Two night minimum.
We have another similar apartment on the first floor. Please inquire if you have a larger party and need more spac
neighborhood_overview: This is a wonderful walking neighborhood. Harvard sq or Porter sq are about a 20 min walk. There are many cafes and shops close by, a lovely park for a run or walk and good eating in Huron village. Its easy to get to other parts of Cambridge or into Boston.
host_about: Brian and I have lived in Cambridge for many years. We welcome you to our house and the best neighborhood in town. The apt is on the first floor, we live upstairs on the third fl. We travel, but if away will always make sure you have whatever you need.

name: 3Bdr Walkout Apartment near park
description:
Take a walk around Fresh Pond Reservoir, exercise in Danehy Park, shop at Whole Foods and Trader Joe's. A mile and a half from Harvard with a private parking place, this apartment is a perfect base for your short or long term visit.

The space
This apartment accommodates up to nine and is ideal for a family or group looking for a high quality extended stay. Simply yet elegantly furnished three bedroom with two full bathrooms (master bath has a large shower, other bathroom has a tub and washer/dryer). Gourmet kitchen fully equipped for cooking.

Guest access
Apartment is on the first floor of a three story apartment building. One parking space included.

Other things to note
A starter supply of paper goods, detergent, soap, shampoo etc. is provided. Vacuum, hair dryer, iron, ironing board, and cleaning supplies are also available for use. A portacrib/pack-n-play is available for use.

Due to Covid concerns,
neighborhood_overview: A stone's throw away, yet hidden from the bustle of Fresh Pond Parkway, this apartment is within walking distance of shops and restaurants, including Trader Joe's, Whole Foods, Chipotle, TJ Maxx, and a movie theater. Equally accessible to two of Cambridge's largest green spaces -- Fresh Pond Reservoir and Danehy Park. Close to public transportation (subway & bus) to take you anywhere around Cambridge and Boston. For the adventurous, ride along the Minuteman Bikeway from Alewife out to historic Lexington and Bedford.

name: Private Room and Bath, Gym Privileges & Parking!
description:
This really is an amazing place! The condo is beautiful and has a fully stocked kitchen, dining and living room. You'll have a spacious sunny bedroom w/tv and your own private full bath. Add-ons: indoor garage parking, free gym, use of w/d & office equipment.

I'd love to have you stay in my home. I live here with a fabulous, friendly cat who loves guests. Please do not book this room if you don't like cats, are afraid of them, or are allergic to them. I look forward to meeting you! Ciao!!!

The space
It's perfect for a visiting scholar, businessperson on temporary assignment, medical professional or a student attending at schools in the area. You’ll have WiFi and cable tv, and full office facilities are also available if you need them. There is a tv, a big walk-in closet, and there are laundry facilities in the condo. A second bed, a pullout located in the living room, is available if you occasionally have visitors. It can sleep 3 children or 2 ad
neighborhood_overview: This is a beautiful location in Cambridge. You’re just a few steps away from the scenic Charles River and its running and bike paths.  There’s a Whole Foods, a Trader Joe’s, a drugstore, 3 restaurants and a Microcenter (computer and office supplies) on this block, and Sculler’s Jazz Club is right across the river, a 10 minute walk in heels... and did I mention that the best lobster sandwich in Boston is just a block away.
host_about:
I’m an award- winning designer, singer and cook.  And, I'm open to people of all stripes... or polka dots, or color, or gender, or sexual preference. 
I'm a Jersey girl who came to Cambridge as a grad student and never left...  so I can help with local history, lore and information, dining and entertainment suggestions... and if I don’t know something, I know someone who does... and I can guide you to the best lobster sandwich in Boston, just a block away, courtesy of my friends Louie and Mario... and I love meeting new people, like you!

name: Private studio w/ parking by MIT/Harvard/BU/Fenway
description:
Private room, private bath, private entrance! Off-street parking available. Charming, recently renovated Victorian style retreat, queen sized bed, white 650 thread count cotton linens, A/C and free WIFI. Also includes your own fridge & microwave. Next to MIT, Harvard, BU, Kendall Sq, Charles River, Boston, Fenway Park, Red & Green line, Starbucks, Whole Foods & Trader Joe's. This unit is safely located on the 2nd floor. Please let us know if you have mobility issues, as the staircase is narrow.

The space
Feels like a hotel without the hassle. Quiet space to sleep and work. Perfect for traveling professionals.

Guest access
Studio apartment with keyless access through your own private entrance. Private bathroom, wardrobe, fridge, microwave, Keurig machine & free WIFI network. Private staircase leading to the studio is somewhat steep, so please let us know if you have mobility issues and need help with your luggage.

Other things
neighborhood_overview: Our neighborhood is a beautiful place to explore and is walking distance to Harvard, MIT, Central and Kendall Square, BU, Fenway Park, Boston, RED & GREEN lines and the Charles River. Cambridgeport is the part of Cambridge that dips into Boston so you have the best of both worlds.  Our place is walking distance to Boston, including Longwood Medical area, Kenmore Square and Fenway. Try to catch a Red Sox game while you're in town! Come for Harvard, MIT or BU graduation. Perfect place to stay if you're in Boston for the Marathon or Head of the Charles Regatta.
host_about: We are young professionals that enjoy traveling and love living in Cambridge.  We are excited to make your stay with us as comfortable as possible and hope you can experience all of the great restaurants, attractions and opportunities our city has to offer!

The space
This is a great place for a group to treat as home as they visit the Cambridge and Boston areas. It is just a couple blocks from Harvard itself, but that also means it is close to Harvard square- an area of Cambridge with many shops, cafes, restaurants, and a subway stop that will take you straight into the center of Boston in exactly 14 minutes, with no need to change train lines.

You'll have:
-Fresh towels and linens
-High-quality toiletries for every guest
-High-speed wifi
-A fully equipped kitchen
-A Roku TV

Guest access

neighborhood_overview:

This is a great base of operations for groups seeking to visit Harvard, MIT, or Tufts University.

name: Typically Cambridge: Harvard/Porter
description:
Quiet. Convenient. Clean. Tidy. Walk everywhere (there's a Boston/Cambridge bike sharing HUBWAY station nearby where you can rent bikes for a hour or a day). Parking Permit is available for 5- day-or-less guests. If you are staying longer than 5 days it is better not to have a car since the City of Cambridge regulates long-term non-resident parking. It's a 10-minute walk to Harvard Yard. Even closer to the subway/Red Line. Get everywhere quick. Christine is the artist; Matthew the engineer.

The space
We have two rooms, both are on the second floor. Each room has a comfortable desk area for setting up your laptop. There's air-conditioning in the summer. There's one bathroom on the second floor and most likely, if you are our only guest and our daughter is not around, it will be private. There's enough space to do yoga, if you're inclined that way. Room is quiet; beds are comfortable.

Guest access
You enter our house through the front doo
neighborhood_overview: Our neighborhood is typically Cambridge: an assortment of academics, scientists, artists and liberals. There's a real sense of place and history in Cambridge.  The 1973 film LOVE STORY, with Ryan Oneil and Ali McGraw was filmed  right across the street, inside our neighbor's house.
host_about: Artist. Writer. Teacher.
property_type: Private room in bed and breakfast

name: Urban Oasis Near MIT & Harvard
description:
Newly renovated upscale one bedroom private apartment on first floor in a Central Square Cambridge 2 family house. Walk 10 minutes to MIT or 20 minutes to Harvard or take the T and be in Harvard Square in 2 minutes or Boston in 4 minutes.

CITY OF CAMBRIDGE | Certificate of Registration | Registration No: STR-11739

Due to the coronavirus, we are taking extra care to disinfect frequently touched surfaces between reservations.

The space
Rated by walkscore as a Walker's & Biker's Paradise with Excellent Transit, it is a perfect location for the car-free traveller! Vibrant city activity all around and yet, in the garden, you are within a little magic garden oasis.

Designed by a LEED-certified architect with an eye for natural light and an award-winning lighting designer, it gets its electricity through a 100% Green Renewable Energy program.

Guest access
Washer/dryer and patio/garden shared with the owners who liv
neighborhood_overview:
We love Central Square for it's rich weave of diversity and culture, restaurants and nightlife, education and the creative and whimsical local merchants!

Don't know Central Square? Check out this Boston.com video on the Square: https://youtu.be/tKY42t03GMs
host_about:
My name is Carolyn and my husband, Bill, and I will greet you and give you the keys to the apartment or guest room when you arrive. Starting in 2010, we spent 3 years working with an architect, lighting designer, contractor and landscape designer to re-envision our home and to create an apartment on our first floor. Our home, our apartment and the garden have turned out to be delightful retreats in the middle of a bustling city environment. 

One of the many joys of living in Central Square is that we walked to M.I.T. where we both worked in the IT department for many, many years. We retired in early 2018.

name: Room w/private bath/fridge/microwave/fast wifi -T
description:
This room has its own, separate entrance from the back of the house, and a new, private bath. It has a comfortable twin size bed with memory foam mattress, window AC, fridge, microwave, 5 min away from subway station (red line). You can also access fully equipped kitchen through the door right next to your room. Washer and dryer in the basement available for those who stay 5 or more days.

The space
The apartment is in a two family house. This room has a separate entrance at the back of the the house. You will have your own bathroom, fridge, microwave, and all supplies you might need to make coffee or tea. You can also access fully equipped kitchen though the door right next to your room. The house is in a quiet, residential area.

Guest access
Go behind the house, to the door on on the left side, on the ground level out of the driveway. Once you enter the house, you will see the door to your room on your right. The door lock has a keypad. Yo
neighborhood_overview: It's a quiet, residential area but with convenient access to T, Davis, Square (15 min walk), Porter Square (5 min car or bike ride), 10 min subway ride to Harvard Square, 20 min to downtown Boston.
host_about:
IMPORTANT CORONA VIRUS UPDATE:
Private bathroom and kitchen accommodations are available. Some listings may indicate shared spaces but due to low occupancy rate, private bathroom and kitchen might be possible.  Self check-in/out will allow for social distancing here. COVID-19 responders will receive 10% on any bookings at this time. 
As you can see in almost all of reviews from previous guests, we hold cleanliness to a high standard and clean apartment is our priority. 

To prevent the spread of the coronavirus (COVID-19), we have implemented a comprehensive cleaning and sanitizing protocol. This includes sanitizing tables, counters, door and cabinet knobs.

I’d like to also ask all guests to follow CDC and the Massachusetts Department of Health guidelines and recommended techniques and updates. 

Thank you so much for your understanding and cooperation.

I'm a musician. I was born in Poland but I have been living in Boston for the last 25 years. I travelled extensively all over Europe and some other places around the world. My favorite destinations include Southern France, Croatia, and Cape Cod. I love swimming, hiking, biking, reading, and listening to jazz and classical music.

description:
Bright, 3rd floor studio. Our home is close to Porter, Davis, and Harvard Squares.

The space
This is a cozy studio on the 3rd floor of our quiet house in Cambridge. It has its own kitchen and full bath, hardwood floors, 2 skylights, 2 closets.

Furnished with a queen bed, dresser and desk. The kitchen has a full-size stove, fridge and microwave.

We are 4 blocks from Porter square, 6 blocks from Davis square and 10 blocks from Harvard square. There are many restaurants, shops, bars, and markets nearby.

We are located in a nice, peaceful residential neighborhood close to many parks.

Guest access
The entire studio is private.
Laundry is on the first floor.

name: Close to the subway, MGH, Harvard, MIT & Boston
description:
Close to Boston MIT Harvard and MGH. You'll love this place because it is quiet, with lots of trees in the middle of Boston. It is in an old Cambridge house filled with charm with curved walls made from old ships. It actually feels like a tree house with a comfortable bed. It is good for solo adventurers and business travelers who are not very tall because the slanted ceilings will most likely get in the way.

The space
The space is unique and close to many places to have a great meal. From the ethnic food on Cambridge Street to the techy experience of eating at any of the many places close to MIT, or just cross the river to enjoy Boston's Charles Street and the Commons.

Guest access
You will have access to the livingroom and kitchen of the apartment.

Other things to note
Walking or running by the river is a must. Lists of sports facility with classes, machines and trainers available that are a good way to relax after
neighborhood_overview: The neighborhood is a safe with many families living here. Easy walk to the Charles river and many major hotels where conferences are held.
host_about:
I am a legal Spanish interpreter, love what I do & think Airbnb is really cool.

I live with Duke Ellington, my black cat that came from New Orleans after hurricane Katrina. Love music, ballet and pretty much any artistic expression, and I also love to go to a warm beach for a week during Boston winters.

name: Spacious Strawberry Hill Suite (West Cambridge)
description:
This suite is less than 2 miles west of Harvard Sq. You'll have exclusive access to the space, which has a full bathroom and kitchenette.

There is a queen bed suitable for two people and the couch in the living room converts to a bed for one.

Our neighborhood is friendly, safe, and has a lot to offer. Public transportation (bus) is a 5 minute walk. The trip to Harvard Square is 10-15 minutes.

I live in the home downstairs and am available should you need me during your stay.

The space
The suite is 5 rooms with private access on the third floor of our house.

As you enter, there is a living room with a TV and leather sleeper sofa and a middle room with a desk in case you need to get some work done.

The bedroom has a queen sized bed, charging station, and a dresser if you’d like to put your clothes away.

Our bathroom features the home's original claw-foot tub; I also stock the bathroom with toiletri
neighborhood_overview: We are located in Strawberry Hill, the smallest neighborhood in Cambridge, and very close to the borders of Watertown and Belmont, Mass. The house is approximately 2 miles west of Harvard Sq., which is easy to get to via public transportation. We’re also near Fresh Pond (about a 10-minute walk) which has lovely trails for walking, running, biking and more.
host_about:
I work in Downtown Boston as an Executive Assistant and coordinate weddings in my spare time. 

My favorite thing to do weekends is try new restaurants in Boston and Cambridge. Let me know if you want suggestions!

I try to go to as many shows as I can. My favorite venues are: The Sinclair, Royale, and Great Scott.

Best shows I've been to: Feist (@ Berklee College of Music), Lady Gaga (@ Fenway Park), Miami Horror (@ the Sinclair), Shy Girls (@ Great Scott), Coldplay (@Xfinity Center)

Favorite travel destinations: Erfurt, Germany; Cape Town, South Africa; Porto, Portugal, and Tokyo, Japan

Currently binge-ing on: Living Single, RuPaul's Drag Race, and Pose.

name: Classy Cambridge 2BD--Harvard, MIT, Kendall,Boston
description:
Classy two-bedroom at a prime location, close to Harvard, MIT, Kendall and downtown Boston. The bus is one-minute away and Kendall Square is within walking distance. Walk to the T station and you can get to downtown Boston easily. Near shops, grocery stores, restaurants and vibrant art scenes. King-size and queen-size beds. High-quality mattresses and linens. Nespresso machine. High-end furnishings with leather sofa and chairs. Renovated modern kitchen, wifi, new ACs in every room.

The space
***In response to COVID, we sanitize and professionally clean the entire apartment. Our cleaning staff wear masks and gloves. We also provide keypad entry so there is no need to meet in person to exchange keys.***

The two-bedroom flat has a charming vintage design while providing high-quality modern furnishings. The entire apartment is available for great privacy. There is even a private separate entrance to one of the bedrooms. The apartment is on the second floor
neighborhood_overview:
The apartment is at a prime location, close to Harvard, Central Square, Kendall Square, MIT, and downtown Boston. We are within reasonable walking distance to all major Cambridge neighborhoods and downtown Boston. There are also shops, bars, restaurants, grocery stores and pharmacy within walking distance, about 1 to 13 minute walk depending on where you want to go.

Depending on what you're hoping to do while in town, we are happy to make suggestions and help you have the best time possible when you visit.
host_about:
Hello, we are Yan’s hosting team. We are full-time property managers. Our hosting team is always happy to help so please don't hesitate to contact us anytime! :)

We love hosting people in Boston because it's an exciting city full of culture and history. In our free time, we like to go out with friends, travel, as well as enjoy all the fun activities that Boston has to offer. Our style of hosting is flexible because everyone's needs are different. We want to make your stay enjoyable and help you meet your goal of staying here. We look forward to hosting you! :)

description:
Design and sophistication describe this apartment and the Kendall Square area. Enjoy the panoramic views from your home, its spacious floor plan, the designer kitchen, and oversized windows and closets. This top-notch community next to the Charles River offers a modern fitness center, concierge services, a Zen garden, a lush clubhouse, and a sundeck.

The space
Live in the most exciting and vibrant neighborhood of Massachusetts. Kendall Square is a brimming area with cutting edge technology, science, design, innovation, creative restaurants, and fist-class shopping and is only a couple of metro stations away from downtown Boston. The apartment is located in a modern high-rise boasting spectacular views and world-class resident amenities including a Zen garden, a clubhouse, and full-time concierge services. The moment you walk in your apartment you will fall in love with the stylish interiors and designer kitchen with stainless steel appliances, the panoramic view

Leading academic institutions like MIT, innovative restaurants with all types of cuisine, a big selection of shopping centers, and the proximity to the Kendal/MIT metro make this apartment your perfect headquarters to explore Cambridge and Boston.

Rainfall shower, deep luxury soaking tub, stainless steel kitchen, mid-century modern furniture, central air & heat, and incredible sunlight. You'll have full use of the top two floors of this Cambridge townhome on a beautiful, quiet, residential street. The unit comes with a pass to park on the street, washer/dryer, and a wine fridge, so you can relax and enjoy your weekend!

The space
The main level is the kitchen, dining area, living room, and half bath. And the upstairs level is 2 beds and 2 baths, with one of the bedrooms en-suite with a stunning a rainfall shower. The other bathroom has a large luxury bathtub and shower. The walls colors were selected to give the space a warm and modern vibe, and the colors in each bathroom are designed to add energy and flare.

name: Charming 2 Bed/1.5 Bath located on Harvard Street!
description:
Rare opportunity to live in a fully furnished 2 bed, 1.5 bath condo on brick-lined Harvard Street in Cambridge, MA. Condo is ideally located just blocks from Whole Foods, the Central subway stop, dozens of bars and eateries, and is a short 10 min walk to Harvard Square and campus. Ask about garage parking.

IMPORTANT: Furnishings pictured are not the furnishings in our apartment right now. Actual furnishings are very similar and photos will soon be added. Please message with any questions!
host_about:
My wife and I are in our mid-30s and love traveling to new places together. She grew up in a big city in Argentina and I grew up on a cabbage farm in the United States. 

Today, we live in the Finger Lakes areas in New York. And since both of us work remotely from our computers we're fortunate to be able to spend several months out of the year with our respective families in North America and South America. 

My wife's sister married a Swiss guy and they both currently live in Switzerland... so now we have a new place to explore while visiting family!

Regarding how we would be as guests in your place: We're landlords of a condo in Austin, TX  and Cambridge, MA and we help my mother-in-law, Vero's mom, with her place in Buenos Aires -- so we have an idea of what it's like to have guests and how important it is to have someone that can take care of your place. As your guests, you can rest assured that we will be respectful to both your property and your neighbors and comply with any rules or regulations your building may have. We don't smoke or do drugs and we don't have any pets.

name: Quiet 2 Bedroom Apartment near MIT, BU & HBS
description:
Our private 2 bedroom apt. is in an antique home on a quiet street. In addition to the two air-conditioned bedrooms, it has a living room, kitchen/dining room and a full bath. 10 minute walk to Central Square 'T' station, BU bridge, Trader Joe's and Whole Foods. WiFi. Due to recent city short-term rental regulations limiting homeowners to one apartment, we must have guests book our 2 bedroom apartment for 90+ days or longer. Please send a message to discuss making your dates work.

Guest access
After entering an exterior door and walking up on flight of stairs, guests have their own locked entrance to the private apartment. Guests have shared access to the side patio and yards, including a charcoal grill. Washer & dryer available in the cellar. On street parking. Great WiFi, too.

Other things to note
We include a pass for two adults to the Museum of Fine Arts (MFA). Save $25 each. For your convenience, we also have an MBTA 'Charlie Card' av
host_about: We have lived in Cambridge MA for over 30 years. We love the New England area and embrace all four seasons as well as the food and activities that come with them. In addition to loving this area, we both like to travel as much as we can. After all the years in Cambridge, we still love to discover new restaurants and activities in the Boston area and are looking forward to sharing those places with you when you come to visit. Our apartment is close to farmers' markets, interesting bars and restaurants, and public transportation to go anywhere in Boston or Cambridge. We are a 10 minute walk to the Charles River and its hike and bike paths as well as several Hubway bike rental spots. We'll happily loan you helmets! You can walk to Harvard, MIT and BU from our central location and even downtown Boston is only a little over a 1/2 hour walk. There's so much to see and do in this historic and interesting neighborhood. Come visit!

name: Three-bedroom Harvard Square condo.
description:
1400 sf 3.5-bedroom condo two blocks from Harvard Yard. The entire top floor of a three-story house so you get light from all four sides. Seven minutes from the Harvard Square Red Line T station. Perfect set-up for a couple with kids. The downstairs unit, exactly half the size, sold in June 2017 for over $800k.

We use this mostly as an office so everything is set up well for working.

Well-behaved dogs are welcome.

Condo docs require that we rent for at least one month.

The space
Although we use it as an office we try to keep it set up as though a family with two kids had just walked out the door. There is a full selection of toys for ages 3-7. There is also some stuff for a dog (we have a Golden Retriever).

Guest access
The whole condo is yours!

Each has a private bath and a Jacuzzi. You may use the first floor common area, with a living room, dining room and large full kitchen. name: Prime location Harvard/Porter Sq
description:
Prime location between Harvard/Porter sq. King bed, en suite bathroom, offering good value for two people. Off street family home, quiet yet yards away from all the action. The room is mostly taken up by the bed. There is ample cupboard and drawer space for a monthly stay, and a wall mounted tv with cable.

The space
The house is eclectic, furnished with vintage furniture, and maybe a bit of a fixer upper by American standards but most people love it. The bed is quite low so not suitable for older people. The shower head is new but the bathtub is old, and has a few hard water stains by the tap. The room is not pitch black in the mornings, so some guests may like to bring an eye mask. I would also add that this is not a pristine secluded guest room but rather a comfortable rickety little room amidst a family home, would suit young informal people not too worried about absolute privacy. Also as mentioned above, there is little floor space, so not ideal for people w

This luxury community that offers 5-star amenities is also conveniently close to the Kendall/MIT T station which makes moving around Cambridge and Boston a breeze.

name: 1 Bedroom in the Heart of Kendall Square
description:
This is a great one bedroom in the Kendall Square area. You can walk to the Kendall Square T station in 10 minutes, or to the Lechmere T station in 8 minutes. So you're in the middle of two lines that will take you anywhere in Boston or Cambridge in about 10-15 minutes depending on where you want to go.

Plus, it is central enough so that you can get an Uber to most popular places for less than $10 each way.

The space
This is the first floor of a three floor home. You have a bedroom with a full bed, living room with a great couch, a workspace, and reliable internet in every corner of the apartment.

Guest access
You'll have full use of the whole place for the duration of your stay.
neighborhood_overview: You're centrally located for both business and pleasure. You are in the middle of two T stops and can go to whichever you prefer, you're a 10 minute uber away from most key places in Boston and Cambridge, and you are a 4 minute walk away from Cambridgeside Galleria with plenty of shopping and eating available. It's a great place to situate yourself for short or long stays.

name: private studio near Harvard/MIT
description:
My place has everything you need for a co-vid safe stay in Cambridge: separate keyless entry to a completely separate studio in our building; queen sized bed, microwave/fridge/coffeemaker, cable TV. We're walking distance from Kendal, Central, and Harvard Squares, with a bike rental station half a block away. Local restaurants with curbside pick up and contact less delivery. On street parking in our neighborhood using our visitor pass, upon request.

The space
Your room has a private entrance, and a bathroom that was just remodeled. The room itself is set up as a studio, with a queen size bed, table and chairs, comfortable reclining chair, cable TV and Wifi. You have a fridge with freezer, microwave, toaster, Keurig coffee maker, and electric kettle; think hotel room with a couple of extras, not a full kitchen.

Guest access
You can come and go at your convenience, using your keyless entry which is set to a code unique for you. Although we
neighborhood_overview: Our neighborhood has a mix of younger professionals, families, and students. We're right next to a city park, 5 minutes from Central Square, and walking distance from Harvard Square and Kendal Square. Central Square has a big collection of restaurants, from alternative vegetarian to Indian, Chinese, the best sushi restaurant in Cambridge, and many more.
host_about: When I travel, I want to feel comfortable and at home wherever I'm visiting, as much like I"m living there as possible.  That's what we've created here: a comfortable little home smack in the middle of Cambridge, 5 minutes from the MBTA subway system, and a lovely walk to Harvard in one direction and MIT/Kendal Square in the other.

name: 1 Bedroom in Kendall Square
description:
This is a great place that is close to everything. It is on the top floor of a three unit building in which you can see the edges of the Boston skyline in the distance.

This place has a comfortable bed, couch, and fully functional Roku TV.

You can get to the Kendall Square T stop within a 10 minute walk and there is plenty to eat and shop for at the Cambridgeside Galleria which is only 3 blocks away.

The space
This is a cozy one bedroom, but the sofa turns into another bed for a group of four just looking for a place to crash.

Guest access
Full access to the whole unit.
neighborhood_overview:
This neighborhood is the real value of this unit. It is close to the Red line and Green line, both of which will get you anywhere you want to go in Boston or Cambridge within just 15 minutes on the train. And each of these lines is only a 10 minute walk away.

Also, you'll have access to a large mall with plenty of shopping and food options available for you at the Cambridgeside Galleria.

name: Harvard/MIT (Unit 1)- Brooklyn Ambiance w/ Parking
description:
Central Square is known for its diversity, upscale, ethnic eateries and a vibrant club scene. Easy walk to Central Square subway (3 min), MIT (12 min) and Harvard (15). Our apartment offers parking for 1 large car, and a well-equipped kitchen for entertaining.

The space
This apartment is located within walking distance of bars, restaurants, grocery (Whole Foods and H Mart) and the Central Square subway stop. Mitsubishi air cooling system was installed this year.

The apartment is located on the first floor, and includes kitchen essentials, coffee machine, microwave, gas stove, refrigerator, dishwasher, washer/dryer, TV (with cable) and WiFi.

Sleeping possibilities include:
- 1st bedroom: Double bed and en suite bathroom
- 2nd bedroom: Double bed and trundle mattress
- 3rd bedroom: Queen bed

Towels and bedding are included in the price. Baby cot is available upon request.

Guest access
G
neighborhood_overview: Central Sq. is hot!  Lots of great dining options.  Walking to either MIT or Harvard is very easy.  Cambridge is a bike friendly city.
host_about: I am an English teacher for new Americans own the two unit apartment building.    If unable to personally greet you, our two sons will be happy to assist you.  We live two miles away from this building.   We have developed an "insider's guide to Cambridge" to provide you with a solid foundation to enjoy your stay.  We frequently stay with Airbnb hosts when we travel.    I am member of two choirs and love history and literature.

name: Spacious 2BR 2 bath w/deck, walk to Harvard & MIT
description:
Welcome! This home is spacious and airy, with high ceilings and open floor plan. Charming, historic house with all modern amenities: central A/C, stainless steel appliances, Wi-fi, washer/dryer, and private deck. Complimentary coffee & tea. Quiet, residential street, yet close to everything: 10 min walk to Harvard, 20-30 min walk to MIT, bus or T (subway) to Boston (25 min). WholeFoods, restaurants, and shops around the corner, with lots more within 5-15 mins walk. Parking by arrangement.

The space
This classic Cambridge house underwent an award-winning restoration in 2010. Historic on the outside, 'classic' modern on the inside, with all the comforts of a new home. Large, well-equipped kitchen with granite counters and stainless steel appliances opens up to large dining and living room. 2 bathrooms: one with full bath tub and marble vanity top, and another with oversized shower. Bright rear bedroom has queen bed, dresser, big closet, and opens onto a large pr
neighborhood_overview: We're on a  tree-lined, quiet, residential street with brick sidewalks and charming 100-year old wood houses, but walking distance to everything. Around the corner are several restaurants and cafés: Dali's (tapas), Kebob factory (Indian), Bergamot (American / fusion), The Thirsty Scholar Pub, Darwin's (sandwiches and baked goods - yum!) and the Biscuit (bakery and café). If you want to eat in,  get stuff around the corner at Wholefoods, The Wine and Cheese Cask, and Savenor's the butcher. A short walk away are lots more shops, restaurants and night life in Inman Square (5min), Harvard Square (10-15 min) and Union Square (5-10min). Harvard Art Museums 10 min, public library and pool 3-5 min walk.
host_about:
Hi, I'm Kjersti, (yup, unusual name unless you're Norwegian - so I also answer to Kirsti or just K:).  I love to travel to places a bit off the beaten path. Closer to home I enjoy my kids, skiing, hiking, biking, Kung Fu, cooking, and spending time with  family and friends.  Looking forward to hearing from you! 
Best, 
Kjersti

name: Bright & airy studio in historic home
description:
Newly renovated loft apartment in historic Cambridge row house. Originally built in 1846, our brand new studio is bright and airy, with vaulted ceilings and a secret loft. Steps from Kendall Square, Red Line, and Green Line. Perfect for a couple visiting for the weekend or a solo work traveler.

The space
Vaulted ceilings and ample light make this a cozy spot to spend a weekend or longer.

We just completed a gut renovation of this second floor apartment in November 2016. Everything is new, from the floors to the vaulted ceiling to the not-so-secret loft. Enjoy a morning coffee from the back patio where you can look out over our neighborhood. The very first house in Cambridge was built just two houses away.

The studio is 100% private. You have your own entrance and it's completely separated from the rest of the home. Comfortably sleeps two on the queen-sized bed. Eventually, we'll create extra space in the loft where additional guests (and ki
neighborhood_overview: This is a hidden gem. Located right next to the city courthouse, our cozy neighborhood is full of tiny treasures and bits of history. Walk around to see beautiful old brownstones, lush courtyards, and the site of the very first house built in Cambridge (the king gave the land to the man who surveyed Charlestown for the crown). You'll also find lots of great restaurants, cafés, bars, and shopping nearby.
host_about: I'm a designer living and working in Boston for the past 10 years, first for The Boston Globe and then Upstatement, a digital design firm. My wife and I love to travel and have both been an active Couchsurfers and AirBNB users (as both host and guest) for years.

name: A floor all to yourself in our historic home
description:
Your own floor in our historic Cambridge row house. Originally built in 1846, the third level is recently renovated with a bedroom, bathroom, study and lots of natural light. Just steps from Kendall Square, Red Line, and Green Line. Perfect for a couple visiting for the weekend or a solo work traveler.

The space
This encompasses the entire third floor and includes two separate rooms (master bedroom and study) as well as a bathroom. The study includes a queen-sized pull-out to accommodate an extra traveler or child. Recently renovated, the space gets lots of light, features two skylights, and a provides a view of our neighborhood. The very first house in Cambridge was built just two houses away.

While we live in the home, the top level is quite private. You can enter through the front door and take the master staircase right up to your room without moving through any common spaces except for the main hallway.

name: Big and Luminous Apartment at Cambridge Port
description: Clean, spacious and functional apartment in Cambridge Port. The apartment has tones of windows which make it very luminous. There are two bedrooms: our fully equipped room (queen-size bed, closet..) and a studio where we work. One bathroom, full equipped kitchen, dining room and very cozy living room. Great location, between Kendall Sq (MIT) and Central Sq; 10 min walk from either T subway stop . Harvard Sq is at 20 min walk; 15 min bus to Longwood Area.
host_about:
Hi,

I'm Marta from Barcelona, currently doing my postdoc in Boston. About me? I've common sense, I'm respectful. I love talking to people but I'm not chatterbox, I prefer listening. I'm a happy and easy-going person :-)

Un beso,
Marta

name: Comfortable Cloud, Close to Everything... (3S)
description:
A cozy comfortable unique spot with a super-soft mattress that makes you feel like you are in a cloud.

Easy access to a subway, supermarket, local indy cinema, a pool hall, great food, MIT, Harvard, Central Square, the list goes on... Here for work? You are right next to Kendall Square! Attending a conference, visiting MIT, Harvard, or just leisure, this place is a perfect cozy quiet home waiting for you just close enough to everything.

On-street parking permit available at $5/day.

The space
This is a three-bedroom apartment. In addition to bedding, you'll have access to a fully stocked kitchen. The water pressure in the bathroom is great.

The room is the Cloud room with a unique mattress setup that makes you feel like you are sleeping in a cloud...

Guest access
You will have access to:
- your room (exclusive)
- living room
- kitchen
- bathroom
- coin-op washer/dryer in the
neighborhood_overview: The neighborhood is a unique blend of corporate, academic, and artistic.  You are next to a great food, a park, a pool hall, and way too many places to list ranging from foodie to Toscanini's ice cream (a landmark) to Flat Top (pool hall) to Kendall Square [indy] Theatre, and so on...  Easy access to MIT, Harvard and the plethora of corporations, while right across the river from downtown Boston (Massachusetts General Hospital, Beacon Hill, etc.).

name: Cambridge in Harvard Square - a spacious home.
description:
Located in Harvard Square, the house is minutes away from the main Harvard campus,Harvard Law, Harvard Business School, and MIT. The two bedroom home has two large living rooms with books and original art and Donghia furniture. One can walk out front door to reach two excellent cafe's or visit the Harvard Art Museum to see a Van Gogh or Cezanne or have a fabulous meal. All of this is possible within minutes of easy walking.

The space
This tastefully furnished two bedroom Arts and Crafts home has two large living areas, an eat-in kitchen, a washer and dryer and a private garden. There are two desks for working and 3 TV's with cable service that includes all the premium channels and wifi. There are windows on all four sides and views of Riverbend park and the Charles River.

Guest access
Guests will have sole access to the entire first floor of our two family home. Guests will control their own heat and air conditioning and have sole
neighborhood_overview: Mount Auburn Street is a tree lined street with an eclectic array of local gardens lining the sidewalk.  The neighborhood is part of the Half Crown Marsh Conservation District with mostly Victorian architecture    The house is four doors away from Longfellow Park - designed by Charles Elliot in 1887.  Across the street is Riverbend Park where you can sit on a bench and watch the Charles River where rowing teams from the various universities often practice.  We have two cafes in the neighborhood. Darwins and Flour both very good and both close. Memorial Drive which runs alongside the Charles River ( a short block from our house) is closed for biking, roller skating etc. from 11am to 7pm on Sundays from the last Sunday in April until the 2nd Sunday in November.  Because of major universities located in Cambridge, the city is very international and you will hear many different languages spoken

description:
Our place is close to MIT, Harvard, Landmark Theaters Kendall Square Cinema, public transport, supermarket, and a lot more...

This room is great for couples, solo adventurers, academics/scholars, business travelers, researchers, and anyone with wanderlust.

With a desk and a monitor to get some work done!

Daily parking pass is available at $5 per day.

The space
This room is a bedroom in a 3-bedroom apartment. It is a medium-sized room with a desk, chair, closet, and, of course, a bed. The water pressure in the bathroom is great.

The room is right next to the kitchen, so you may hear us as we hang out, cook, chat, etc. Naturally, you are welcome to join! Or, if you would like it to be quiet, just let me know and we can move into the living room or to the kitchen on the 2nd floor.

name: Cozy, Renovated Abode Between Harvard & MIT
description:
*Please send inquiry, not request!

Quiet, comfortable 1 bedroom perfect for solo adventurers, couples, business, or families. Walk to MIT or Harvard. Beautiful, safe Inman Square neighborhood--a true gem!

-Exclusive use of entire, newly renovated apartment
-Easy 24 hour keyless entry
-6 min walk to train!
-15 min walk to Harvard or MIT
-Private street in safe, quiet neighborhood
-2 min walk to great food/grocery
-Luxury memory foam mattress & linens
-New kitchen with coffee bar
-Free laundry

The space
*I'm a Superhost! Please see my 5 star reviews for other apartments. Expect to have a wonderful stay :)

Exclusive use of a newly renovated, entire 1 bedroom apartment in a historic Cambridge brick.

This lower level apartment is bright and clean. The open living room and kitchen are perfect for hanging out or relaxing. The new bathroom with custom marble is located between the be
neighborhood_overview:
It's quiet, charming, and only 5 minutes from the train! My neighborhood is a safe oasis of fabulous food and cute shops.

Harvard is a 15 minute walk. There you can enjoy Harvard Square, tour Harvard campus, explore historical points of interest, visit Harvard's art museums, see American historical sights, and enjoy coffee while people-watching.

Central Square is a 6 minute walk (there is a train stop there.) At Central, you'll find quirky dive bars, a cool used book store, juice bar, vegan/ vegetarian/farm-to-table restaurants, live music, record shops, thrift shops, yoga, and art galleries.

MIT is a 15 minute walk. You can take a guided tour and enjoy the MIT Museum, free interactive public art, and gardens.

A Hubway bike station is a 5 minute walk.

Inman Square is a 2 minute walk. There you'll find:
City Girl Cafe- phenomenal brunch & dinners in eclectic tiny restaurant
Punjabi Dhaba- award-winning Indian "street food
host_about:
Gleeful epicurean and traveler, always planning or returning from a trip.

Polyglot—I studied Swahili, Portuguese, Spanish, French, and Latin. I explore street markets until they close or kick me out. Can't live without passport, antique books, botany, kids & dogs, dinner club, gelato...

I mentor startups at Harvard and work in finance. 

Hosting is a blast; I give guests privacy, but I'm always available to help or make recommendations. I treat guests like fam and surprise them with treats. 

Everyone is welcome!

description:
Located at the Green Line subway terminal, walking 10 to 20 minutes to MIT, MGH, Kendall and downtown Boston. A clean and basic bed room is ready for your stay. Shared a bathroom and kitchen with two other bed rooms in the suite.

The space
Convenience locates in Lechmere Station area. Walking to MGH, Science Museum, Cambridge Galleria Mall and Green Line terminal in minutes. Bus and EZ ride shuttle to Harvard and MIT campus. All of our bedrooms have build in heating board and window air conditioner for your convenience.

Guest access
Shared bathroom, kitchen and living room with two other bedroom guests. Coin operated laundry facility inside the house.

Other things to note
Paring is difficult in the heart of city. We are lucky to close to several public resources. Please do your home work for parking. We have some info listed with photos.

name: Cambridge Basement Apartment over 90 day rental
description:
Furnished self-contained newly renovated basement private apartment. Spacious and welcoming in beautiful, historic neighborhood. Over 31 day rental.

Full kitchen. Sleeps 4 or more. Cozy eating and studying nook. Hi-speed Internet. Shared W/D. Driveway parking.

Harvard Square access. Near MBTA bus lines.

Close to wooded, scenic reservoir and shops.

I welcome couples, solo adventurers, business travelers, families (with kids), and approved pets.

The space
Our basement apartment is comfortable, self-contained, and privately accessible. It is spacious with somewhat low (around 6.5 feet high) ceilings. Visitors taller who are more than six feet will occasionally need to duck when passing under pipes and beams. The minimum rental period is 30 days.

The kitchen appliances were newly purchased in 2017. The kitchen is equipped with a sink, stove, refrigerator, toaster oven, and microwave. It is well stoc
neighborhood_overview:
We are located in a safe, quiet and historic part of Cambridge. The house is only a block away from Fresh Pond Reservation which is the largest public park area in Cambridge. The reservation is surrounded by a has a well used and attractive running and strolling path and has an adjoining golf course.

The nearby Huron Village area features food and shops is a village atmosphere.
host_about: I am a semi retired father of two sons.  I maintain an active yoga practice and am involved in several start-up companies.  I am an avid reader.  I play a lot of table tennis.  I also like to spend time studying and playing chess. I have many friends and enjoy life.

name: Private room for 2 close to Harvard/MIT
description:
Quiet and cozy apartment close to Harvard, MIT, and Inman Square!
**Please be aware there is a very friendly cat and dog in this home.**
Newly renovated in 2016, it features an updated kitchen and bathrooms, new washer/dryer, and all of the comforts of home. We hope you can use our place as a launching pad for exploring Boston and Cambridge! On street guest parking permit available for use during your stay (up to 3 days use).

City of Cambridge Permit #CDR37301.

The space
Please note there is a very friendly cat and dog on this property. We will have plenty of fresh linens and towels for your stay. Feel free to travel light and use our salon-quality bath essentials (shampoo, conditioner, face wash, soap). Your queen size bed is a true Tempur-pedic, very comfy!

License number
STR-23961
neighborhood_overview: Inman Square is convenient to everything! Just a 10 minute walk to Central Square where there's lots of shopping and restaurants, plus easy access to the MBTA red line stop at Central Square. Just a block or two away from the apartment are tons of restaurants and coffee shops, making it easy to try all of the delicious cuisine in the area! We are also located in between two Whole Foods, and just two blocks away from a Walgreens. We love living here because it's so easy to get around. Central Square is a 10 minute walk, Harvard and MIT both take about 20-25 minutes to walk, or there are a number of bus lines running all over Boston just a block away!
host_about:
I love being active and trying new things. I love the performing arts, working out, the beach and meeting new people. I always love checking out new restaurants, too. Travel is awesome and I've been to Thailand, Laos, Vietnam, London, Paris, Berlin, Sydney, Bali and a few other fun places.

I'm clean and respectful, and will treat your home like my own.
