name: West Cambridge 1 BR entire apartment near Harvard
description:
Ground floor fully furnished one-bedroom apartment all to yourself near Harvard. Double bed walk-in closet. Living room. Dining room, study with desk, kitchen appliances & utensils. Back porch. Your own key.

Sheets towels Cable TV included.
WiFi
Window-mount AC.

Short bus ride or bike to Harvard Square.
Parking on street, 1 guest permit available to borrow.
Cambridge STR Certificate STR-17697

Sorry, no pets.

Booking is set to accept Minimum 1-month stays, but feel free to make inquiry.

The space
Apartment is in a three story 1909 era wooden building typical of Boston area, on residential street in western part of Cambridge (Fresh Pond/Strawberry Hill district) on the Cambridge-Belmont-Watertown line.

Apartments has its own seperate front and back door, leading to a common hallway and common doors front and back. There are a total of 3 other people in the building in addition to your
neighborhood_overview:
Short residential street connects to a Main Street with bus stop around the corner (Boston MBTA Bus Route 73, look it up on the Internet. Our Stop location is Sullivan Road).

Local pub, Chinese-Taiwanese restaurant, three coffee shops, ethnic deli, convenience store and large supermarket within walking distance.

The local supermarket has an in-house Starbucks, florist, pharmacy and service desk for FedEx packages and Western Union money transfers. BlueBikes bicycle rental outside the supermarket.

Other locations with half mile to a mile with more shops in Watertown's Coolidge Square (*), ATM, restaurants, Post Office, CVS Pharmacy/Store, Dunkin Donuts, two pizza eateries in walkable Watertown Coolidge Square area, site of famous 1947 era Watertown Deluxe Diner and a small but locally famous sub shop Emilio's. You must try an Emilio's meatball sub!

Also in Coolidge Square (*) Locally famous Red Lentil Vegetarian & Vegan Restaurant is here.
host_about: After retiring from hi-tech and telecommunications industry I have commenced a new career path as an amateur historian and independent scholar. To pay the bills, my spouse and I rent out on AirBnb and do some part time history teaching at local adult education centers in Cambridge and Brookline, Massachusetts. The occasional telecommunications consulting and research project still comes my way.  Part of my old job was travelling and meeting different people. My past business travels have taken me repeatedly all over the US, a lot of trips to France, Germany and the UK. Through AirBnB that can happen again, but in a different way!  Since I was born in Melbourne, Australia, we revisit there and we do stop by in New Zealand many times too. We have hosted or rented to people from all over the US, France, Sweden, Israel, China, Saudi Arabia,  Chile, Australia, Germany, Turkey, Lebanon & Taiwan.

description:
Come discover historic Boston and Cambridge while staying in our comfy studio. Located in the heart of Cambridge, the studio is steps away from Lesley, Harvard and Harvard Law. Upon renting you will have available WIFI, room to sleep 4, a kitchen, bathroom and laundry room accessibility. New,Pull out Bob-o-pedic full-size sofa!Walking distance from Harvard and Porter square. Train and bus transportation just minutes away. Great place for solo travelers, couples, small families and even students!

The space
The location of this studio is phenomenal! Minutes away from the best universities in the city, best eateries and shops. The studio is also located in a very quiet apartment building where you will be able to focus on your work or catch up on some much needed rest. We have available parking for those of you traveling with a car. ($30 dollars a night for onsite parking) The apartment is freshly painted, very clean and decorated with all the essentials to make yo
neighborhood_overview: Location, location, location. This studio is smack in the middle of Harvard Square and Porter Square, two squares that are full of life and exciting things to see. I love the real city feel the studio and surrounding area has to offer. I love that the studio is Walking distance from eateries, parks and historic places. Cambridge is a diverse neighborhood, that is warm, friendly, and accepting. It is a great place to come learn and also vacation!
host_about:
Hi, 
My name is Cinzia. I am new to Airbnb, but have had a lot of experience traveling to many parts of the world thanks to my parents. I love learning about new cultures and meeting new people. I hope my place can be your home away from home for a short period of time. I am always just a call or text away if you ever need anything as a guest! I look forward to being your host.

name: Cozy Bedroom in a 2BD Apartment. (2K)
description:
A comfortable room with a desk, a bed, a closet. Super comfortable and clean.

Easy access to a subway, supermarket, local indy cinema, a pool hall, great food, MIT, Harvard, Central Square, the list goes on... Here for work? You are right next to Kendall Square! Attending a conference, visiting MIT, Harvard, or just leisure, this place is a perfect cozy quiet home waiting for you just close enough to everything.

On-street parking permit available at $5 per day.

The space
You will have access to a shared living room, a dining room, and you will share two kitchens, two bathrooms, all shared with us and other AirBnB guests.

How we deal with Coronavirus / COVID-19: regular wipedowns (especially door handles), rooms are cleaned with a disinfectant, soap and wipes are provided.

Guest access
Living room, Kitchen, Bathroom - all usual things :)

Coin-op washer/dryer in the basement.

Other

name: 2020 Grad Student or Professor!
description:
Spend time in our artistic, sunny home near colleges and subway. Your room is quiet and private, a peaceful, clean spot to land w/ new Sealy Posturpedic Full-sized mattress. Tree-lined street in perfect neighborhood near Davis, Porter, Alewife. Very close to public transportation: Harvard, Tufts & Lesley all in walking distance, & easily accessible by bike, subway, bus. Great pup who loves our guests. Cable TV in room which is warm and safe.

Guest access
Use of kitchen for making coffee or tea in the morning. If you stay for more than one week we can discuss cooking and laundry privileges if you are tidy and clean (kitchen is exposed to the living area).

Other things to note
1) Kitchen: You can use the kitchen by asking on a time-by-time basis if your stay is more than 1 week. This can work if you are tidy and follow this rule-of-thumb: Finish cooking and all clean up by 8pm. Leave kitchen cleaner than you found it---including cleaning st
neighborhood_overview: Fantastic Cambridge neighborhood! Near all public transportation, very short walk to Davis, Porter, Alewife and about a 20-25 minute walk to Harvard University or Tufts. Lesley is even closer. Parks, bike-path Trader Joe's, Whole Foods, shops, music bars, restaurants galore, all in walking distance. The court is quiet and friendly.
host_about:
Friendly, smart, politically liberal/progressive, resourceful :) I love hosting people from all over the world, and know the Cambridge/Boston area well (for a native NY'er---I've been here since graduate school which was 20 yrs ago). You will find the environment here 'on the court' restful, peaceful and as my current guest from Australia put it, "I  figured you were a healer of some sort-- because your home feels healing." Our place is relaxing and down to earth, with  an artistic and colorful ambiance, and lots of sunlight.

My boy is pure enjoyment once he feels comfortable with a guest. My dog is one of the sweetest mutts ever (objectively speaking of course)!

If you happen to be taking the bus from NYC, WORLD WIDE BUS leaves you a 10 minute walk from our house.

name: Spacious 1 Bedroom w/ Free Parking Near MIT
description:
This is a well laid out, spacious 1 bedroom 1 bathroom apartment that is ideal for a professional visiting the area on a long trip and looking for the necessary space to feel at home.

The space
This space is very conveniently located within the city and is on a very quiet residential street. But it is an older unit and building that has not been renovated in a long time. So please expect an older building and the corresponding older feel that creates- like scuff marks here or there on the sink, walls, rugs, etc. Everything is 100% clean and functional, but they show their age visually.

Other things to note
Free parking! (Super rare in Cambridge). But please see notes about parking if you intend to use parking.

name: Sunny, quiet Cambridge apartment near Davis Sq
description:
Comfortable and quiet very large apartment with a Scandinavian interior feel. 2 generous bedrooms with three beds. Around 1200 sf. 5 minute walk to Davis Square, Red Line, restaurants and shops. Location, location!

The space
The apartment is on the first level. One bedroom has a queen bed, the other bedroom has two single beds. The apartment is around 1200 sf.
Kitchen is open floor plan to dining room. Large oak table with 6 chairs. Relaxing living room area with couch and TV/wifi.
This apartment is ideal for visiting faculty or families wanting to get to know the area.

There is a washer and coin operated dryer in the basement shared with the host family.

Guest access
On street parking pass or parking in the driveway for one car available.

License number
STR-50480
neighborhood_overview: The house is located in a quiet, safe tree-line street off the beaten path. Pemberton Farms, a grocery store and numerous fantastic restaurants are in the area. Movie Theater and shops - all in walking distance. Red line subway and convenient buses to Harvard, Tufts, MIT etc Bike path and Danehy park close by.

name: Penthouse Room With Private Entrance
description:
Top floor, steps from Porter Square and Red Line Subway.

Bed linens and towels provided.

There is a kitchenette with microwave, cooktop, refrigerator, coffee maker, toaster, pots, pans and dinnerware.

The house is a few steps away from Porter Square which has a grocery store, book store, coffee shop, restaurants and red line subway.

The space
The room is located on the top floor of a multifamily house. It has a private entrance and a large outdoor deck. The kitchenette has an induction cooktop, microwave and refrigerator. Large skylights makes the room bright and beautiful.

Guest access
You’ll have the entire 3rd floor to yourself including a rooftop deck. Laundry is in the basement. The room has a private entrance.
neighborhood_overview: The house is about a three minute walk from Porter Square subway station on the Red Line. The Red Line takes you to downtown Boston in less than 20 minutes. Harvard Square is about a 20-minute walk or one stop on the Red Line. Davis Square is about a 10-minute walk or one stop on the Red Line. Porter Square Shopping Center is only a couple of minutes from the house. The shopping center has a grocery store and a pharmacy open 24/7. There are also a coffee shop, a bookstore and several restaurants.

2 Bed, 2 Bath, Sleeps 5

name: Long-term Renters Please! Harvard Walkable 1bdr
description:
This spacious, light-filled, 1 BR/1bath apartment in a five unit brick building in a charming, quiet neighborhood near the Harvard-Smithsonian Astrophysics lab and Currier House is two blocks from the Harvard QRAC (gym, tennis courts, indoor basketball court) and a lovely 10-15 minutes walk to Harvard Square. Fully furnished, with a study area and built-in book cases, the unit has a fully applianced eat-in-kitchen. TV, DVD, and laundry downstairs. Over 600 sq. ft.

30 day minimum

The space
This unit is furnished and equipped to a high standard and is ready for move-in.

Other things to note
Please note that we are offering three identically laid-out and equipped units available in the same building. Placements will be made based on availability of spaces.
host_about:
Born in Boston, I live between Cambridge and Shanghai. Over the last two decades, I have lived all over China in Taipei, Hong Kong, Hangzhou, Dalian, Chengdu, Beijing, and Shanghai as well as in Berlin and Chicago. I have worked as a business consultant, entrepreneur and freelance writer and photographer. I majored in history at the University of Chicago and my interest in China was sparked by reading the Romance of the Three Kingdoms, one of China’s major historical novels, at age fourteen.

In over a decade based in China, mostly in Beijing and recently in Shanghai, I have worked as a Director at Kamsky Associates Inc. and Editor-in-Chief of LifeStyle Magazine and gained international recognition for the street style blog (Website hidden by Airbnb) a valuable record of the looks and attitudes of Beijingers at the start of the 21st Century. As an independent consultant, I created exciting collaborations and content for Lacoste, American Rag Cie, The HUB and these clients.  For over three years, I also served as Lifestyle Advisor for the Four Seasons Hotel Beijing.  I have been invited to speak on the China media and fashion environments by P&G, H&M, Corneliani, Benetton, and Fudan University.

I now work with my wife, Jane, on introducing secondhand fashion to China, called Pawnstar.

name: Walk to Harvard/MIT (unit 2) w/ parking
description:
Newly renovated three bedroom, two bath apartment in Cambridge. Easy walk to the Central Square metro (3 min), MIT (12 min) and Harvard (12 min). Parking for 1 large car. This apartment can accommodate up to 7 people. Our 1st floor unit was such a success that we have transformed the second floor unit for larger parties.

The space
This apartment is on the second and third floors of our building, and includes kitchen essentials, coffee machine, microwave, gas stove, refrigerator, washer/dryer, TV (with cable) and WiFi.

The apartment is located within walking distance of bars, restaurants, grocery (Whole Foods and H Mart), and the Central Square subway station.

Sleeping possibilities include:
- 1st bedroom: Double bed
- 2nd bedroom: Queen bed
- 3rd bedroom: Queen bed, Futon sofa
- Third fl annex: Twin bed

Towels and bedding are included in the price. Baby cot is available upon request.

Guest
neighborhood_overview: If you like Brooklyn, NY, you will love Central Square.
host_about: I am an English teacher for new Americans own the two unit apartment building.    If unable to personally greet you, our two sons will be happy to assist you.  We live two miles away from this building.   We have developed an "insider's guide to Cambridge" to provide you with a solid foundation to enjoy your stay.  We frequently stay with Airbnb hosts when we travel.    I am member of two choirs and love history and literature.

name: ^10min walk-Harvard, Suite-like/private entry/3fl
description:
Anchor Room
Huge 24'x11' 3rd floor room in our 19th c. victorian home. Unusual windows and gabled ceilings give the room tons of character! Air Purifier, queen sized bed, cozy living area with AC, couch, tv, mini fridge and microwave. Professionally cleaned. Parking by arrangement only.

Great location- 7min walk to the Porter Square subway, 10min walk to Harvard. Shops, restaurants, etc half block away on Mass Ave. The neighborhood is diverse and vibrant, and our street is quiet and safe!

The space
Our rental is not suitable for children or pets. Street parking only available by prior arrangement. The room, bathrooms, and common areas are professionally cleaned between guests.

The room is one of two we rent on the 3rd floor of our house, while we live on the first two floors. This 260/sf giant room is basically a suite- a sleeping area with a brand new queen bed with 100% cotton sheets, and a sitting area with couch, chair, and tv. The
neighborhood_overview:
One of the best neighborhoods in Cambridge! We're close to everything. The subway is right up the street. Historic Harvard Square is a 10-15 min walk with the University, historic sites, great food, shopping, and bustling street life.
We're just half a block away from Mass Ave, which stretches between Harvard and Porter Square and is lined with cute shops, cafes, restaurants, etc.

Our corner of the neighborhood is diverse and family oriented, with a sprinkle of students thrown in.
host_about:
Hi!

We are a married couple living in a big beautiful house in Cambridge. Jarrod is a scientist and Rae is a painter. We're pretty low key- when we're not working hard, we like to relax at home, explore local history, or check out antique shops.

We're friendly and are happy to be helpful in any way possible, but mostly keep to ourselves. Since our rooms to rent are separated from our living space, we might not encounter our guests at all, but are always available to answer questions.

Stunning, modern, and newly updated duplex only a 5-minute walk to vibrant Central Square and the red line station! Nestled in the heart of Cambridge, this is the perfect place to be based to explore Harvard, MIT, Kendall Square and Boston. Welcome to your home away from home!

name: Ocean Oasis in the Heart of Cambridge
description:
Ocean Oasis in the Heart of Cambridge. Climb the SPIRAL STAIRCASE ascending through the clouds to the blue sky and enter into a sunny 2 bedroom beautifully furnished THIRD FLOOR apartment. Feel like kings and queens in regal repurposed bed frames as you gaze at seascape paintings.

Perfect location for exploring Boston, Harvard, MIT

Steps from Whole Foods, a block from the Charles River, 5 min walk to Trader Joe's, 10 min walk or jump a bus to the Subway (T). 2 Stops and you are in Boston.

Visitor's Parking Guest Pass-
If guests use the parking pass for the residential street parking and it is not returned to the apartment upon check-out, there will be a $100.00 charge to replace it.

License number
STR-13943
host_about:
I have been a Cambridge resident for over 35 years. I have lived in my flatiron (triangle) building for most of those years, and have lived through many different renovations of this building. In this house, I have filled up 3 guests books, mostly hosting members and/or visitors from my local church. I am known for remembering my friend's birthdays.

I am a former triathlete and marathon runner, but now just a walker. Because of a sports injury, I became a muscular therapist as a second career, and I am passionate in teaching people about how to care for their muscles. I like the Chinese proverb, "Give a man a fish, and you feed him for a day. Teach a man to fish, and you feed him for a lifetime."  I am always willing to give a free consult for either body or soul conditions. In my free time I am always trying to do self-care for my own body and working on memorizing  the Book of Philippians.

This room has a comfy queen sized bed, a desk, and office chair for a working space, high speed Wifi, shelves, and a big closet for lots of storage. The locks use access codes instead of traditional keys to make checking in a breeze. We have a 43 inch Flatscreen on the wall with cable. and a fan, a heater, and an air conditioner to keep the temperature controlled and comfortable all year long. This is one bedroom in a 3 bedroom apartment, with one shared kitchen and bathroom.

The space
Our comfortable home has nice hardwood floors, and recently painted rooms (late 2018). Your going to feel right at home!

Guest access
Guests are welcome to use the kitchen, the living room, the laundry room, the bathroom, and their bedroom

name: Fabulous Flat Near Harvard Square
description:
Fantastic Flat near Harvard Square
This lovely renovated first floor apartment is walking distance from Harvard Square, in a very quiet and safe neighborhood, is available for weekly or monthly rentals from Oct 27-May 12, 2018. Exceptions can be made for shorter stays, (4 day minimum)write me about your specific needs and what brings you to Cambridge.

The space
This charming, uncluttered apartment is located on the first floor (4 porch steps) of our lovely Victorian home on a quiet one way street between Harvard and Inman Squares. A 12 minute walk to Harvard Square (0.8 miles) will bring you to historic Harvard Square where the subway can transport you to downtown Boston in less than 10 minutes. MIT is a 20" walk. Vibrant Inman Square is a 5 minute walk with a large selection of fabulous restaurants.

This bright, modern apartment has it's own private entrance and is perfect for guests here for business, conferences and teaching sabbaticals.
neighborhood_overview: Wonderful, quiet and safe neighborhood in mid-Cambridge within walking distance to Harvard, Central and Inman Squares as well as MIT. Restaurants abound within walking distance and public transportation by bus or metro is minutes away.
host_about:
I am a pediatric nurse practitioner married to a cabinetmaker who loves to travel (especially to Italy)! I love meeting new people from around the world and helping them to fully experience my wonderful home town of Cambridge/Boston. I am a foodie and can steer you to fabulous restaurants (many of them walking distance from my home).
My kids are grown so I now have 2 comfortable, peaceful rooms available to guests.
Looking forward to meeting you!

neighborhood_overview:
Riverside is a residential neighborhood located along the Charles River, which includes some of the oldest settled parts of Cambridge. Harvard Square and Central Square, both major commercial and transit centers, lie at either end of the neighborhood. Massachusetts Avenue, which connects the two squares, serves as the neighborhood’s retail. Smaller commercial areas exist along Putnam Avenue, Western Avenue and River Street.
Whole Foods (with wine and beer) is a 5-minute walk; the Charles River (with walking and biking paths) is a 3-minute walk.
This is a diverse and convenient neighborhood.

Estabrook Room
Huge 23'x11' 3rd floor room in our 19th c. victorian home. Gabled ceilings give the room tons of character! Air Purifier, AC, comfy queen sized bed, and living area with couch, tv, mini fridge and microwave. Professionally cleaned. Parking by arrangement only.

Great location- 7 min walk to the Porter Square subway, 10 min walk to Harvard. Shops, restaurants, and bars half a block away on Mass Ave. The neighborhood is diverse and vibrant, and our street is quiet and very safe!

The space
Our space is not suitable for children or pets, and parking is by prior arrangement only. The room, bathrooms, and common areas are professionally cleaned between guests.

The room is one of two we rent on the 3rd floor of our house, while we live on the first two floors. This 250/sf giant room is basically a suite- a sleeping area with a brand new queen bed with 100% cotton sheets, and a sitting area with couch, chair, and tv. The room has
neighborhood_overview: One of the best neighborhoods in Cambridge! We're close to everything. The subway is right up the street. Historic Harvard Square is a 10-15 min walk with the University, historic sites, great food, shopping, and bustling street life. We're just half a block away from Mass Ave, which stretches between Harvard and Porter Square and is lined with cute shops, cafes, restaurants, etc. Our corner of the neighborhood is diverse and family oriented, with a sprinkle of students thrown in.
host_about:
Hi!

We are a married couple living in a big beautiful house in Cambridge. Jarrod is a scientist and Rae is a painter. We're pretty low key- when we're not working hard, we like to relax at home, explore local history, or check out antique shops.

We're friendly and are happy to be helpful in any way possible, but mostly keep to ourselves. Since our rooms to rent are separated from our living space, we might not encounter our guests at all, but are always available to answer questions.

The space
WHAT I LIKE ABOUT THIS PLACE:
(1) INTELLECTUAL HUB
This house is just minutes' walk from the world's center of innovation and intellectualism - MIT and its Technology Square. The neighborhood perhaps has the country's greatest concentration of PhD's. About 1/3 of our past guests are PhD students or visiting professors, making our place an ideal choice for people visiting MIT or the Technology Square. One night's stay i
neighborhood_overview:
This neighborhood houses one of the best-known high-tech and innovation hubs of the United States and arguably has the highest concentration of PhD's in the world.

However, this neighborhood is probably the most "below the radar" for tourists, but what it lacks in glamour it more than makes up for it in total, earnest hidden-gem-ness. Cruise down its main aorta, Cambridge Street, for access to some of the best fish markets, Portuguese bakeries, and well-loved bars in town. Mall rats can get their fill between the Cambridgeside Galleria and the Twin City Plaza shopping center, but one would be remiss to pass up stylish treasures at the Cambridge Antique Market. The residential makeup is richly diverse,anchored with strong Irish and Portuguese communities. Local pride runs thick.

name: Casa Paradiso - Top Floor 1bed/1bath in Cambridge
description:
Welcome to my Cambridge home with the vibe of Havana! I'd love to share my sunny, professionally-designed 1 bed/1 bath with you. Please note that I do live here full-time, so please treat it with kind and respect, as I would for you and yours.

With a walking score of 93, we're in a bustling neighborhood of great restaurants, coffee shops, craft beer pubs, and supermarkets. You can access Boston from Lechmere (Green), or Harvard Sq via the 69 bus, or bike/walk to Kendall Sq and Central Sq (Red).

The space
Ok, so here we go.
+Top floor apartment with views of the Prudential and beautiful sunsets (gotta walk up 4 floors to get to it, unfortunately no elevators. Some have commented that at least one of the staircases is a little narrow. It's worth it.)
+You got the entire place to yourself!
+In-unit laundry
+Super fast WiFi (Starry is awesome)
+Cozy at 500 sq ft. No, wait, excuse me. 505. :)
+Lots of sunshine
+Super co
neighborhood_overview:
+Across the street is the public library, which I love to go and read or do work
+Right outside is a Little Free Library book exchange. It's an adorable place where you can take and leave books. Feel free to grab some or leave some!
+A few doors down is a bakery with the most amazing Portuguese bread I have ever tasted. I get some once a week.
+A few blocks down is a local butcher shop where I get fresh eggs and meats. If there are some in the fridge during your stay, you're more than welcome to them!
+There's a park and community pool across the street, which is fun in the summers to watch people play softball, or sit on the grass and read a book
+One of my favorite places to eat is Puritan & Company, which serves a modern twist to traditional New England cuisine
+If you're craving Tacos, there is a fab spot called the Lone Star Taco Bar. 4.5 stars, almost 900 reviews. Just saying.
+Usually known for their live music, or just a casual drink at a lo

-Dan and Kat

host_about:
IMPORTANT CORONA VIRUS UPDATE:
Private bathroom and kitchen accommodations are available. Some listings may indicate shared spaces but due to low occupancy rate, private bathroom and kitchen might be possible.  Self check-in/out will allow for social distancing here. COVID-19 responders will receive 10% on any bookings at this time. 
As you can see in almost all of reviews from previous guests, we hold cleanliness to a high standard and clean apartment is our priority. 

To prevent the spread of the coronavirus (COVID-19), we have implemented a comprehensive cleaning and sanitizing protocol. This includes sanitizing tables, counters, door and cabinet knobs.

I’d like to also ask all guests to follow CDC and the Massachusetts Department of Health guidelines and recommended techniques and updates. 

Thank you so much for your understanding and cooperation.

I'm a musician. I was born in Poland but I have been living in Boston for the last 25 years. I travelled extensively all over Europe and some other places around the world. My favorite destinations include Southern France, Croatia, and Cape Cod. I love swimming, hiking, biking, reading, and listening to jazz and classical music.

name: Cambridge Executive Suites
description:
A modern, comfortable, sun-lit Executive Suite with all the necessary amenities for a business traveller.

The 550 sq. ft. suite includes a kitchen with appliances, utensils and supplies. A comfortable bedroom, with a charming view over Linear Park, bathroom and equipped work/lounge space.

The suite is well connected; just a 5 min. walk from the vibrant Davis Square. It's ideal for Guests visiting Tufts/Harvard/MIT for example. Any destination in metropolitan Boston can be reached in 25 mins.

The space
The Executive Suite is in a recently constructed condominium in North Cambridge. The suite is on the second floor, at the rear of the building, where Guests will enjoy a quiet stay, with charming views over Linear Park.

The building is certified energy efficient and fitted with modern equipment; the space is very comfortable to inhabit.

The suite is well lit by sunlight in the day, and has many lighting options in the even
neighborhood_overview:
The suite is located in North Cambridge, near the hip and vibrant Davis Square, Somerville, just a 5 min. walk away along Linear Park. Linear Park is a charming well lit pathway that is well trafficked day and night by folks day and night, walking back and forth to Davis Square, often with street music performers at points along the way.

Davis Square is certainly a cultural location, with shows and movies to see at the Somerville Theatre, in addition to Somerville Open Studios, ArtBeat, HONK! to name but a few of the many festivals the occur in the town around the year.

Davis Square is also a dining destination. There's something for everyone in these blocks, from barbecue to vegan fare. One can find the cuisines of Mexico, Italy, China, India, Japan, and more. And there are new places to find delicious food opening all the time.

And for nightlife, there are no shortage of bars, from the casual to the hip and trendy with fine beverages and food on offer
host_about:
I am part of a four person team. I have an amazing and beautiful wife, Lucy, and two adorable children, Amber and Aiden.

I am the founder of a product company, and previously worked as a Structural Engineer on the design of skyscrapers.

I love to travel when I can, and have already visited many countries. But there are plenty of places left to explore, and enjoy again.

I am principally on airbnb to host. But who knows, on my next vacation I may also stay at someone's airbnb in an exotic location.

name: Lux 2 Bedroom Cambridge Apt by MIT
description:
This 23 story high-rise residential building is located in one of the most exciting places to live, work, shop & play in the Boston area. At this community, there is an array of amenities such as a mezzanine terrace with a garden.

The space
Residents will enjoy their new luxury home equipped with beautiful design features such as gourmet kitchens with Shaker-style birch cabinets, tile floors and granite counter tops, luxurious bathrooms and expansive windows.

Property amenities include:

• Fitness center (fee)
• Business center
• Club room with video conference & caterers’ kitchen
• Meeting rooms with 45" LCD screen with surround sound
• Elevator
• Mezzanine terrace with a garden
• Zen garden with WiFi
• Beautiful lobby with museum art
• Magnificent architectural and interior design
• Constructed with sensitivity to energy consumption and environmental issues, including natural ventilation and exte
neighborhood_overview:
This property is located in the heart of Kendall Square, an award winning neighborhood marked as a global center for innovation and cutting edge technology next to MIT. Kendall Square has endless options for dining, entertainment, shopping, recreation and more.
Right nearby, you can also to go sailing, kayaking, running or biking along the Charles River.
Neighboring Boston is only ten minutes east of Cambridge and can be accessed by one of several bridges that cross the Charles River. The Longfellow Bridge, that carries Route 3 and MBTA trains, directly connects Cambridge’s Kendall Square with Boston’s Beacon Hill neighborhood.
host_location: New York, New York, United States
host_about:
We have been providing vacation rental apartments for over 10 years across the East Coast. We are known for our distinctively furnished apartments in popular locations, and for our attentive service. You’ll find that our rates are quite reasonable. If you're looking for a safe, comfortable place with fabulous amenities and Wi-Fi (we know you need the Wi-Fi!) in the Boston MA area, Washington DC, Miami FL or very close to NYC in Jersey City or Hoboken, we'd love to host you. Many of the buildings where our apartments are located feature amenities such as beautiful lobbies, 24 hour front desk staff, fitness centers, business centers, recreation rooms, indoor or outdoor pools and whirlpools. If you are traveling with children, some buildings offer playgrounds (many buildings are near public playgrounds as well) or indoor playrooms. Depending on the location, you can stay for just a few days, a week, a month or more. 

We offer an assortment of short-term apartments in sizes ranging from a studio to three bedrooms that are fully furnished with all the comforts of home. Our local staff meticulously prepares your apartment before your arrival, and we offer 24 hour assistance for any emergencies after business hours. When you arrive at your apartment, the beds will be made, towels and bath amenities will be stocked in the bathrooms, and the coffee maker will be set up in the kitchen with some sample coffees, sweetener and creamer (teabags too if that is your preference) to start your morning off properly. If you’d like to cook a meal, the kitchen is stocked with dishes, cutlery, glassware and pots and pans. The living room is set up with a TV and cable channels, and the Wi-Fi router password and instructions will be prominently displayed so you can get connected quickly. You can also make local and toll-free phone calls at no charge. 

Please contact us to confirm the exact availability of the apartment you are interested in. We’d love to host you (and your family) for your vacation or business trip.

name: Private room Near Harvard Square
description:
Sunny 2 Bedroom, 1 Bathroom conveniently located in Huron Village, near Harvard Sq., Danehy park and Fresh Pond!

The space
Our house is funky and fabulous, it is great for business travelers , visiting scholars to Harvard. Great outdoor space- front porch ,back porch and the HUGE garden space! LOCATION: Head straight down Concord Ave to catch the Red Line in Harvard Square. Near shops and- restaurants in Huron Village, Center for Astrophysics, Danehy Park, Trader Joe's and Whole Foods, and, of course, Harvard University. Our house is always professionally cleaned and spotless for your arrival. The house is on the ground floor and has it's own private entrance accessible by key code. We've built a space great for working from home with fast speed internet, farm table for dining and working. Eat in kitchen with breakfast high table. Close to Whole foods Grocery store, boutique restaurants, fantastic bars, bookstores, foods, music, etc.

SUBWAY: MBTA (Re
neighborhood_overview: Our house is located at West Cambridge and West of Harvard Square. Shops and restaurants line this vibrant street that is the focal point for the community. The neighborhood is close to Fresh Pond, so residents have easy access to a golf course as well as a playground for kids and a pleasant two mile walk around the pond. I think Huron Village is the one of nicest areas in Cambridge as well as that of a upscale areas around Boston. The streets off Huron Ave offer wonderful neighborhoods to walk through, with beautiful old homes, amazing landscaped yards, strong community spirit. As far as food tips, you are close to many of Cambridge's best restaurants and specialty markets. Specialty pizza is noteworthy. You're so close to Harvard and Porter that you will never run out of places to eat. There is also a small but popular group of apparel, children's and art stores. name: basic room in Cambridgeport
description:
A basic private room in a great location for Boston and Cambridge. The queen bed is super comfortable and the sheets, towels, pillows are premium. The apartment also functions as headquarters for a car rental operation, so there are car parts and tools all over the place. It's an authentic MIT experience. Read my house rules before sending a booking request. I'm a very friendly host, but I insist on guests who can communicate well and say why they want to stay here.

The space
I'm an MIT-trained engineer and now a full-time car enthusiast. There's a transmission and car tires on the porch, tools lining the hallway. I used to get guests who complained it's a junkyard, but now I only get ones who think it's cool. Also, if you have something that needs to be fixed, talk to me about it in advance and maybe I can fix it. I enjoy repairing all things that aren't alive.

Because I live here, the place is fully stocked. I've lent guests winter clothes, my bicycl
neighborhood_overview: Cambridgeport is a safe, relatively quiet, tree-lined neighborhood with families and young professionals. You can walk home late at night with no problem. Be respectful of the neighborhood and don't roll your wheeled suitcases along the sidewalk or talk loudly at night.

name: Serene, Roomy 2BR near Harvard & Davis Sq
description:
Enjoy the peaceful tree views from this tastefully furnished, sun-splashed apt in Cambridge! Located on a quiet cul-de-sac, this peaceful 2nd floor apt is a short walk from vibrant shopping centers Porter Sq and Davis Sq (1 subway stop from Harvard Sq). Driveway parking for 1-2 cars avail for extra $100/mo.

STAYS OF 30+ NIGHTS ONLY. NO TAXES FOR 31+ DAY STAYS

The space
The living/ dining room is spacious with stately windows and wide views. The renovated kitchen has everything you need to enjoy home cooked meals, including pots, pans, toaster, microwave, electric kettle, French press, gas stove and electric oven. The main bedroom's queen size bed sleeps 2 people. The room has a writing desk to enable quiet working off the living room. A toddler bed is available on request. The second bedroom has a full size bed for 1 or 2 people. WiFi internet and cable TV are included. The modern bathroom with full-size tub will enable you to relax after a full day o
neighborhood_overview:
Porter Square area is a happening neighborhood with plenty of restaurants, bars, shops, and grocery stores. Our apartment is a short walk to the Porter Sq subway stop on the Red Line. Harvard Square can be reached in 10 minutes by train (1 stop), or 20 minutes by foot past the colorful shops of Massachusetts Ave. Stay on the train past Harvard and arrive in downtown Boston in 10 minutes or so. Enjoy the beautiful views of the Charles River along the way!

Nearby Porter Square offers a variety of shops including a supermarket, drug store, toy shop, a gift shop that sells wares made by local artists, and a well-visited independent book store (with great coffee!) that frequently hosts talks by notable authors. There's even a new Target a short walk away.

For people with international tastes (like us!) Davis Square offers a wide range of shopping and dining options (13 min walk/ 1 stop by red line train).

The Pemberton Farms & Garden Center at 2225 Massachu
host_about: Hi, I'm Cheryl. I love dancing, playing violin, challenging myself, and trying new things with friends. (Boston is a great place for trying new things!) I meditate regularly and try to live every day according to my values.

One sunny bedroom (facing south with balcony) in a two bedroom condo with one bath for rent (ideally for one year). Located right across Harvard Law School. name: Fully renovated spacious 2BR mins from Boston & T
description:
Centrally located fully renovated spacious unit! Enjoy the quiet neighborhood within walking distance to public transportation, nearby universities (Harvard, MIT, Tufts, Lesley, etc.) and downtown Boston. 10 min T ride to MIT/Harvard. 8 mi from downtown Boston, Fenway Park. 6 min walk to T, 10 min walk/5 min T ride to nearby squares. Whole Foods, Trader Joes, CVS, Chipotle, TJ Maxx/Homegoods, CorePower yoga, Boston Meditation Center, pubs, restaurants of all kinds within walking distance.

The space
The 2BR 1,000 sq. ft. open space has been fully renovated with brand new hardwood floors, appliances, and furniture. Sleeps 5 (including full size sleep sofa & 2 queen beds) w/46” flat screen TV. Free waters, toiletries, and blowdryer provided. Private entrance w/side yard and grill/deck, fenced-in front yard. Free street or short-term driveway parking available upon request. On street parking available by using homeowner’s guest parking pass. Full service Keurig coffe
neighborhood_overview: This historic Cambridge neighborhood is an eclectic mix of the things that make Cambridge great; culture, education, art, entertainment, and cuisine. It’s a diverse community only a T ride away from tech start ups, MIT, Harvard, Lesley, and Tufts. Conveniently located to the many squares in Cambridge (Central/Davis/Porter/Kendall) that host art, music, and entertainment at spots like The Middle East or The Cantab. Don’t miss out on Cambridge’s unique cuisine and intriguing restaurants, like Cuchi Cuchi or Nirvana The Taste of India. Many more exciting restaurants in nearby Arlington. Yoga and meditation classes offered in Arlington or local squares. Fresh Pond Reservoir is a beautiful place to spend an early morning meditation or a walk/bike ride. Up the street from Whole Foods/Trader Joes and shopping plaza (McDonalds, Home Goods, Staples). Pemberton Market is in walking distance with distinguished wine offerings. Many local breweries close by (Cambridge/Somerville) and fun activities
host_about: Hello, We are a family of 3, and are Air bnb hosts in Cambridge , Ma. I work for MIT, my husband, Bobby is a Boston Actor and our daughter Maegan is perusing her doctorate degree in Clinical Psychology.  Living life to the fullest!!

description:

The space
This master bedroom in a 3 bedroom apartment accommodates up to two and is ideal for an individual or couple seeking a high quality extended stay. Simply yet elegantly furnished, this room has a master bath with a large shower. Gourmet kitchen fully equipped for cooking.

Due to Covid concerns, soft accessories such as throw pillows and blankets have been removed. However
neighborhood_overview: A stone's throw away, yet hidden from the bustle of Fresh Pond Parkway, this apartment is within walking distance of shops and restaurants, including Trader Joe's, Whole Foods, Chipotle, TJ Maxx, and a movie theater. Equally accessible to two of Cambridge's largest green spaces -- Fresh Pond Reservoir and Danehy Park. Close to public transportation (subway & bus) to take you anywhere around Cambridge and Boston. For the adventurous, ride along the Minuteman Bikeway from Alewife out to historic Lexington and Bedford.
host_about:
Travelling is a passion of mine.   I love to experience new places, new foods and meet new people.   Having lived in Brazil, Japan, Thailand and many years here in the United States I appreciate diverse viewpoints and customs.    Getting helpful insight from friendly locals makes any stay so much richer.

For my day job, I develop multifamily housing.   I am interested in creating living solutions that allow residents to pursue their passions and interests while having a smaller environmental footprint.    To that end, I am involved in a startup that uses architectural robotics to create transformable spaces.

As a father of five, I am a family man.   I appreciate the challenges and joys of travelling with family.    My wife and I took our children down the Silk Road on a 3 week hand carry only trip.   Getting good local advice can be critical to making a stay pleasant and rewarding for every member of the family.

description:
This sunny, spacious, fully renovated, quiet, and artfully furnished 2-bedroom condo in Cambridge, MA is available for short and longer-term stays while we are away on sabbatical. Located on the third floor of 3-family home, this thousand-sq. ft. condo is drenched in sun while offering complete privacy and roof-top views.

This is a safe space - everyone is welcome! <3

We are confident that you will love our home as much as we do!

- Irina and Russ

The space
The entire apartment was fully renovated in January, and includes a brand new kitchen and bathroom. The kitchen includes new granite countertops, cabinetry, and appliances (including fridge, oven, gas range stove, microwave, and washer/dryer in separate room off the kitchen). The shower has a large frameless glass enclosure and good water pressure which offers a heavenly shower experience. The whole condo has newly finished wood floors, fresh paint and crown molding throughout
host_about: We are both university professors who travel quite a bit.

name: Beautiful N. Cambridge Private Room
description:
This bedroom for two (2 twin beds) features beautiful natural light, a lounging chair, and a walk-in closet space. We are located in the residential neighborhood of North Cambridge, an 8 minute walk from Davis Sq Red Line train station, and 2 minute walk to buses that will take you to Harvard Sq. There are various restaurants and cafes within walking distance, and we will be happy to give you more suggestions if you are looking for things to do in the area. We look forward to hosting you!

The space
We host additional guests in the Airbnb room adjacent to this one.

Guest access
Aside from the bedroom room, guests have access a shared bathroom. Please notice, there is no kitchen or laundry services.

Other things to note
You may be sharing the bathroom with the guests in the adjacent room if it is occupied.
neighborhood_overview: Quiet, safe neighborhood nearby Davis Square and Harvard Square. Local cafe down the street for a quick breakfast. Plenty of restaurants within walking distance, available for delivery & take out. 8 minute walk to Davis Square (MBTA Red Line Stop) will bring you to a bustling neighborhood with nightlife, a variety of bars/restaurants, movie theater, and boutiques.
host_about: Longtime resident of Cambridge, wife and mother, activist, and teacher of adults. Enjoy getting to know different people from around the world, as well as exploring new places and learning their history.

name: BnB! Sunny private bedroom/bath near Harvard
description:
A private bedroom and private bath in a BoHo style condo located in Huron Village, a quiet, safe neighborhood in Cambridge. A continental breakfast is included. Harvard University, Harvard Square and access to public transport (the T) are only a 15 minute walk along beautiful historic Brattle Street. A diversity of nearby restaurants, cafes, museums, pubs, shops and music and art experiences abound. Boston is an easy T ride away.

The space
This is a two bedroom condo on the lower floor of a two-family house. I stay in one bedroom and you will have the guest room down the hall which is next to your private bathroom. When you first arrive, I will greet you and help to settle you in.
Your bedroom is clean and comfortable with a new mattress. There is plenty of space to store clothes in an empty closet and large empty bureau. Great for solo female travelers!

Guest access
Other than your bedroom and private bath, you will have ac
neighborhood_overview: If you are going to visit Cambridge or Boston, this is a great place to stay. Huron Village is a quiet neighborhood full of families, walkers, runners and bicyclists. Its safe to walk here both day and night.  You can stop for a great dinner in Harvard Square and then enjoy a leisurely walk back to Huron Village along historic Brattle street.
host_about: I am a retired science teacher and school administer.  When I travel, I love to go on  walking holidays. Walking allows me to pay more attention to the landscape and the surrounding architecture, which I love the most.   My favorite walking holiday so far has been through Cornwall, England.  No matter where I go, I always try to seek out some good jazz - especially latin jazz! The small local music venues are often the best.   I have always been  curious about people, who they are, where they are from and what are their life stories. I look forward to lots of interesting conversations as both a host and a guest.

description:
Our place is convenient to Harvard, Tufts, Lesley & MIT It is close to the RED Line "T" stations as well as the bus #77 stop. You’ll love our place because of the quiet neighborhood, the comfy bed, and the coziness. There is a queen size bed, a desk, a chair a skylight and a ceiling fan in the room. Please no dog phobias or allergies. In addition you will be helping two grandparents save money so they are able to visit their grandchildren in Italy & Canada!

The space
Our place is very convenient to Davis, Porter and Harvard Squares. It is a short 7 min walk to the RED Line "T" stop and 1 block from bus #77.

neighborhood_overview: Our neighborhood is very quiet.  The noises you are likely to hear are birds chirping or an occasional dog barking.  We are very sheltered from the sounds of the city.
host_about:
My name is Carla and my husband Steve and I live in Cambridge, MA.  We have three extra bedrooms that we decided to make available to those who have a business or educational need to be in Cambridge.  We have a Golden Retriever and a Yorkshire Terrier, so we only rent to people who are not afraid or allergic to dogs.
We look forward to meeting new people and hosting your visit!

description:
Great Cambridgeport location. Garden level apt close to Harvard Sq, Central Sq, Kendall Sq, and Downtown. The bedroom has a king bed with down comforter. In the living room there is a sofa couch that folds into a queen bed. The bedroom and living room are separated by 2 doorways as seen in the pictures. We try to provide a practical and efficient space that's great value for the amazing location.

The space
For 2020, we've made the cleaning fee optional and raised our guest expectations. It's unfair to charge a hefty cleaning fee to people who leave the place spotless or for others to think a cleaning fee means they can trash the place. There's a $10 linens fee for providing you with clean sheets and towels for your stay. There's a $20/person extra fee for the value provided and because hosting smaller groups keeps our neighborhood nice and quiet. name: Cultural District, MIT, Harvard, 1Br, Free parking
description:
Stay here and be in town next to MIT and Harvard.

Whole 1 Bedroom apartment with new King size bed, 1 full bath, Leather sleeper sofa. New Kitchen, A/C, in-unit W/D, gas fireplace. On the edge of MIT's campus. In the heart of Central Square's Cultural District.

You will have access to whole apartment. No Parties, No Smoking, No Pets.

Welcome to Cambridge! We look forward to hosting you and your family and friends.

The space
About the space:
Sunny first floor of a 2 family in downtown Central Square. Recently completed renovation of entire unit with high end finishes. About 650 sq ft. area, it features bright open plan kitchen, living, dining. Unit is brand new!

Guest access
You will have access to whole apartment. No Parties, No Smoking, No Pets.

Other things to note
Walk score: 94 /100, transit score: 70/100, bike score: 100/100
Public Transport: 7 min walk to Central Sq.
neighborhood_overview: Central Square is a Cultural District that is home to diversity and the universities. There are lots of events in the arts, music, and science. It is the epicenter of the tech hub, walking distance to innovation sector, biotech, research, pharma labs.
host_about:
Kat and I love to travel, cook and meet new people. We are longtime Cambridge residents, and attentive hosts who provide the highest standards for our guests. 
You will have a personal connection, and immediate response to your needs if you book with us. If this is your first time in Boston we're happy to give you recommendations for things to see, eat, and do in this great city. We are actual local residents who live on the property, versus a corporate airbnb listing. 
Look forward to meeting you!
-Dan and Kat

At this beautiful, modern high-rise apartment tower, residents have access to a mezzanine terrace with a garden, a beautiful lobby with museum art, and 24-hour concierge services. Kendall Square offers dining, entertainment, shopping, and more.

The space
2 Bed, 2 Bath, Sleeps 5

For your convenience, we have a guest service representative available in the area.

This building is located in the heart of Kendall Square in Cambridge, an award winning neighborhood marked as the global center for innovation and technology. Just steps from MIT and dubbed as one of the most exciting places to live, work, shop, and play in the Boston area, this brand new, 23 floor high-rise sits a mere 10 minutes outside of Boston, surrounded by coffee-scented cafes, antique bookstores, multi-cultural restaurants, lively pubs, artistic festivals, and chic boutiques. name: Huron House Room - 3rd floor
description:
Room & or two for rent in our three bedroom apartment. This is the upper unit in a two family home.

The space
This is a spare bedroom in my 3 bedroom home. There is only one bathroom so it must be shared. It is a bright open floorplan common area for living room and dining room. Our home is in the heart of Huron Village.
host_about:
I am Democratic political consultant who travels a lot for business and pleasure both domestically and internationally. My homes are showcases for the various art and handicrafts I have picked up along the way.

I have homes in Kigali, Rwanda, Washington, DC and in Cambridge, MA that  I list on AIRBNB and try to use AIRBNB when I travel as well. 

My brother Adam manages the Cambridge house most of the time and will be your primary contact should you choose to stay there. My friend Whinock helps me manage guest communications in Kigali  and we have a full staff to support guests there.

A 50 inch Samsung TV with cable and high speed Wifi as well. An extra heater and air conditioner provided depending on the season, and many popular items and amenities for your convenience and enjoyment. There is a shared bathroom and kitchen in this 3 bedroom apartment.

STR-15178
neighborhood_overview:
The neighborhood that I grew up in my whole life is affectionately known as Area 4.
We are 5-minute walk from Central Square. and 1 stop from MIT and Harvard in either direction. It's a quiet, residential neighborhood and conveniently located near local markets, stores, bars, the Red Line subway, and the Central Square stop.

name: 2Bed—10 Meters from Harvard Law School! Big & New!
description:
**PLEASE send inquiry instead of request**

Chic, fully renovated 2bedroom just 10 meters from Harvard Law School! High ceilings, tons of light, original art & high end furniture. Authentic Harvard experience.

-7 minute walk to Harvard Sq train
-24 hr keyless entry
-Quiet, 2nd floor apt in historic home
-Safe Harvard Sq neighborhood
-Perfect for exploring Harvard, MIT, Cambridge, Boston
-Amazing food, history & culture within 1 min walk
-Ideal for school visits, business, or vacation

Guest access
Guests have exclusive access to the entire apartment.

This is a 2nd floor apartment, guests walk only one flight of stairs to access the apartment.

The living area opens to a brand new kitchen stocked with food staples and cooking accoutrements.

The bedrooms are located on opposite sides of the apartment, for privacy. The bedrooms have full closets, a high-end mattress, and luxury li
neighborhood_overview:
This is located at Harvard Square, a fantastic and historic area. There are dozens of great restaurants, shops, and history about 30 seconds from the door.

It's a cultural hub--you'll find tons of diverse food (Thai, Indian, Italian, Asian, Gastro, New American, Venezuelan!) and activities down the street. The Museum of Natural History is a 5 minute walk, and the renowned Harvard Art Museums are a 10 minute walk. Harvard Law School is literally 10 meters from the apartment.

The Red Line train is right in the center of Harvard Square. It's easy and inexpensive to take the train to any location in Boston or Cambridge.
host_about:
Gleeful epicurean and traveler, always planning or returning from a trip.

Polyglot—I studied Swahili, Portuguese, Spanish, French, and Latin. I explore street markets until they close or kick me out. Can't live without passport, antique books, botany, kids & dogs, dinner club, gelato...

I mentor startups at Harvard and work in finance. 

Hosting is a blast; I give guests privacy, but I'm always available to help or make recommendations. I treat guests like fam and surprise them with treats. 

Everyone is welcome!

name: Serene suites close to Harvard- always disinfected
description:
Two suite-like 250s/ft rooms on the 3rd floor of our 19th c. victorian home with tons of character! Each bedroom has a HEPA Air Purifier, queen sized bed, and a living area with AC, couch, and tv. No kitchen, but each room has its own mini fridge and microwave. 7min walk to the Porter Sq subway, 10min walk to Harvard! Shops, restaurants, etc half a block away on Mass Ave. The neighborhood is diverse and vibrant, but our street is quiet and safe! Professionally cleaned. Ask about parking.

The space
Our rental is not suitable for children or pets. Street parking only available by prior arrangement. The rental is professionally cleaned and disinfected between guests.

This rental is on the 3rd floor of our house, while we live on the first two floors. The giant rooms are basically suites- a sleeping area with a brand new queen bed with 100% cotton sheets, and a sitting area with couch, chair, and tv. The rooms each have their own brand new ACs and thermost
neighborhood_overview:
One of the best neighborhoods in Cambridge! We're close to everything. The subway is right up the street. Historic Harvard Square is a 10-15 min walk with the University, historic sites, great food, shopping, and bustling street life.
We're just half a block away from Mass Ave, which stretches between Harvard and Porter Square and is lined with cute shops, cafes, restaurants, etc.

Our corner of the neighborhood is diverse and family oriented, with a sprinkle of students thrown in.
host_about:
Hi!

We are a married couple living in a big beautiful house in Cambridge. Jarrod is a scientist and Rae is a painter. We're pretty low key- when we're not working hard, we like to relax at home, explore local history, or check out antique shops.

We're friendly and are happy to be helpful in any way possible, but mostly keep to ourselves. Since our rooms to rent are separated from our living space, we might not encounter our guests at all, but are always available to answer questions.

name: Cambridge beautiful 2BR, near Porter/Harvard Sq.
description:
The perfect place for your stay in Cambridge! This nice 2 bedroom apartment is located on a residential street near Porter Square, red line T station, shops, restaurants, and more. It is one subway stop, or a pleasant 20 minutes walk, away from Harvard Square to the South, or to lively Davis Square to the North. You can also be downtown Boston within 20 minutes by car or subway from Porter Square. Street parking permit provided for one car.

The space
The apartment has two bedrooms, one with a queen size bed and one with a full size bed. An air mattress can be setup in the living room for extra guests. The sunny living room is perfect to read a book or watch a movie. The kitchen is fully equipped and includes everything you need to prepare a nice meal to enjoy in the dining room. There are in-unit washer and dryer. Free and ample street parking (we provide a guest parking permit).

Guest access
The apartment has its own separate entrance. The
neighborhood_overview:
The apartment is very conveniently located near Porter Square, featuring many shops and restaurants nearby. There is an amazing convenience store just a block away.
This is a beautiful neighborhood, very typical of Cambridge. It is a pleasant walk from the apartment to Harvard Square, allowing one to explore the area.

name: Your own private bed, bath, and office/bonus room!
description:
Like Harvard Square's hipper little cousin, Davis Square is famous for its art festivals, restaurants, and live music performances.

This bright, private room is a perfect home base for visiting scholars, or for exploring the city. Located on a leafy side street lined with historic Victorian homes, a short 3-min walk will take you to Davis' lively center. From there, take the Red Line directly to Harvard, MIT, or Downtown Boston. Tufts is a short 20 min walk or 7 min bus ride away. Come explore!
host_about:
I love traveling and meeting new people. Some of my favorite destinations I've traveled to recently are Thailand, Switzerland, Italy, and France. Next up, Japan!

I've lived in Cambridge/Somerville for 10 years now-- first as a student, and now as a software engineer-- so if you have any questions about the area, just ask!

Cambridge is a city in Massachusetts, across the Charles River from Boston! Its home to Harvard University. At the heart of campus, grassy Harvard Yard is anchored by the neoclassical Windner Library. Harvard Square has cafes, bars and book stores!

host_about:
Hello!

Thanks for checking out my properties!  

My name is Dawn and I have been living in beautiful historical Charlestown for the last 16 years. My property is near and dear to my heart as this was my grandparents home that I pretty much grew up in and that I bought after they passed away. I recently decided to turn my beautiful peice of property into a place where visitors can come and enjoy all this wonderful city has to offer while staying in a place of history vs a hotel!  You will enjoy staying here and all this city has to offer_ I will make sure of it!  :) 
 
Thank you and I look forward to meeting you!  

Dawn

name: 4BR Beautiful New Cambridge Home
description:
Newly built beautiful four bedroom home in Cambridge, 10min from Harvard Square! Great for families.

The space
The master bedroom has a lofted ceiling, private balcony, and private bathroom with huge shower, double sinks, and separate toilet. A second bedroom has a double bed; 3rd bedroom has a twin bed with a trundle (can sleep 2); 4th bedroom currently has a crib but we can set up an air bed if need be. Sectional (LoveSac) couch in basement can be set up as a Queen bed for additional sleeping. The house is open concept, with the kitchen opening to the dining and living room and a gas fireplace. Sliding doors off the kitchen open to a small patio with a table and two chairs for morning coffee or al fresco dining, and then out to the backyard. Our backyard has a state of the art grill, beautiful furniture, swing bed, outdoor fire, and lawn for lounging/patio. Everything is brand new and in great shape.

Our home is well-equipped for families; we have 2

name: Newly renovated, spacious gem in heart of City
description:
Amazing location with this 1st floor airy and bright, fully furnished apartment in a two family, historic, recently renovated Greek Revival row-house with a private entrance. Located in a quiet, family-friendly location close to the Charles River, Kendall Square, Cambrideside Mall, Kendall Theater, Harvard Square, MIT, groceries, cafes, restaurants and more. Close to red line (Kendall), green line (Lechmere) and multiple convenient bus lines as well as a quick drive from Logan Airport.

The space
Our space is a charming one bedroom studio with a private entrance and full eat-in kitchen. Once inside, the bright windows and garden view will provide a pleasing compliment to the comfortable, spacious rooms. The unit is fully furnished and provides many amenities to our guests whether you decide to cook in or head out and explore.
In terms of the layout and sleeping, there's one bedroom with a queen size bed and plenty of storage that sleeps two. Adjacent to th
neighborhood_overview: East Cambridge is a vibrant community with many local restaurants, several art venues, a theater and places to explore. The gorgeous Charles river is two blocks from our house with the neighboring Cambridgeside mall. Kendall square is a short walk and Harvard Square is within a stone's throw.  If you would like more information or suggestions let us know and we'll offer some of the locals' best Cambridge places to explore. We want you to have the best possible time while you're here!

Beautiful Single Family Home located minutes from MIT, Central Sq., Harvard Sq., Kendall Sq., and Harvard University. Close to restaurants, HMART Supermarket and many other shops. Minutes from public transportation and Biotech Hub of Cambridge

The space
Home is available as a bedroom or entire home for a minimum of a four night stay.

Guest access
Guests also have exclusive access to the laundry room, kitchen, living room and fully equipped kitchen on the 1st floor.

Additionally, guests will have access to outdoor patio starting June 1st.

STR-23373
neighborhood_overview: Though mainly residential, the Port neighborhood area includes part of diverse Central Square, with its cluster of low-key pubs, record stores, cocktail bars and trendy late-night eateries. Indie acts play at the Middle East, a decades-old club, while DJs spin at upscale lounges like La Fabrica. Around Technology Square, tech workers break at lunch spots and pizza joints. Exhibits at the nearby MIT Museum blend science, industry and art.

neighborhood_overview: This furnished apartment is situated on Kendall Square at the intersection of Main Street and Broadway. The area hosts MIT and a variety of co-working spaces and incubators, ideal for bright young minds. It is home to a cutting-edge tech community and has thus become one of the world's most important tech and biotech centers. Farm-to-table restaurants and third-wave coffee joints have also found their places around this startup culture. The Cambridge neighborhood, which is a top destination for shopping, is centered around Kendall Square. The Kendall transit stop is only a 4-minute walk away via Main Street.

description:
**Please send Inquiry, not Request!

Chic, fully renovated 1bedroom 10 meters from Harvard Law School! High ceilings, tons of light, original art & high end furniture. Authentic Harvard experience.

-7 minute walk to Harvard Square train
-24 hr keyless entry
-Quiet 1st floor apt
-Safe Harvard Square neighborhood
-Perfect for exploring Harvard, MIT, Cambridge, Boston

-Ideal for visiting schools, business or vacation
-Helpful Superhost :)

The space
This gorgeous apartment in a historical building is SO close to Harvard Law School, it appears to be on campus!

This spacious, quiet home is the perfect location to walk everywhere at Harvard.

Guest access
The entire newly renovated apartment!

The bedroom is located in the back of the apartment—private and quiet. The bedroom has a large closet, high-end mattress, and lu
neighborhood_overview:
This is located at Harvard Square, a fantastic historic area. There are dozens of great restaurants, shops, and history about 30 seconds from the door!

It's a cultural hub--you'll find tons of diverse food (Thai, Indian, Italian, Asian, Gastro, New American, Venezuelan!) and activities down the street.

The Museum of Natural History is a 5 minute walk, and the renowned Harvard Art Museums are a 10 minute walk. Harvard Law School is literally 10 meters from the apartment.

The Red Line train is right in the center of Harvard Square. It's easy and inexpensive to take the train to any location in Boston or Cambridge.
host_about:
Gleeful epicurean and traveler, always planning or returning from a trip.

Polyglot—I studied Swahili, Portuguese, Spanish, French, and Latin. I explore street markets until they close or kick me out. Can't live without passport, antique books, botany, kids & dogs, dinner club, gelato...

I mentor startups at Harvard and work in finance. 

Hosting is a blast; I give guests privacy, but I'm always available to help or make recommendations. I treat guests like fam and surprise them with treats. 

Everyone is welcome!

Catch a film at the local indie theater or stroll over to Sacco's for pizza and candlepin bowling. If you want to head into the city, the subway and bus hub will take you anywhere you need to go.

Tangerine Dream is adjacent the kitchen as is the bathroom. During your stay you'll be our only guest and will have exclusive use of the bathroom. We will not host any ot
neighborhood_overview:
We're in an amazing location and walking distance to many cafes, restaurants, breweries, a Formaggio cheese shop, and an indie theater (Kendall Square Cinema). One of Boston's best restaurants is right around the corner (Cafe du Pays) as is one of Boston's must try watering holes: Lamplighter Brewery, not to mention Lord Hobo and Mead Hall. Pepitas cafe is also nearby with tasty breakfast tacos. Flour Bakery + Cafe, one of the best spots in Boston, is a short 10 - 15 min walk.

MIT and Kendall Square are less than 10 minutes by foot. Have an interview? This is the place to stay. We're just a few steps from Genzyme, Akamai, Novartis, Fa*ebook, G**gle, Microsoft, Broad Institute, Draper, Biogen, Sanofi, Takeda, CIC, MIT-Sloan, Pfizer, and so many more.

Harvard and downtown Boston are just a short two stops away on the T (Boston's subway), as are all of the tourist attractions.
host_about:
I'm an Architect and designer in Boston. Former San Franciscan and Seattelite.
My partner Luis is a planner and developer. He is a native East Coaster.

We love to travel and are in California frequently. We love to travel and look forward to meeting folks from all over the world.

name: Roomy 2BR in Kendall Square w/ Gym, Doorman near MIT & MGH by Blueground
description:
Show up and start living from day one in Cambridge with this cheery two-bedroom Blueground apartment. You’ll love coming home to this thoughtfully furnished, beautifully designed, and fully-equipped Kendall Square home with stunning views over the city. (#BOS55)

The space
Gorgeous furniture, fully-equipped kitchen, smart TV, and a premium wireless speaker are just a few of the amenities you’ll find inside this two-bedroom apartment. Ideally located in Cambridge, you’ll find a lot to love outside as well. When you’re ready to relax, you’ll be happy to discover every Blueground bedroom comes with superior quality mattresses, luxury linens, and cozy towels. We handle everything so you can simply show up and start living.


Amenities

Building amenities unique to this two-bedroom apartment include an on-site:

- In-Building Laundry
- Pet Friendly
- Gym
- Indoor Parking
- Roof Deck
- Courtyard
neighborhood_overview: This furnished apartment is situated on Kendall Square at the intersection of Main Street and Broadway. The area hosts MIT and a variety of co-working spaces and incubators, ideal for bright young minds. It is home to a cutting-edge tech community and has thus become one of the world's most important tech and biotech centers. Farm-to-table restaurants and third-wave coffee joints have also found their places around this startup culture. The Cambridge neighborhood, which is a top destination for shopping, is centered around Kendall Square. The Kendall transit stop is only a 4-minute walk away via Main Street.
host_location: New York, New York, United States
host_about:
Why take a chance picking & choosing between so many individual hosts when you can enjoy the highest-quality guest experience from one consistent host -- Blueground. We are a global real estate tech company offering +3500 fully-equipped & furnished apartments for a month, a year or longer across 12 cities and 3 continents. Centrally-based in vibrant neighborhoods, each home is tech-powered & furnished by our expert Interior Design teams. Enjoy at-home amenities like high-speed WiFi, a fully-stocked kitchen, smart TV, premium bedding/towels, quality toiletries, and depending on the apartment choice -- artisan coffee, bluetooth speakers & select building amenities such as pools, gyms & outdoor spaces. From meal, wine & grocery delivery to laundry & dry-cleaning right to your door, our guests can choose from a number of service benefits. Each apartment is safe & professionally sanitized.

During your stay
Driven by a mission to help you show up & start living, Blueground is proud to host thousands of guests around the world in the following cities: New York, Los Angeles, San Francisco, Boston, Chicago, Washington D.C., Seattle, Dubai, Istanbul, Paris, London and Athens.
Upon arrival, you’ll either be greeted personally by a Blueground team member or given self check-in instructions. The entire apartment is yours to enjoy; and for additional support, our Client Experience team is available via phone, email & our Guest App through which you can schedule additional cleanings, request fresh towels/linens, submit maintenance requests, and view neighborhood recommendations. We’ll share all details upon confirmation of your stay.

name: Harvard Square: Charming, newly updated
description:
Ideally-located unit 2 blocks to Harvard Square, steps to Darwin’s coffee, Mona Lisa Pizza, Harvard Market and a pharmacy. Starbucks and Broadway Market are just a block away, through the much loved Joan Lorenz Park: Cambridge’s “central park” for picnicking and general social distancing. Within blocks to Harvard Square Red Line T, Memorial Drive, the Charles River, shopping, eateries -- the best Cambridge has to offer!

Has a 4th bedroom can be configured a study or dining room.

The space
Nicely updated, newly painted with newly refinished hardwood floors and brand new windows. Apartment has high ceilings, lots of sun, a large living room, an eat-in kitchen with new appliances, a pantry and a dishwater. There is also a spacious, leafy private deck outside the unit and laundry in the basement.

Guest access
You have access to the entire apartment, including the washer and dryer.
neighborhood_overview: We are in the eastern part of Harvard Square, which not only makes Harvard Square within a few minute's walk but Inman Square and Central Square are also close by.  A nice grocery is right across the park and Darwin's coffee shop and Harvard mini market are just a few steps away (with Harvard Market brewing a far superior coffee than Darwin's IMHO). Looking for a the best coffee or espresso in the city?  I have some opinions on that (though we provide a Keurig and pods). We also provide guests with a culinary key to the city, including where to go and what to order (both on and off the menu).
host_about: We live in Cambridge, MA with two small children and enjoy traveling to National Parks in the United States.

name: N. Cambridge Private Bedroom for Two
description:
This bedroom for two (full bed) features beautiful natural light, a lounging chair, and a walk-in closet. We are located in the residential neighborhood of North Cambridge, an 8 minute walk from the Davis Square Red Line train station, and a 2 minute walk to buses that will take you to Harvard Square. There are various restaurants and cafes within walking distance, and we will be happy to give you more suggestions if you are looking for things to do in the area. Looking forward to hosting you!

The space
This is our second listing. We also host Airbnb guests in an adjacent bedroom for 2.

Guest access
Guests will have access to their private bedroom and the shared bathroom. You are welcome to leave your leftover takeout food in our refrigerator, and warm food in the microwave. However, we ask that guests do not use the kitchen for cooking. We are a family of 3 working adults who consistently use the space for our personal meals.
neighborhood_overview: This is a pleasant residential neighborhood, an easy 8 minute walk to bustling Davis Square (Tufts University), where you can take the Red Line to Harvard Square, MIT, and into Boston. There are also plenty of restaurants and cafes within walking distance, as well as the Minuteman Bike Path and Fresh Pond Reservation if you feel like enjoying an outdoor stroll.
host_about: Longtime resident of Cambridge, wife and mother, activist, and teacher of adults. Enjoy getting to know different people from around the world, as well as exploring new places and learning their history.

name: Lovely, sunny, spacious 2 bdrm, summer 2020
description:
Lovely 3rd floor condo, spacious, bright and inviting. Free driveway parking, centrally located on a quiet street in Cambridge. Walking distance to Porter square subway. Easy access walking or using transit to Harvard, MIT, Tufts, Boston, parks, great shops /restaurants. NOTE: 4 week (28 day) minimum rental.

The space
Our top floor condo is a charming, quiet, light filled space with 2 bedrooms and one bathroom (with a great claw foot tub). It is a warm, inviting, colorful and relaxing home. You will find a wonderful variety of books, everything you need to cook fine meals, and a guitar and piano if you are musically inclined. There is a huge deck off of the kitchen which overlooks the trees and the lovely shared yard. One of the bedrooms has a queen size bed and the other has a bunk bed. There is free parking in the driveway. We are renting it out during the summer of 2020 from late June until early August. Please note: there is no TV, and clothes washer an
neighborhood_overview: Our neighborhood is peaceful and quiet, but has access to everything fun and urban. We are one block from a great park and walking distance to several even larger parks which have tennis and basketball courts and an outdoor community swimming pool.  We are also very near the famous 12 mile Minuteman bike path.  Within 12 minutes, you can walk to Porter Square where you will find great shops, restaurants, cafes, bars, bookstores, and a big grocery store.  There is also a subway stop there --one stop inbound gets you to Harvard Square, and one stop outbound gets you to lively Davis Square.  Just a few more stops and you are in Boston.  We are also walking distance to the Huron Village neighborhood which has a favorite local bakery / cafe, the best gourmet food shop in town, a used book store, and numerous antique shops, boutiques and galleries.
host_about: We are a couple with two little girls (currently 7 and 10 years old).  I teach math, and Jeff is a transportation planner currently working on a Ph.D. in urban planning. We have been airbnb hosts as well as guest, and it has been a great experience either way. We have a pretty broad range of interests, favorites being: cooking with friends while the kids play, hiking, biking, exploring new places by walking all over the place, playing music, and reading. When we travel, we like staying in one place for longer and getting to know it rather than trying to visit a lot of places in a short time.
