description:
*30+ day rental* Nice studio 3-minute walk to Red Line subway station and walking distance to Harvard Square. Enjoy the direct short train ride to Kendall Square, MIT, downtown Boston and other major destinations. Direct bus ride to Tufts. Free parking is rare in the city! Steps to grocery stores, restaurants, theatre and great night scenes in Davis Square. Fresh linens and towels. 1 queen bed and 1 sofa bed. Updated bathroom. New furniture. Coffee machine, WiFi. Semi-private deck and yard.

The space
This gorgeous studio features 1 bed and 1 sofa bed. The space is thoroughly cleaned before each check-in and supplied with fresh beddings and linens. Unit comes with free wifi, Netflix access. Free parking on site is a rare amenity in Boston, and you will have access to 1 parking in the back of the building! :)

We offer shampoo, body wash, and conditioner, as well as one set of bath towel and hand towel for each guest. Guests have commented that our mattre
neighborhood_overview:
We have free parking on site, which is rare in Boston. We are a 3-minute walk to grocery stores, subway, hardware store, bookstore and many restaurants. Our neighborhood is located on a quiet street, while providing the convenience of being literally steps to the Red Line Porter Square train station. We are about 15-minute walk to Harvard (or 1 stop after walking directly to the subway station across the street). If you take the subway or bus, you can get to Harvard in less than 10 minutes. Red Line also takes you directly to downtown Boston.

We are also close to MIT/Kendall Square (3 stops), Central Square (2 stops), and downtown Boston (4 stops). There are many shops, bars and restaurants across the street near the subway station.

You will be able to walk to grocery stores and pharmacy near the subway station in less than 5 minutes minutes, so you may enjoy the comfort of a quiet neighborhood and the convenience of shops nearby. Depending on what you're hoping t

name: Rad Kendall Square 1BR w/ Gym, W/D by MIT, MGH & River by Blueground
description:
Feel at home wherever you choose to live with Blueground. You’ll love this spacious Kendall Square furnished one-bedroom apartment with its modern decor, fully equipped kitchen, and bright living room with great high floor views. Ideally located, you’re close to all the best that Cambridge has to offer! (#BOS66)

The space
Gorgeous furniture, fully-equipped kitchen, smart TV, and a premium wireless speaker are just a few of the amenities you’ll find inside this one-bedroom apartment. Ideally located in Cambridge, you’ll find a lot to love outside as well. When you’re ready to relax, you’ll be happy to discover every Blueground bedroom comes with superior quality mattresses, luxury linens, and cozy towels. We handle everything so you can simply show up and start living. This apartment also offers in-apartment laundry.


Amenities

Building amenities unique to this one-bedroom apartment include an on-site:

- Doorman
- Pet
neighborhood_overview: This furnished apartment is situated on Kendall Square at the intersection of Main Street and Broadway. The area hosts MIT and a variety of co-working spaces and incubators, ideal for bright young minds. It is home to a cutting-edge tech community and has thus become one of the world's most important tech and biotech centers. Farm-to-table restaurants and third-wave coffee joints have also found their places around this startup culture. The Cambridge neighborhood, which is a top destination for shopping, is centered around Kendall Square. The Kendall transit stop is only a 4-minute walk away via Main Street.

Why take a chance picking & choosing between so many individual hosts when you can enjoy the highest-quality guest experience from one consistent host -- Blueground. name: Smartly-Equipped Porter Square 1BR in Harvard Square by Blueground
description:
Show up and start living from day one in Cambridge with this cheery one-bedroom Blueground apartment. You’ll love coming home to this thoughtfully furnished, beautifully designed, and fully-equipped Porter Square home with stunning views over the city. (#BOS65)

The space
As with any Blueground apartment, you’ll find a thoughtfully designed space complete with beautiful furniture and a fully-equipped kitchen in this one-bedroom property. And, thanks to our superior quality mattresses, luxury linens, and towels, you can relax knowing you’ll always feel comfortably at home. When you’re ready for some fun, you can take in the Cambridge vibes or bring the entertainment to you with the premium wireless speaker or smart TV.


Amenities

Building amenities unique to this one-bedroom apartment include an on-site:

- In-Building Laundry
- Garden
- Courtyard

- Bike Storage

Other things to note
neighborhood_overview: This furnished apartment is located in Porter Square, Cambridge near the intersection of Somerville and Massachusetts Avenue. The area is always buzzing with activity and offers a wide range of goods and services such as coffee shops, supermarkets and gyms. There are more unique options as well though like a Japantown mall and a live music venue. Widely known for having a diverse restaurant scene, people flock from all over to have a meal here. Full of students and young professionals, Porter Square is easily reached via the MBTA Red Line and the Commuter Rail. Originally named for Porter’s Hotel which use to be the center of the square, Porter Square has evolved into an area offering something for everyone.

name: Cosy/ Artsy Apartment mins from MIT/ Harvard
description:
This is a local artist's cozy apartment, steps from MIT and Harvard, one block from the Redline Subway stop in Central Square. The city's best food and eclectic nightlife is bumping right nearby, but the noise doesn't travel here. Central Square is a Massachusetts Cultural District with many historical and artistic sites, sounds, and events. If you're staying in Cambridge or Boston, the location truly couldn't be better.

The space
A unique artist's space where the location is king! Enjoy easy access to MIT and Harvard. The space itself is a classic - once the monk’s lodgings for the Greek Church next door.

Guest access
You will have access to the Kitchen and Living Room, three rooms, the hallway restroom, the outside patio, the serving restroom, and the washer/dryer. All rooms in the apartment are part of the rental and none of the rental is shared. The apartment itself is on the first floor.

Other things to note
Bost
neighborhood_overview: This a bustling neighborhood and Massachusetts Cultural District. There are museums, shows, universities, nightlife hotspots, great restaurants, fine dining, hookah, historical sites, and waterfront walks nearby the apartment.

name: Central Kendall Square Studio w/ Gym, W/D near MIT & River by Blueground
description:
Discover the best of Cambridge, with this studio Kendall Square apartment with views over the city. It’ll be easy to simply show up and start living in this modernly Blueground furnished apartment with its fully-equipped kitchen, comfortable living room, and our dedicated, on-the-ground support. (#BOS72)

The space
As with any Blueground apartment, you’ll find a thoughtfully designed space complete with beautiful furniture and a fully-equipped kitchen in this studio property. And, thanks to our superior quality mattresses, luxury linens, and towels, you can relax knowing you’ll always feel comfortably at home. When you’re ready for some fun, you can take in the Cambridge vibes or bring the entertainment to you with the premium wireless speaker or smart TV. This apartment also offers in-apartment laundry.


Amenities

Building amenities unique to this studio apartment include an on-site:

- Doorman
- Pet Friendly
- G
neighborhood_overview: This furnished apartment is situated on Kendall Square at the intersection of Main Street and Broadway. The area hosts MIT and a variety of co-working spaces and incubators, ideal for bright young minds. It is home to a cutting-edge tech community and has thus become one of the world's most important tech and biotech centers. Farm-to-table restaurants and third-wave coffee joints have also found their places around this startup culture. The Cambridge neighborhood, which is a top destination for shopping, is centered around Kendall Square. The Kendall transit stop is only a 4-minute walk away via Main Street.
host_location: New York, New York, United States
host_about:
Why take a chance picking & choosing between so many individual hosts when you can enjoy the highest-quality guest experience from one consistent host -- Blueground. We are a global real estate tech company offering +3500 fully-equipped & furnished apartments for a month, a year or longer across 12 cities and 3 continents. Centrally-based in vibrant neighborhoods, each home is tech-powered & furnished by our expert Interior Design teams. Enjoy at-home amenities like high-speed WiFi, a fully-stocked kitchen, smart TV, premium bedding/towels, quality toiletries, and depending on the apartment choice -- artisan coffee, bluetooth speakers & select building amenities such as pools, gyms & outdoor spaces. From meal, wine & grocery delivery to laundry & dry-cleaning right to your door, our guests can choose from a number of service benefits. Each apartment is safe & professionally sanitized.

During your stay
Driven by a mission to help you show up & start living, Blueground is proud to host thousands of guests around the world in the following cities: New York, Los Angeles, San Francisco, Boston, Chicago, Washington D.C., Seattle, Dubai, Istanbul, Paris, London and Athens.
Upon arrival, you’ll either be greeted personally by a Blueground team member or given self check-in instructions. The entire apartment is yours to enjoy; and for additional support, our Client Experience team is available via phone, email & our Guest App through which you can schedule additional cleanings, request fresh towels/linens, submit maintenance requests, and view neighborhood recommendations. We’ll share all details upon confirmation of your stay.

name: Cute, Comfortable, and Centrally Located
description:
Private bedroom available in a cozy, centrally located Cambridge home, just a 6 minute walk from the Green Line (Lechmere), and a 13 minute walk from the Red Line (Kendall) and MIT. Tons of great restaurants, cafes, and bars nearby and a million easy ways to get to downtown Boston. Great for visiting students, scholars, and tourists.

Must be cat friendly, because my cat is VERY friendly.

The space
This tiny colonial house was built in 1873. Situated on a quiet block in East Cambridge, it was completely updated a few years back, and comfortably outfitted. Many of my guests stay for longer periods while visiting research groups, or studying in the area for a semester.

Guest access
Guests are free to use the room, all common spaces, and the laundry in the basement.

Other things to note
Please make sure to close doors behind you so that Mookie doesn't escape. And please remember not to feed her. Thanks!
neighborhood_overview: East Cambridge is a dense, calm, and friendly enclave in the middle of it all.  Wedged between the river on the East, the commercial drag of Cambridge Ave. On the North, and Kendall on the South, it's right in the thick if things, but quiets after dusk.  The neighbors are a mix of professionals and students, and are usually super friendly.  Come experience it for yourself!
host_about: Ex-classical musician turned economist, specializing in promoting altruism.  Love to host and love to travel.

neighborhood_overview: This furnished apartment is located at Harvard Square, a triangular plaza near the center of Cambridge, Massachusetts. 'The Square' (as it is sometimes referred to locally) is both a commercial and residential center. Bookstores, theatres and music venues line the streets and enhance the energetic atmosphere. The neighborhood's central location, close proximity to university campuses and many public transportation options make it a bustling hub for people of all ages. During the day, take a stroll and discover the area's tranquil scenery. At night, there are countless bar and entertainment options. On the T, Downtown is a 15 minute ride while Logan International Airport is 30 minutes away.
host_location: New York, New York, United States
host_about:
Why take a chance picking & choosing between so many individual hosts when you can enjoy the highest-quality guest experience from one consistent host -- Blueground. We are a global real estate tech company offering +3500 fully-equipped & furnished apartments for a month, a year or longer across 12 cities and 3 continents. Centrally-based in vibrant neighborhoods, each home is tech-powered & furnished by our expert Interior Design teams. Enjoy at-home amenities like high-speed WiFi, a fully-stocked kitchen, smart TV, premium bedding/towels, quality toiletries, and depending on the apartment choice -- artisan coffee, bluetooth speakers & select building amenities such as pools, gyms & outdoor spaces. From meal, wine & grocery delivery to laundry & dry-cleaning right to your door, our guests can choose from a number of service benefits. Each apartment is safe & professionally sanitized.

During your stay
Driven by a mission to help you show up & start living, Blueground is proud to host thousands of guests around the world in the following cities: New York, Los Angeles, San Francisco, Boston, Chicago, Washington D.C., Seattle, Dubai, Istanbul, Paris, London and Athens.
Upon arrival, you’ll either be greeted personally by a Blueground team member or given self check-in instructions. The entire apartment is yours to enjoy; and for additional support, our Client Experience team is available via phone, email & our Guest App through which you can schedule additional cleanings, request fresh towels/linens, submit maintenance requests, and view neighborhood recommendations. We’ll share all details upon confirmation of your stay.

Separate dining and living room in a quiet building. Conveniently located: near Cafe Sushi, multiple coffee shops, cycling studio, restaurants, Harvard Hillel, subway (Red Line into Boston), and various bars and cafes. There is a Vegetarian kitchenette with fresh French-press coffee available.

Other things to note
Hello Traveler! This space is in a beautiful space near Harvard Square. There is a small Kosher kitchen and bathroom in the apartment, and in the this common room there are many philosophy books, a futon, A/C, guitar and dining table.

neighborhood_overview: This furnished apartment is located at Harvard Square, a triangular plaza near the center of Cambridge, Massachusetts. 'The Square' (as it is sometimes referred to locally) is both a commercial and residential center. Bookstores, theatres and music venues line the streets and enhance the energetic atmosphere. The neighborhood's central location, close proximity to university campuses and many public transportation options make it a bustling hub for people of all ages. During the day, take a stroll and discover the area's tranquil scenery. At night, there are countless bar and entertainment options. On the T, Downtown is a 15 minute ride while Logan International Airport is 30 minutes away.

name: Private, clean, non-shared 1BR near Harvard & MIT
description:
Privacy, peace & quiet: a light-filled gem of an apartment in a lovely backyard. We live upstairs (not the right place for partiers :o). Gorgeous large bathroom and kitchen, with dishwasher, pots & pans, etc. Coffee beans, coffee grinder, coffee maker, and cream provided. The living room has a comfortable queen sofabed, and a flat-screen TV. High-quality front-loading washer/dryer inside apartment. Fast wifi & laser printer/scanner. Welcome to use backyard by appointment. Quiet hours 9p-6:30a.

The space
This is a one-bedroom apartment, about 650 square feet. The kitchen is large, and stocked with silverware, plates, bowls, glasses, pots and pans. It has a gas range, and black granite countertops. The living room is very nice, with lots of light and a nice backyard view. The bathroom is gorgeous, filled with light and style. The bedroom is 12'x10'. It has a queen-sized bed with a single-size pull-out trundle bed under it. There is a queen sleeper sofa in the liv
neighborhood_overview: You can't top this location. We're three blocks from the gorgeous Charles River, and about midway between Harvard Square and Central Square. If you want to calculate the distance to any location, you can map the intersection of Kinnaird St. and Jay St. We're about 30 meters from there. The Harvard Business School, undergraduate, and law campuses are an easy walk. MIT is close by. There are tons of great restaurants and bars, and a nearby gym that offers day passes. There are lots of nice parks for kids very nearby.
host_about: I am an emergency doctor. My wife and daughter and I live upstairs from our Airbnb apartment. We would love to have you stay in our place...although you'll probably never see us, thanks to the separate entrance, sound insulation, and overall total privacy. Welcome!

name: Fantastic Studio in Cambridge, Gym + Pet-Friendly
description:
Settle into your new home at Proto Kendall Square in Cambridge, where welcoming energy awaits. Amenities you'll love include a fireside residents lounge, yoga-spin studio, on-site bike maintenance shop, pet spa, and awesome views from the outdoor terrace. Nearby you'll have your pick of amazing options for shopping and dining, as well as parks and literary landmarks. The Kendall/MIT stop on the T metro red line is steps away, making for a short commute to just about anywhere in Boston, and Boston-Logan Int'l Airport is conveniently close via car or train. 

Enjoy a stay with Zeus! We have 3780+ reviews (see below).

The space
At Zeus, we offer thoughtfully furnished homes for 30+ day stays.

Our homes come equipped with handpicked essentials, from premium mattresses and linens to kitchen basics like pots and pans, chef’s knives, and wine glasses. Your home is also equipped with high-speed WiFi and cleaning supplies like dish soap, paper towel
host_about:
We built Zeus Living so you can feel at home wherever opportunity takes you. Whether it’s for a month, a year, or sometime in between, you can count on a thoughtfully designed home and a comfortable, easy stay. Our technology helps us select homes you’ll love in ideal locations at a good value, while our expert team handles all the details. Based in San Francisco, and operating in the Bay Area, Los Angeles, New York City, Seattle, Boston, and Washington, D.C.


** 
PLEASE NOTE: Many of our homes are pet friendly, which you will see listed under "House Rules". If you do plan to bring your furry friend(s), we have a one-time non-refundable $500 pet fee and have a limit of 2 pets max. We have several dog breed restrictions. Most of our dog-friendly homes do not allow American Pit bulls, Rottweilers, Akitas, Cane Corsos, Presa Canarios, Bull Mastiffs, Staffordshire Terriers, Dobermans, German Shepherds, Boxers, Malamutes, Huskies, Dalmatians, Chow Chows, Fila Brasileiros, or Wolf hybrids. We encourage individuals with service animals or one of the breeds listed as restricted to contact us before booking.

name: Beautiful 2BR in Cambridge, Gym + Pet-Friendly
description:
Settle into your new home at Proto Kendall Square in Cambridge, where welcoming energy awaits. Amenities you'll love include a fireside residents lounge, yoga-spin studio, on-site bike maintenance shop, pet spa, and awesome views from the outdoor terrace. Nearby you'll have your pick of amazing options for shopping and dining, as well as parks and literary landmarks. The Kendall/MIT stop on the T metro red line is steps away, making for a short commute to just about anywhere in Boston, and Boston-Logan Int'l Airport is conveniently close via car or train. 

Enjoy a stay with Zeus! We have 3780+ reviews (see below).

The space
At Zeus, we offer thoughtfully furnished homes for 30+ day stays.

Our homes come equipped with handpicked essentials, from premium mattresses and linens to kitchen basics like pots and pans, chef’s knives, and wine glasses. Your home is also equipped with high-speed WiFi and cleaning supplies like dish soap, paper towel
host_about:
We built Zeus Living so you can feel at home wherever opportunity takes you. Whether it’s for a month, a year, or sometime in between, you can count on a thoughtfully designed home and a comfortable, easy stay. Based in San Francisco, and operating in the Bay Area, Los Angeles, New York City, Seattle, Boston, and Washington, D.C.

name: Upstairs in Central Square
description: Welcome to Upstairs in Central Square! This is two bedroom apartment in the heart of Cambridge.  With an extra fold out futon bed for extra guests.  Great light on this third floor walk up that's set back a block from Mass Ave, so its surprisingly quiet.  Located right in between MIT and Harvard, in the bustling and fun Central Square, the T is a mere 30 second walk away to whisk you away to all parts Boston in minutes!
host_about:
I spent most of my adult life traveling around the globe from my home base in Portland,Oregon... sometimes staying in people's house, sometimes just a hammock between two trees.  I am currently indoctrinating my son to like these things so we can hit the road when he gets a wee bit older.  My last trip was across India by bicycle.  Good fun if you get the chance!

Since I've been in Cambridge, I've learned things that would be not possible while traveling, learning the guitar, making beer, perfecting my jerk chicken burritos...and I've grown to love this town...lively music scene, and the biking is getting better and better!

name: One bedroom in a Nice Apartment near Harvard Sq.
description:
Very pleasant apartment nicely decorated with an open minded and friendly hostess. This apartment has two sweet cats, it would be helpful if guests are cat lovers! The apartment is kept clean as we have a cleaning services every two weeks.
This is a new listing for the upstairs bedroom, and I have been an airbnb host for 6 years now with 36 5-Star reviews!
Easy and convenient laundry machines in the unit.
Welcome!!!!

Guest access
Guests can use the kitchen, living room, dining room, laundry room in unit, second bathroom. The apartment has two floors, being on the second and third floors of a small building with 4 condo units. This bedroom is located on the third floor (2 flights to go up).
neighborhood_overview:
Super convenient location! If you like to walk, it is a short 30-min walk from Harvard Square. Or, you can catch the bus #71 (or #73), bus stop right across the street, and it will be a 10 min ride to Harvard Square. From Harvard you can catch the T (subway) red line to MIT or downtown Boston.
There is a large grocery store Star Market one block away. intelligentsia coffee shop next door, as well as famous Sofra Bakery & Cafe a half block away. Also, Mt. Auburn Cemetery and Fresh Pond nearby. Please search those on a map to have a sense of the beautiful neighborhood this is!
host_about: I worked as a Montessori preschool teacher for 14 years, now working with real estate. I try to keep myself active and love dancing argentine tango. I also love DJing tango, and sometimes I travel to dance and to DJ. I can guarantee you will love my place and the cats that are just adorable!

name: New House in Safe and Convenient North Cambridge
description:
The charming cottage-style single family house is located in the Covid-19 green city of Cambridge. All rooms are disinfected and guaranteed minimum 24 hours unoccupied before self check-in. It is conveniently located within minutes of walk to park & sports field and Davis Square & T station. A permit is provided for free street parking. The entire house is gut renovated, featuring modern amenities and top-line appliances. Enjoy a safe and comfortable stay at your home away from home !

The space
The living area has a modern design with open floor plan, high ceiling and sky windows. The living room and kitchen area is therefore bright and full of cheerful energy. Central air conditioner ensures your stay a comfortable one anytime of the year. Kitchen is fully equipped with modern appliances, Keurig Coffee maker, toaster and cooking utensils. Sleeper sofa in the living room may be pulled out to make a third bed if needed. Downstairs, discover the master be
neighborhood_overview: The house is in a quiet, tree-lined street in a friendly neighborhood.  Parks, sports fields, bike rental station and grocery stores are within minutes' walk.  A large variety of restaurants and bars, boutique shops, supermarkets, cinemas, theaters and sports clubs are located within 10-20 minutes' walk.  Bus stop around the corner.  T (subway) stations within 10-15 minutes walk, offering easy access to Harvard, MIT and Boston.
host_about: Hello, World !  Wen and I have worked, lived and traveled around the world.  We are now  sharing our home with world travelers.  Enjoy the journey!

Feel at home wherever you choose to live with Blueground. You’ll love this sophisticated Central Square furnished two-bedroom apartment with its modern decor, fully equipped kitchen, and stylish living room with great views. Ideally located, you’re close to all the best that Cambridge has to offer! (#BOS80)

Ideally located in Cambridge, you’ll find a lot to love outside as well. neighborhood_overview: This furnished apartment is located in Central Square, Cambridge, which is centered on the junction of Massachusetts Avenue, Prospect Street and Western Avenue. The diverse area is well known for its wide variety of ethnic restaurants, bars, live music and theatre venues. Many startups have moved research and office operations into the Square to take advantage of the relatively low costs and the proximity to MIT. Nearly demolished in the 1950’s, the neighborhood was spared and went so far as to experience a sort of renaissance. In 2012, the state of Massachusetts designated Central Square as an official Cultural District.

name: Close to Harvard MIT, near Porter Sq Red Ln Subway
description:
The private bedroom is a few steps away from Porter Square Red Line Subway Station, five minutes walk to Harvard campus in Cambridge, three subway stops away from MIT and one subway stop away from Davis Square where Tufts University is in the area. Porter Square shopping mall is one block away with Target, CVS, and many restaurants. It is in a very convenient location.

The space
The bedroom has a queen size bed with new mattress, bed sheets and towels. Large bay windows let in natural light and room darkening curtains. The shared bathroom has a bathtub and make sure you understand it will be shared with two other bedrooms. We never had a complaint about traffic in the bathroom. We are proud to keep the place extremely clean.

name: The NERDpartment in the heart of Cambridge
description:
Our lovely apartment was former worker's housing built during the late 1880s for the labor force nearby the railway to Boston. Located in the heart of East Cambridge, we're 15 minutes walk from MIT/Kendall and Bunker Hill, and 25 minutes walk from Harvard.

With the disappearance of the railways and the rise of high-tech, most of our tenants, including yours truly, have been academics and students of the many universities nearby!

The space
Besides our proximity to Harvard and MIT, and our close proximity to food and culture (1 min to Thai, Chinese, Mexican, restaurants and a European bakery cafe anyone?), and our building being over 140 years old; we're uniquely trying to best offer a space for families visiting schools, academics and professionals a cozy and inviting space to stay during their visit of our city.

License number
C0222850491
neighborhood_overview:
We have a series of lovely Portugese, Brazilian and Italian restaurants near by Cambridge street. Elmendorf Bakery and cafe, is right around the corner, and 9Zaab Thai place is less than a minute walk!

Along with the popular Lone Star Taco Bar, easy going pizza place of Aram's #2, and cozy bar/restaurant of Portuglia.

Other than food, we are in a highly walkable family neighbourhood with plenty of parks and between two large local libraries. Very close to a nearby Starmarket, and a strip mall. There's also a laundromat less than 30 seconds walk from our door to make up for our lack of laundry options in unit.
host_about: Hello! I'm a explorer at heart and love to see the world, really looking forward to hearing about your experiences and perspectives!

neighborhood_overview: This furnished apartment is located at Harvard Square, a triangular plaza near the center of Cambridge, Massachusetts. 'The Square' (as it is sometimes referred to locally) is both a commercial and residential center. Bookstores, theatres and music venues line the streets and enhance the energetic atmosphere. The neighborhood's central location, close proximity to university campuses and many public transportation options make it a bustling hub for people of all ages. During the day, take a stroll and discover the area's tranquil scenery. At night, there are countless bar and entertainment options. On the T, Downtown is a 15 minute ride while Logan International Airport is 30 minutes away.

description:
Garden level loft apartment in a 19th century Victorian house conserves multi-period architectural details in recently renovated comfort. You will appreciate the original oak beams, an open kitchen and bar, and spacious bedroom marble bathroom and creative lighting. A stone's throw from Porter Square, where bars, cafes, boutiques, and transportation options abound. Minutes to Harvard, MIT and Boston.

The space
Your own separate space:
This apartment is a separate space in our house, and has acoustic insulation to ensure as much privacy as possible. The apartment has its own entry from the side yard so you may come and go as you please. There is a washer and dryer onsite for your convenience.

Other things to note
1- Cambridge monthly street cleaning, make sure to look at the street signs before you park.
2- Our guest parking applies only to our neighborhood. Please check the back of the permit for the map.
3- If you are bor
neighborhood_overview:
Historic, posh Avon Hill neighborhood is great for walking. This part of Cambridge in general has an abundance of old Victorian homes over several square miles. The Cooper-Frost-Austin house (1681), oldest in Cambridge, is just down the street. Raymond Park and playground is nearby as well. The Harvard campus is a short distance away, and in addition to the famous yard proposes the Natural History Museum and its renowned Art Museum. Historic Cambridge Common, where General Washington's troops assembled, is nearby as well. The Porter Square subway stop is a 3-minute walk, and one stop away from Davis square or Harvard Square.

For shopping an errands, we recommend:

Porter Square Post Office
Porter Square Book store
Caffe Nero
Cafe Bourbon
The Abbey (bistro)
Bagelsaurus bakery
The Toad (cozy live music bar)
Christopher's (bistro and sports bar)
Colette Wine Bar and Restaurant
Yume Wo Katare ramen bar
Lunder Arts Cen
host_about: Marie and Andrew have been living in Cambridge for a dozen years. Marie grew up in the romantic city of Paris, and is now a filmmaker and script writer. She also loves to cook and read. Andrew hails from the south, moved to Paris to study architecture, and now runs a design and visualization practice in Cambridge. Andrew and Marie love to travel and strike up unexpected friendships.

neighborhood_overview: We are close to Harvard and close to MIT.  Many nearby conveniences.  1369 Coffeeshop, the best in the city is two blocks away.  Many super restaurants nearby, from Life Alive to Thelonius Monkfish or Jenny's, many more.  Nice parks within 2 blocks, on Lee St, Hancock St, Broadway.  The Cambridge Public Library has two libraries within easy walking.
host_about: I love art, music, gardening, architecture.  I am a mathematical/cognitive psychologist and helped to found the Laboratory for Probabilistic Reasoning at Tufts, where I am co-Principal Investigator.  I have worked as a nurse, and sometimes teach with the Mass Nurses' Association.  I love boats, and sail in Buzzards Bay, and canoe in New England and NY/NJ/PA on the amazing Delaware River.  Sometimes I paint and sometimes make things in ceramics.  I am deeply committed to sustainability, and will soon have my house off Carbon fuels, using photo-voltaics and geothermal to collect energy from my rooftop and garden,  Of course, first is always conservation and efficiency.  I chortle at the simplicity of sustainability.

neighborhood_overview: This furnished rental is located in East Cambridge, a European-style neighborhood in Boston, that a diverse group of families and professionals call home. Being just a few T stops away from downtown, it is a prime location to live.  With MIT and Kendall Square bordering the neighborhood as well as the exciting new Northpoint area, it represents the best of Boston and Cambridge. Be it through the local art scene, university presence, exciting employment centers, new high rises or access to the Charles River, this neighborhood has it all. This intellectual hotspot is also known for promoting ‘green living’ and this is one of the reasons why Charles River is one of America's cleanest urban rivers.
host_location: New York, New York, United States

Why take a chance picking & choosing between so many individual hosts when you can enjoy the highest-quality guest experience from one consistent host -- Blueground. name: Furnished 1BR in Cambridge w/ Concierge + Gym
description:
Settle into your new home at Proto Kendall Square in Cambridge, where welcoming energy awaits. Amenities you'll love include a fireside residents lounge, yoga-spin studio, on-site bike maintenance shop, pet spa, and awesome views from the outdoor terrace. Nearby you'll have your pick of amazing options for shopping and dining, as well as parks and literary landmarks. The Kendall/MIT stop on the T metro red line is steps away, making for a short commute to just about anywhere in Boston, and Boston-Logan Int'l Airport is conveniently close via car or train.

Enjoy a stay with Zeus! We have 3780+ reviews (see below).

The space
At Zeus, we offer thoughtfully furnished homes for 30+ day stays.

Our homes come equipped with handpicked essentials, from premium mattresses and linens to kitchen basics like pots and pans, chef’s knives, and wine glasses. Your home is also equipped with high-speed WiFi and cleaning supplies like dish soap, paper towels
host_about:
We built Zeus Living so you can feel at home wherever opportunity takes you. Whether it’s for a month, a year, or sometime in between, you can count on a thoughtfully designed home and a comfortable, easy stay. Our technology helps us select homes you’ll love in ideal locations at a good value, while our expert team handles all the details. Based in San Francisco, and operating in the Bay Area, Los Angeles, New York City, Seattle, Boston, and Washington, D.C.


** 
PLEASE NOTE: Many of our homes are pet friendly, which you will see listed under "House Rules". If you do plan to bring your furry friend(s), we have a one-time non-refundable $500 pet fee and have a limit of 2 pets max. We have several dog breed restrictions. Most of our dog-friendly homes do not allow American Pit bulls, Rottweilers, Akitas, Cane Corsos, Presa Canarios, Bull Mastiffs, Staffordshire Terriers, Dobermans, German Shepherds, Boxers, Malamutes, Huskies, Dalmatians, Chow Chows, Fila Brasileiros, or Wolf hybrids. We encourage individuals with service animals or one of the breeds listed as restricted to contact us before booking.

neighborhood_overview: This furnished apartment is located in Central Square, Cambridge, which is centered on the junction of Massachusetts Avenue, Prospect Street and Western Avenue. The diverse area is well known for its wide variety of ethnic restaurants, bars, live music and theatre venues. Many startups have moved research and office operations into the Square to take advantage of the relatively low costs and the proximity to MIT. Nearly demolished in the 1950’s, the neighborhood was spared and went so far as to experience a sort of renaissance. In 2012, the state of Massachusetts designated Central Square as an official Cultural District.

neighborhood_overview:
If you are visiting Boston - THIS is where you want to be. Location is everything in this City - you can step out your front door and walk to most places you'd want to be...including:
- MIT, BU, Harvard Business School, Harvard Square, Harvard College, Harvard iLab, 60+ other schools.
- Charles River, Whole Foods Supermarket, Rite Aid Pharmacy, Trader Joe's Supermarket
- Weekly Local Farmer's Market
- Dozens of Small Retail Shops
- Two Outdoor Parks & Playgrounds
- Dozens of Great Restaurants & Coffee Shops
- The MBTA "The T" Public Transit (Buses & Trains) literally right out front door.
- JFK Birthplace, a National Historic Site
- Easy Access to Boston, Logan Airport, Harvard
- I am available by email, text, phone as needed during your stay and love meeting new people.
host_about: Hello!  Professional in 30s splitting time mostly between Boston, Kendall Square Cambridge, Portsmouth, NH, San Francisco and NYC right now and travel frequently.  I've visited most of the 50 states and traveled to 20+ countries internationally.  Profile shows some hosting/swap/Couchsurfing activities, plus dozens of others not booked via AirBnB. Just returned from Iceland, Holland, Italy and London - some great AirBnB experiences - including an Amsterdam Houseboat.  I own/operate multiple businesses:  Lingerie Planet, Inc.  Beer Bites, LLC and my non-profit " (Website hidden by Airbnb) you can follow via @PHILANTHROPIST on (Hidden by Airbnb) . I've owned numerous condos - Cambridge Mass, USA has been home base for 15 years and I've maintained various apartments with numerous residential tenants as well as physical office/incubation spaces with business tenants and/or employees. Currently promoting "The Market Accelerator" which is a startup incubator similar to TechStars, MassChallenge, Y-Combinator with pilot locations on Market Street in Downtown Portsmouth, NH and Kendall / MIT area Cambridge.  My space is unique in that it is designed to work & live for small startup business teams with numerous beds/desks, etc.  I'm also currently working on a project:   "FloatingLoft"  dotc0m  - which is an accelerator / incubation / living space on the ocean. I'm also interested in travel opportunities - so if you are travelling here to New England - I'm open to swaps/exchanges/creative deals, etc.  If you have piles of airline miles needing to be used us - that's a huge plus and can be better than cash.

name: Convenient Studio *parking* 3-min. walk to subway
description:
Nice studio 3-minute walk to Red Line subway station and walking distance to Harvard Square. Enjoy the direct short train ride to Kendall Square, MIT, downtown Boston and other major destinations. Direct bus ride to Tufts. Free parking is rare in the city! Steps to grocery stores, restaurants, theatre and great night scenes in Davis Square. Fresh linens and towels. 1 queen bed and 1 sofa bed. Updated bathroom. New furniture. Coffee machine, WiFi. Semi-private deck and yard.

The space
***In response to COVID, we sanitize and professionally clean the entire apartment. Our cleaning staff wear masks and gloves. We also provide keypad entry so there is no need to meet in person to exchange keys.***

This gorgeous studio features 1 queen bed and 1 sofa bed. The space is thoroughly cleaned before each check-in and supplied with fresh beddings and linens. Unit comes with free wifi, Netflix access. Free parking on site is a rare amenity in Boston, and you will h
neighborhood_overview:
We have free parking on site, which is rare in Boston. We are a 3-minute walk to grocery stores, subway, hardware store, bookstore and many restaurants. Our neighborhood is located on a quiet street, while providing the convenience of being literally steps to the Red Line Porter Square train station. We are about 15-minute walk to Harvard (or 1 stop after walking directly to the subway station across the street). If you take the subway or bus, you can get to Harvard in less than 10 minutes. Red Line also takes you directly to downtown Boston.

We are also close to MIT/Kendall Square (3 stops), Central Square (2 stops), and downtown Boston (4 stops). There are many shops, bars and restaurants across the street near the subway station.

You will be able to walk to grocery stores and pharmacy near the subway station in less than 5 minutes minutes, so you may enjoy the comfort of a quiet neighborhood and the convenience of shops nearby. Depending on what you're hoping t
host_about: Hi I’m Mary, a world traveler and educator. My co-host Yan helps me host from time to time. We want to make sure you have a great stay! :)

name: Airy Central Square 1BR w/ Gym, DM, nr. Central Sq. T by Blueground
description:
Discover the best of Cambridge, with this one-bedroom Central Square apartment. It’ll be easy to simply show up and start living in this exquisitely Blueground furnished apartment with its fully-equipped kitchen, lovely living room, and our dedicated, on-the-ground support. (#BOS256)

The space
Thoughtfully designed with bespoke finishes, modern furnishings, and a fully-equipped kitchen, you’ll enjoy that “I’m home” feeling with this Blueground apartment. Whether you’re lounging in your beautiful living room streaming the latest and greatest entertainment on the smart TV or premium wireless speaker, or getting some well-earned rest on the superior quality mattress with luxury linens, you’ll fall in love with everything this Central Square apartment has to offer. This apartment also offers in-apartment laundry.


Amenities

Building amenities unique to this one-bedroom apartment include an on-site:

- Doorman
- Gym
-
neighborhood_overview: This furnished apartment is located in Central Square, Cambridge, which is centered on the junction of Massachusetts Avenue, Prospect Street and Western Avenue. The diverse area is well known for its wide variety of ethnic restaurants, bars, live music and theatre venues. Many startups have moved research and office operations into the Square to take advantage of the relatively low costs and the proximity to MIT. Nearly demolished in the 1950’s, the neighborhood was spared and went so far as to experience a sort of renaissance. In 2012, the state of Massachusetts designated Central Square as an official Cultural District.
host_location: New York, New York, United States
host_about:
Why take a chance picking & choosing between so many individual hosts when you can enjoy the highest-quality guest experience from one consistent host -- Blueground. We are a global real estate tech company offering +3500 fully-equipped & furnished apartments for a month, a year or longer across 12 cities and 3 continents. Centrally-based in vibrant neighborhoods, each home is tech-powered & furnished by our expert Interior Design teams. Enjoy at-home amenities like high-speed WiFi, a fully-stocked kitchen, smart TV, premium bedding/towels, quality toiletries, and depending on the apartment choice -- artisan coffee, bluetooth speakers & select building amenities such as pools, gyms & outdoor spaces. From meal, wine & grocery delivery to laundry & dry-cleaning right to your door, our guests can choose from a number of service benefits. Each apartment is safe & professionally sanitized.

During your stay
Driven by a mission to help you show up & start living, Blueground is proud to host thousands of guests around the world in the following cities: New York, Los Angeles, San Francisco, Boston, Chicago, Washington D.C., Seattle, Dubai, Istanbul, Paris, London and Athens.
Upon arrival, you’ll either be greeted personally by a Blueground team member or given self check-in instructions. The entire apartment is yours to enjoy; and for additional support, our Client Experience team is available via phone, email & our Guest App through which you can schedule additional cleanings, request fresh towels/linens, submit maintenance requests, and view neighborhood recommendations. We’ll share all details upon confirmation of your stay.

name: Master bedroom in Lux 3BR between MIT and Harvard
description:
Master bedroom with private bath in a three bedroom apartment. Comfortably fits two and is just blocks away from MIT and Harvard. Shared gourmet kitchen, easy access to subway at Central and Kendall.

This is Marisa, their daughter and local host, and I live in room C. I'm a computer engineer who works remotely. In the other room is a software engineer who also works remotely. We are both quiet and keep the common areas clean and are careful with following all MA guidelines regarding covid.

The space
Queen size bed and a full sleeper sofa and desk in your own private room with access to a fully equipped kitchen and living room. Washer/dryer in common bathroom.

Other things to note
Due to Covid concerns, soft accessories such as throw pillows and blankets have been removed. However, all towels, bed sheets, and comforters are provided as pictured. Color and style of linens may differ from photos.
neighborhood_overview: Located at 277 Broadway, our building is across the street from Lamplighter Brewery which offers beer at night and coffee during the day.    Acclaimed restaurant Bondir is right next door (open for dinner) while even more acclaimed Oleana is just a block away.
host_about:
Travelling is a passion of mine.   I love to experience new places, new foods and meet new people.   Having lived in Brazil, Japan, Thailand and many years here in the United States I appreciate diverse viewpoints and customs.    Getting helpful insight from friendly locals makes any stay so much richer.

For my day job, I develop multifamily housing.   I am interested in creating living solutions that allow residents to pursue their passions and interests while having a smaller environmental footprint.    To that end, I am involved in a startup that uses architectural robotics to create transformable spaces.

As a father of five, I am a family man.   I appreciate the challenges and joys of travelling with family.    My wife and I took our children down the Silk Road on a 3 week hand carry only trip.   Getting good local advice can be critical to making a stay pleasant and rewarding for every member of the family.

*This apartment will be newly furnished. Photos show furniture from prior tenant.

If you’re a student or teacher, or if you’re visiting your college student, our property is the best option for you!

The space
* Apartment will look different as it will be furnished similar, but with different furniture.

The 1 BD is a newly refurnished loft-level (attic) unit. Comes with free washer and dryer, dishwasher, and free street parking. Great for professionals, grad students, and visitors.

neighborhood_overview:
* This is a very family-friendly neighborhood, with a playground right around the corner. Neighbours include Harvard faculty and young professionals in bio-tech, finance, and IT.
* High-end, safe neighborhood down the street from where the Internet was invented. You will find the Fresh Pond Golf Course and beautiful Fresh Pond running trail right across the street, which makes this a very quiet neighborhood.
* There's also a close-by tennis court, basketball court, and children's park. There are lots of restaurants around the area with many options for you and your family.
* Steps from bus to Harvard Square (10-15 minutes). From there, you can hop on the RED line train to downtown Boston (additional 15 minutes), or drive there in 25 mins.
* Short walk to convenience store and WOW gym; short drive to Fresh Pond Mall for Trader Joe's, Starbucks, LOEWS theaters, etc.
* 30-min. drive from Boston Logan Airport.

Note: I highly recommend if you are looking

name: Stylish 3BR | Full Kitchen | Pool | Laundry | Gym
description:
Experience Cambridge. Sometimes choosing a specific location can be difficult, but sometimes, the location chooses you. Near Downtown Boston, Charles River, Magazine Beach & BU Bridge, places YOU in the center of it all. With a Whole Foods and Trader Joe’s market minutes away, as well as the MBTA & bus routes, providing the option to stay local or get out on the town. Global Luxury Suites Cambridge offers spacious apartments in a luxury building, featuring upscale amenities.

Other things to note
Please see house rules.
Please note, all guests are required to wear a mask in all non-private areas at all times. This means the moment you open your unit door to leave, and up to the moment you close the door, after entering.

At Churchill Living, your wellbeing is our top priority, therefore, we are following the CDC guidelines to ensure your safety. All apartments are thoroughly cleaned after each resident has checked out and before another guest checks
host_location: New York, New York, United States
host_about:
We have been providing vacation rental apartments for over 10 years across the East Coast. We are known for our distinctively furnished apartments in popular locations, and for our attentive service. You’ll find that our rates are quite reasonable. If you're looking for a safe, comfortable place with fabulous amenities and Wi-Fi (we know you need the Wi-Fi!) in the Boston MA area, Washington DC, Miami FL or very close to NYC in Jersey City or Hoboken, we'd love to host you. Many of the buildings where our apartments are located feature amenities such as beautiful lobbies, 24 hour front desk staff, fitness centers, business centers, recreation rooms, indoor or outdoor pools and whirlpools. If you are traveling with children, some buildings offer playgrounds (many buildings are near public playgrounds as well) or indoor playrooms. Depending on the location, you can stay for just a few days, a week, a month or more. 

We offer an assortment of short-term apartments in sizes ranging from a studio to three bedrooms that are fully furnished with all the comforts of home. Our local staff meticulously prepares your apartment before your arrival, and we offer 24 hour assistance for any emergencies after business hours. When you arrive at your apartment, the beds will be made, towels and bath amenities will be stocked in the bathrooms, and the coffee maker will be set up in the kitchen with some sample coffees, sweetener and creamer (teabags too if that is your preference) to start your morning off properly. If you’d like to cook a meal, the kitchen is stocked with dishes, cutlery, glassware and pots and pans. The living room is set up with a TV and cable channels, and the Wi-Fi router password and instructions will be prominently displayed so you can get connected quickly. You can also make local and toll-free phone calls at no charge. 

Please contact us to confirm the exact availability of the apartment you are interested in. We’d love to host you (and your family) for your vacation or business trip.

neighborhood_overview:
Cambridge has a very unique sense of community. Filled with students, young professionals, and families alike, Cambridge boasts a unique mix of people from all backgrounds.

Central and Kendall Square, as well as Harvard Square bost great shopping and restaurants, and well as great museums and cultural attractions. But go down some of the side streets and you can feel a quieter suburban living. It's the best of both worlds!
host_about:
At SplitSpot, we specialize in medium- and long-term bedroom rentals. We are a little different than your typical AirBnb listing, because we do everything we can to keep the costs as low as possible, so you can customize your living experience to what is most important to you.

What's Included:
 - the bedroom
 - access to all common areas in the apartment
 - if it is a furnished apartment, then use of that furniture
 - WiFi

What's Not Included:
 - home goods (sheets, towels, toilet paper, etc.)
 - utilities (they are based on usage, then divided up equally between all roommates)

name: Luxury 1 Bedroom Apartment Near MIT/Harvard
description:
This apartment is professionally managed by Furnished Quarters, the largest independently owned and operated supplier of short-term furnished housing with over 20 years of experience in the industry. The contemporary mid-rise building, just one block from the MIT/Kendall Square Red Line T stop, boasts amenities such as concierge service, a game room, a conference room, a 24-hour fitness center with yoga room and childrens play area, a heated indoor swimming pool, a media room, a private courtyard with grilling areas, on-site Zipcar vehicles and more. The surrounding Kendall Square area is a college, tech-centered neighborhood near the Charles River, Harvard University and MIT. Easily travel the rest of the city and metro area by walking to one of four T stations serving the Green, Red, Orange and Blue lines, in addition to two bus stations and the Boston North Amtrak Station.

The space
This thoughtfully designed one-bedroom apartment in Kendall Square, Cambridge
neighborhood_overview: Cambridge, Massachusetts is a charming, diverse city adjacent to Boston with beautiful views of the Charles River. A college town home to Harvard University and MIT, Cambridge is on the cutting edge of education, research and development. Over 100 of the world's total Nobel Prize winners have at some point been affiliated with universities located in Cambridge.
host_location: New York, New York, United States
host_about:
I work for Furnished Quarters, the largest provider of furnished apartments in the Northeast. My family started this business over 20 years ago and we welcome the opportunity to host you in our apartments. 

Guests can expect a comfortable, fully furnished and equipped private apartment, plenty of helpful neighborhood information and 24-hour access to our team. We consider ourselves first and foremost a hospitality company and we are here to provide a worry-free stay that enables you to enjoy the city and feel like a local from the moment you arrive.

name: 1 Bedroom Walking Distance to MIT/Harvard, Cambridge Views
description:
This apartment is professionally managed by Furnished Quarters, the largest independently owned and operated supplier of short-term furnished housing with over 20 years of experience in the industry. The luxury high-rise building is found in the University Park neighborhood of Cambridge, within walking distance of the MIT and Harvard campuses. The area contains office and laboratory buildings, several biotechnology companies, residential developments, retail areas, parks, open space and public art installations. The pet-friendly building boasts amenities such as a 24-hour front desk, beautifully landscaped grounds, a catering kitchen and entertainment dining room, a community garden, a conference room, a resident lounge, a fitness center and yoga studio, a grilling area and an outdoor terrace/deck. Get to Harvard University or Boston with ease by walking 10-20 minutes to the Red Line at either the Central or Kendall/MIT T station.

name: Spacious Central Square Studio w/ Doorman, near T Stop, by Blueground(BOS311)
description:
Feel at home wherever you choose to live with Blueground. You’ll love this cheery Central Square furnished studio apartment with its modern decor, fully equipped kitchen, and exquisite living room with great views. Ideally located, you’re close to all the best that Cambridge has to offer! (#BOS311)

The space
Gorgeous furniture, fully-equipped kitchen, smart TV, and a premium wireless speaker are just a few of the amenities you’ll find inside this studio apartment. Ideally located in Cambridge, you’ll find a lot to love outside as well. When you’re ready to relax, you’ll be happy to discover every Blueground bedroom comes with superior quality mattresses, luxury linens, and cozy towels. We handle everything so you can simply show up and start living.


Amenities

Building amenities unique to this studio apartment include an on-site:

- Doorman
- 24/7 Security
- In-Building Laundry
- Indoor Parking
- Roof D
neighborhood_overview: This furnished apartment is located in Central Square, Cambridge, which is centered on the junction of Massachusetts Avenue, Prospect Street and Western Avenue. The diverse area is well known for its wide variety of ethnic restaurants, bars, live music and theatre venues. Many startups have moved research and office operations into the Square to take advantage of the relatively low costs and the proximity to MIT. Nearly demolished in the 1950’s, the neighborhood was spared and went so far as to experience a sort of renaissance. In 2012, the state of Massachusetts designated Central Square as an official Cultural District.
host_location: New York, New York, United States
host_about:
Why take a chance picking & choosing between so many individual hosts when you can enjoy the highest-quality guest experience from one consistent host -- Blueground. We are a global real estate tech company offering +3500 fully-equipped & furnished apartments for a month, a year or longer across 12 cities and 3 continents. Centrally-based in vibrant neighborhoods, each home is tech-powered & furnished by our expert Interior Design teams. Enjoy at-home amenities like high-speed WiFi, a fully-stocked kitchen, smart TV, premium bedding/towels, quality toiletries, and depending on the apartment choice -- artisan coffee, bluetooth speakers & select building amenities such as pools, gyms & outdoor spaces. From meal, wine & grocery delivery to laundry & dry-cleaning right to your door, our guests can choose from a number of service benefits. Each apartment is safe & professionally sanitized.

During your stay
Driven by a mission to help you show up & start living, Blueground is proud to host thousands of guests around the world in the following cities: New York, Los Angeles, San Francisco, Boston, Chicago, Washington D.C., Seattle, Dubai, Istanbul, Paris, London and Athens.
Upon arrival, you’ll either be greeted personally by a Blueground team member or given self check-in instructions. The entire apartment is yours to enjoy; and for additional support, our Client Experience team is available via phone, email & our Guest App through which you can schedule additional cleanings, request fresh towels/linens, submit maintenance requests, and view neighborhood recommendations. We’ll share all details upon confirmation of your stay.

neighborhood_overview: This furnished apartment is located in Central Square, Cambridge, which is centered on the junction of Massachusetts Avenue, Prospect Street and Western Avenue. Many startups have moved research and office operations into the Square to take advantage of the relatively low costs and the proximity to MIT. In 2012, the state of Massachusetts designated Central Square as an official Cultural District.

name: Private entrance, tranquil, minutes to Harvard/MIT
description:
This spacious garden level 1 bedroom 1 bath guest suite is all yours to enjoy and call home for your visit. Private entrance through a tranquil garden area. The suite is nestled behind an old mansion and surrounded by greens. It is 5 minute walk to Wholefoods and 7 minute walk to Central T. It is right at the heart of Harvard and MIT, both within short distance. Charles River is only short run away.

Guest access
Entire Apt is for guests.
neighborhood_overview: Central Square is truly the center of everything that's happening in Cambridge. Located right in between Harvard Square and Kendall Square (MIT), it's walking distance to both institutions and all the research centers in the area. I used to bike from Harvard to MIT when I was a student, a very pleasant 15 minute ride. Harvard Street is just two streets north of Massachusetts Avenue, which is the main street that connects these school and also directly leads to downtown. A simple Google search shows that there're more than twenty 4-Star+ coffee shops and countless 4-Star+ restaurants, you can walk to restaurants, coffee shops, grocery stores, universities, just about everywhere.
host_about:
A world traveler trapped inside a body of an entrepreneur who wants to make the world a better place to live. This career path gave me the freedom to control my time and hence I was able to travel internationally at least a few times a year, I've been to over 15 countries across four continents, the pace's just too slow. I love staying at Airbnb to get local tips, make new friends, and as a way for me to enrich my global experience without physically traveling there, I want to become a host as well. Boston is a tourist destination for many reasons, and in Cambridge, I meet many intelligent, fun, and creative people all around the world. I hope to be a host and local guide for those who visiting Cambridge and Boston. 

My No.1 recommendation of a Must-watch movie: "Good Will Hunting". If you are coming to Boston/Cambridge, please do watch that movie, it will add some color to your Boston experience.

neighborhood_overview:
Neighborhood: Harvard Square is a triangular plaza at the intersection of Massachusetts Avenue, Brattle Street, and John F. Kennedy Street, near the center of Cambridge, Massachusetts, United States. The term "Harvard Square" is also used to delineate the business district and Harvard University surrounding that intersection, which is the historic center of Cambridge.[2] Adjacent to Harvard Yard, the historic heart of Harvard University,[3] the Square (as it is sometimes called locally) functions as a commercial center for Harvard students, as well as residents of western Cambridge and the western and northern neighborhoods and inner suburbs of Boston. These residents use the Harvard station, a major MBTA Red Line subway and bus transportation hub.

In an extended sense, the name "Harvard Square" can also refer to the entire neighborhood surrounding this intersection for several blocks in each direction. The nearby Cambridge Common has become a park area with a playground, ba

neighborhood_overview: This furnished apartment is located in Porter Square, Cambridge near the intersection of Somerville and Massachusetts Avenue. The area is always buzzing with activity and offers a wide range of goods and services such as coffee shops, supermarkets and gyms. There are more unique options as well though like a Japantown mall and a live music venue. Widely known for having a diverse restaurant scene, people flock from all over to have a meal here. Full of students and young professionals, Porter Square is easily reached via the MBTA Red Line and the Commuter Rail. Originally named for Porter’s Hotel which use to be the center of the square, Porter Square has evolved into an area offering something for everyone.

neighborhood_overview: This furnished apartment is located in Central Square, Cambridge, which is centered on the junction of Massachusetts Avenue, Prospect Street and Western Avenue. The diverse area is well known for its wide variety of ethnic restaurants, bars, live music and theatre venues. Many startups have moved research and office operations into the Square to take advantage of the relatively low costs and the proximity to MIT. Nearly demolished in the 1950’s, the neighborhood was spared and went so far as to experience a sort of renaissance. In 2012, the state of Massachusetts designated Central Square as an official Cultural District.

name: Entire private studio suite in Harvard/MIT
description:
Come enjoy this newly renovated studio suite in between Harvard Square and Central Square! A 7 minute walk to the Central Square T, 5 min walk to Whole Foods, and 10 min walk to Harvard Campus. Features a fully equipped kitchen and private entrance. Beautiful tiled bathroom makes you feel clean just walking in. This is a great space for some personal place to study, visit Harvard/MIT, explore Boston, or just enjoy what New England has to offer.

Guest access
The entire apt is exclusively reserved for the guests.
neighborhood_overview: Central Square is truly the center of everything that's happening in Cambridge. Located right in between Harvard Square and Kendall Square (MIT), it's walking distance to both institutions and all the research centers in the area. I used to bike from Harvard to MIT when I was a student, a very pleasant 15 minute ride. Harvard Street is just two streets north of Massachusetts Avenue, which is the main street that connects these school and also directly leads to downtown. A simple Google search shows that there're more than twenty 4-Star+ coffee shops and countless 4-Star+ restaurants, you can walk to restaurants, coffee shops, grocery stores, universities, just about everywhere.
host_about:
A world traveler trapped inside a body of an entrepreneur who wants to make the world a better place to live. This career path gave me the freedom to control my time and hence I was able to travel internationally at least a few times a year, I've been to over 15 countries across four continents, the pace's just too slow. I love staying at Airbnb to get local tips, make new friends, and as a way for me to enrich my global experience without physically traveling there, I want to become a host as well. Boston is a tourist destination for many reasons, and in Cambridge, I meet many intelligent, fun, and creative people all around the world. I hope to be a host and local guide for those who visiting Cambridge and Boston. 

My No.1 recommendation of a Must-watch movie: "Good Will Hunting". If you are coming to Boston/Cambridge, please do watch that movie, it will add some color to your Boston experience.

name: Central Square - Between Harvard & MIT
description:
On a quiet residential street, two blocks away from Central Square and the MBTA (subway and busses).

Apt is close to Harvard, MIT, public transportation, bars, restaurants, coffeehouses, grocery stores.

Apt is far enough back from Mass Ave that it feels like a neighborhood, but close enough that you're minutes away from the action.

A good place for students, solo adventurers and business travelers.

The space
Room:
- This private bedroom is on the 2nd floor (other 2 bedrooms on 3rd floor).
- 2 windows, 1 closet, hardwood floor.
- Lots of natural light.
- Queen sized bed (with bed-frame), wardrobe, 2 desks, desk lamp, chairs, side table, floor lamps, blackout curtains.
- Area: 156 ft² (12 x 13 foot).

Apt:
- This is a duplex style house, we have the 2nd and 3rd floor.

- Skylights in the kitchen and bathroom provide great natural light.

host_about:
A world traveler trapped inside a body of an entrepreneur who wants to make the world a better place to live. This career path gave me the freedom to control my time and hence I was able to travel internationally at least a few times a year, I've been to over 15 countries across four continents, the pace's just too slow. I love staying at Airbnb to get local tips, make new friends, and as a way for me to enrich my global experience without physically traveling there, I want to become a host as well. Boston is a tourist destination for many reasons, and in Cambridge, I meet many intelligent, fun, and creative people all around the world. I hope to be a host and local guide for those who visiting Cambridge and Boston. 

My No.1 recommendation of a Must-watch movie: "Good Will Hunting". If you are coming to Boston/Cambridge, please do watch that movie, it will add some color to your Boston experience.

name: Cambridge Central Square Apartment by Harvard, MIT
description:
This apartment is located just steps from Central Square Cambridge, with its restaurants, bars, shops (CVS, Target, H-Mart, thrift stores, etc.), metro, and bus stops. A Wholefoods, a local brewery (Lamplighter), and a park are just 2 minutes away. The Boston city center is reachable by metro in under 15 minutes. The apartment is fully furnished and has a separate bedroom, living room, bathroom, and fully equipped kitchen.

We are a COVID-FREE household and have been doing testing regularly.

The space
The bedroom has a king-sized bed with a comfy luxury mattress. The kitchen is equipped with stovetop and oven, microwave, baking gear, wine glasses, pots, pans, etc. The living room has a romantic mock fireplace, a large dining table suitable for work (there is high-speed internet, we also have a monitor you can use, and a proper ergonomic desk chair), a large selection of puzzles and games. name: Backyard Niche
description:
Backyard studio "She Shed"open to all who appreciate a cozy and well designed space. Created for comfort and ease, private and separate from the two family home on the property. Whether you are traveling for work, visiting, or need an alternative to staying at home during these challenging times, this is a lovely option. A 5min. walk to the Davis squ. T and cafes/restaurants. Located in a quiet residential neighborhood outside of Porter square.

The space
Newly renovated with radiant heat and a new bath. Make your own coffee in the small area that hosts a mini fridge, electric tea pot and dishes. Feel at home seated at the table that serves as a meal space or work space. Relax in a cozy armchair in front of an electric fireplace. Sleep well in a queen size bed using all organic linens. Though we are eco-friendly in our practices, we are using a sanitizer to disinfect and insure the highest level of COVID-19 standards for safety.
neighborhood_overview: Quiet, safe residential neighborhood.  Located just a mile from Danahey Park and Fresh Pond Reservoir. A 5 min. walk to Pemberton Farms Market.  An overall  great location for walking or biking.

host_about: Hi, we're Heather, Samantha, and Brian!  We work on the Boston team at the Remedy Homes Network.  We're a provider of short term housing for the world renowned Boston Hospital industry, and also provide corporate stays and relocation.  We're a small team here in the city, but we have big goals!  For every stay we book we donate 10% of proceeds to Non-Profits that help patients and their friends and families find furnished accommodations across our network.  We thank you for choosing us, and look forward to hosting you!
